loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
The parents of Roland, always dreamed that their children would move to cities with better opportunities for work, that is why a year ago he and his younger brother decided to leave their native town of Ayaviri and relocate to the city of Juliaca. These young entrepreneurs now live in a room located in the city and they began with their business offering calling services, in the beginning they only worked with one рhone but now they have 6 and work with other unemployed men. The desire of Roland is to make shirts, for this he has acquired two sewing machines but still needs capital to acquire raw material.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Los padres de Ronald, siempre soñaron con que sus hijos emigren a ciudades con mayores oportunidades de trabajo, es así que él y su menor hermano hace más de 1 año decidieron salir de su pueblo natal Ayaviri y radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca.Estos jóvenes emprendedores actualmente viven en una habitación alquilada de dicha ciudad e iniciaron con el negocio de brindar servicios de llamadas móviles, en un principio trabajaron sólo con un celular pero ahora ya cuentan con seis con los que brindan trabajo a otros muchachos desempleados.El deseo de Ronald es confeccionar poleras y camisetas, para ello ya adquirió sus dos máquinas de coser pero aún le falta capital para adquirir materia prima, con ese fin recurre a sus solidarios corazones, con la esperanza de recibir pronta respuesta favorable.

loans.use: capital to acquire raw material

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es:
In the house where I live, we have started to construct an additional room.  Given that these houses are very small, and as you can tell, I only need to lay concrete and install doors and windows, I am requesting a loan of $700.  I will then be able to finish constructing this additional room.Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer
En la casa donde vivo ya habíamos empezado a construir un cuarto más; dado que estas casas son muy pequeñas y como podrán notar, solo le falta la colocación de losa, puertas y ventanas, solicito préstamo de $700.00 dll. Y así poder terminar de construir este cuarto más.

loans.use: To lay concrete and install doors and windows

loans.name: Yaqoub Allah

texts.en:
Yaqoub A. is married. He lives in Kamari, an area that is 30 minutes from Kabul. People of that area are always busy in agriculture; Yaqoub is the same. He was in Pakistan during the war in Kabul but when he came back to Kabul, he started again from begging. Now his life is good but he needs some money to do his business well.

He has requested an individual loan with a term of 18 months to complete his stock and start working on his land to get some of his land ready for cultivation of wheat to sell at the bazaar and get good benefit to help his family and make a good future for his children. He wants to enroll them in a better education. He loves to see his children in school because Yaqoub is an uneducated man.

He would love to grow his business in the future and make a good business. He wishes to have a retail shop in the future. He is happy with this process of loans. He would like to thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To complete his stock and start working his land

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es: Don Leonel tiene 43 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, su esposa trabaja en un comedor como cocinera, tiene tres hijos de 2, 9 y 13 años de edad,  los cuales están cursando la primaria. El Sr. Leonel es responsable de cobrar las ordenes de comida a los clientes ya que él trabaja en un restaurante, en el cual lleva nueve años laborando, aunque es un trabajo cansado pero le genera buenas propinas ya que trabaja desde horas muy tempranas hasta las diez de la noche. La solicitud de préstamo es para hacer mejoras en su vivienda, en la construcción de un muro para el cual necesita comprar piedras, arena, cemento y hierro. A largo plazo es poder seguir haciendo mejoras en su vivienda para su familia , poder ayudar a sus hijos que no le falte nada y también tener la oportunidad de prepararlos con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Don Leonel is 43 years old, he lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. His wife is employed at a canteen as a cook. They have 3 children who are 2, 9 and 13 years old who are in elementary school. Mr. Leonel is responsible of charging for the meal orders from the clients at the restaurant where he has worked for the past 9 years. Although it's a exhausting job, he gets good tips because he works from very early hours to ten o'clock at night.

He will use the loan to do improvements to his house. He plans to build a wall, so he needs to buy stones, sand, cement and iron. In the long term, he plans to keep on doing improvements his house for his family, he doesn't want his children to lack anything and also he wants them to have the opportunity to go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start the construction of a wall for his house.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Miss Sokha S., 29, is single and lives with her widowed mother (who is shown in the picture with her). She has three brothers, one of whom is married and lives outside the family home, and the other one is a construction worker. The family lives along national road number one, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Miss Sokha has been a garment factory worker for twelve years. She also sells clothes in her factory as well when she is free from her work. Now, she is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to resell both at her factory and through her mother at home.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rom

texts.en: Mrs. Rom P. is a villager in Lvear Sor Kandal village in Kandal Province. She is 50 years old and the mother of seven children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, one is a motor repairer while the other four are attending the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Tang Tork, are farmers. They own a small piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. However, their fields do not have an irrigation system nearly. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Rom P. request a loan to buy a pump to support her fields. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a pump to support their fields.

loans.name: Rudy Baldomero

texts.es: El Señor Rudy Mejía de 20 años de edad,  casado de oficios Comerciante, “Confección de Playeras Típicas” cuenta con un taller de 4 Maquinas,  habita conjuntamente con su esposa y un hijo, cuentan con tres empleados para la misma actividad, desde su niñez se dedicaba en la Artesanía gracias a los  conocimientos que sus padres le dieron y con los préstamos  a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en el Paraje Chisay del Cantón Nimapa del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala. Donde ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima y activo para dicha artesanía para facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda a su clientela y así poder darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Rudy Mejía is 20 years old and makes traditional woven shoes. He lives with his wife and son. He has a workshop with 4 machines, and has three employees. Since his childhood, he has worked with crafts thanks to the knowledge his parents gave him. With the loans, he will be able to take his family forward. In his home in Paraje Chisay in Cantón Nimapa in the municipality and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala, he is a well-known person. He is requesting a loan from Asociación Asdir so that he can buy raw materials and assets for his craft so that he can provide far and meet the demand of his clients. In this way, he will be able to improve his family’s life.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (To increase capital)

loans.name: Melania

texts.es:
La señora Melania Rodríguez D. V., tiene 56 años D. edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Bendecidas  II y vive en el distrito El  Porvenir D. la provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta tercer el grado D. primaria, pero ya no pudo continuar estudiando porque no tenia apoyo paterno.  Se casó D. 25 años y tiene 3 hijas y un hijo, dos hijas dependen D. ella porque son estudiantes.
Melania venD. fruta D. manera ambulante, pero su inversión más granD. está en sus aves, cria y venD. pichones y palomitas.
Con el primer crédito D. S/. 300 que fue cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró fruta y alimento para aves.
Con este crédito D. S/. 200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en alimento para aves.
Melania sueña con ver profesionales a sus hijos.

Fecha D. desembolso del último crédito: 17 D. diciembre D. 2008.
Tasa D. interés mensual:  3,50 %.
texts.en:
Melania Rodríguez D. V., 56 years old, is a member of the Mujeres Bendecidas II communal bank and lives in the El Provenir district, Trujillo province, La Libertad Department in Peru. She studied until the 3rd graD., but couldn't continue because she didn't have parental support. She got married at 25 years old and has 3 daughters and one son. Two of her daughters are dependent upon her because they are students. Melania street vendor that sells fruit, but her main business is dealing with her birds; she raises and sells young pigeons and doves. With her first loan of 300 Nuevo Soles, which was repaid in 4 months, she purchased fruit and bird feed. With this loan of 200 Nuevo Soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in bird feed. Melania dreams of seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bird feed.

loans.name: Silvino

texts.es: En esta ocasión el Sr. O. se ha acercado con el único propósito de ayudar a una de sus hijas, anteriormente ha obtenido con nosotros créditos para mejorar su casa pero desafortunadamente no puede continuar con sus proyectos en este instante, su prioridad es la salud de su hija, necesita de gran apoyo para poder cubrir los gasto que están surgiendo; la enfermedad que su hija padece es diabetes y ya tiene complicaciones de tipo renal. Su ayuda es urgente, muchas gracias.
texts.en:
On this occasion Mr. O.' only purpose is to help one of his daughters. Previously he has obtained loans with us to improve his dwelling, but unfortunately he cannot continue with his projects for the time being. His priority is his daughter's health, she needs much support in order to cover the costs related to her illness. She has diabetes with kidney complications. Your support is urgent. Thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Daughter's medical expenses

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Su espíritu emprendedor ha permitido que Esther sea una madre ejemplar para sus dos hijos de diecinueve y veintidós años. Ella cuenta que empezó a trabajar desde los trece años. Siempre vendiendo diversas cosas, en tiendas o en puestos ambulantes. No obstante, en sus tiempos libres ella gustaba del tejido de lana y confeccionaba prendas pequeñas. No fue sino hasta que tejió una chompa grande para adulto que la gente empezó a apreciar su arte.

Poco a poco los pedidos han ido incrementando, pero también su visión de negocio, es por ello que gozando de sus habilidades también vende tamales los fines de semana en las mañanas. Esta fue una de sus primeras labres que hoy en día, gracias a su empeño y buen sabor, continúa desde hace veintitrés años.

Como madre y padre de sus hijos sus únicos planes para el futuro se basan con la idea de ver a sus hijos estudiar una carrera. Por ahora, estaba averiguando cuando le cuesta abrir una fuente de soda en su misma casa.
texts.en:
Esther's enterprising spirit has allowed her to be an exemplary mother for her two children of ages 19 and 22. She says that she began to work at age 13. She was always selling different things in stores or in traveling stands. However, in her free time she liked to knit with wool and make little clothing garments. It wasn't until she knit a big sweater for an adult that the people began to appreciate her art.

Little by little the orders were increasing, but in her business vision, she also wanted to enjoy her cooking abilities by selling tamales in the mornings on weekends. This was one of her first jobs, and thanks to her determination and good taste, she continues to do this business after 23 years.

As a mother and father of two children, their only plans for the future are based in the dream of seeing their kids study for a career. For now, they are ascertaining the funds to open a soda shop in their home.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool

loans.name: Korng

texts.en: Korng S., 47, is a widow who lives with her two children in the Kampong Cham province. She grows and sells yams and makes US$6 every day. She is also supported by her two children who operate motor-taxi services. Mrs. Korng S. would like to take out a loan to purchase yams from farmers and resell them to market retailers.

loans.use: to purchase yams to resell

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a tailor and she also sells clothes to her customers. She is 29 years old and married with a child.

She needs a loan of N40,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: Purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Benadetha

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Benadetha M. from Mwanza. Benadetha has been running a tailoring business since 2007. Her business is to make and sell clothes. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Benadetha currently earns about US $240 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US $400 in order to buy a sewing machine, vitenge (African traditional clothes) and thread. In the future, she plans to open another business. Benadetha thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, vitenge (African traditional clothes) and thread

loans.name: Djumagul

texts.ru:
Джумъагул Азиммуродова родилась в 1979 году в Шахристанском районе кишлака Шахристан.Она уже более 13 лет занимается животноводством. Дома имеет 7 голов крупнорогатого скота, откоромом и продажей которых и занимается Джумъагул.
 Она очень трудолюбивая женщина и дополнительно занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур, для того чтобы прокормить семью.
 Она нуждается в займе в размере 800 сомони на 6 месяцев для откорма скота.
Джумъагул замужем и имеет 2 детей. На снимке Джумъагул со своей младшей дочкой.
texts.en:
Djumagul A. was born in 1979 in the region of Shahristan village. She has been in the animal husbandry business for more than thirteen years. She has seven heads of large cattle at home which she feeds and sells. She is a very hardworking woman and she additionally grows some vegetables to feed the family. She needs a loan of 800 somoni ($225USD) for a term of six months for raising and feeding the cattle. Djumagul is married and has two children. Djumagul is with her younger daughter on the photo.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling cattle

loans.name: Omar

texts.fr: OMAR L. EST UN TAILLEUR BIEN CONNU DANS LE QUARTIER DE YOFF.SON EXPERIENCE DANS LE METIER FAIT QUE SACLIENTELE S'ACCROIT DE JOUR EN JOUR.PAR CONSEQUENT LE CREDIT QUI LUI EST ACCORDE LUI PERMETTRA D'INVESTIR POUR AFIN DE MIEUX REPONDRE AUX EXIGENCE DE SA CLIENTELE.
texts.en:
Omar L. is a well-known tailor in the Yoff district. His experience in this trade has resulted in his customers growing in number day after day. Consequently, the loan granted to him will enable him to invest, so as to respond to the demands of his customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Jeremy

texts.en:
Jeremy is a former ambulance driver and a high-energy entrepreneur.  He runs Emergency BBQ, a mobile catering company that serves up barbecue favorites in a style Jeremy calls California Beer B-Que.  Jeremy is ready to take his business to the next level.
With this loan, Jeremy will expand his business beyond on-the-go catering trucks and open up a retail store in San Carlos. He will be able to cater a greater number of lunch and dinner events from his shop, as well as serve lunch to local workers in San Mateo. He will also be able to create full-time employment for his three seasonal employees.
Visit http://www.emergencybbq.com
Watch a video of Jeremy at: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T6g4dz3r_yo&feature=channel_page

loans.use: to buy furnishings and cooking equipment for his business.

loans.name: Kudzo

texts.fr: Kudzo A. est âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est distillateur de « sodabi » à Womé, un village situé au sud-ouest du Togo. « Sodabi » est une liqueur locale qui est obtenu à partir du vin de palme. Avec ce crédit, Kudzo souhaite acheter des palmiers et des outils de travail pour élargir sa capacité de production. La vue a été prise à coté de son atelier. Il a acquis cette moto pour mieux faire ses courses
texts.en:
Kudzo A., age 32, is married and the father of two. He is a distiller of sodabi in Womé, a village located in southwest Togo. Sodabi is a local spirit which is obtained from palm wine. With this loan, Kudzo wishes to buy palm trees and some work tools to expand his production capacity. The photo was taken next to his workshop. He acquired this motorbike for making his runs easier.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm trees and work tools

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma manages a hog-raising business as her source of income. She admitted that their business brings them lots of financial support, especially needed during the enrollments and exams of their three children who are: Mighto, Angela Joi and Precious Lea. Gemma, together with her supportive husband Leo Taganguin, are doing their best to give their children an education that will serve as their key towards a better future. Two of her children are still in elementary level while the eldest has already graduated from college.

Gemma is now asking Kiva to lend her PHP 12,000 as additional capital to finance the feed supply needed by her pigs. She is happy that her business remains strong though sometimes she also experiences financial crises. She said that she is just patient and hardworking and that’s why she is managing her family well, and the same with her business. She hopes that through the blessings of the Lord, her good family relationships will last a long time.

loans.use: To finance the feed supply needed by her pigs

loans.name: Ana Consuelo

texts.en:
Señora Ana is pictured here with the oldest of her two children.  She is a 32-year-old single mother and has a business selling cooked food in the evenings from the front porch of her home.  Ana lives in the city of Pucallpa.

Ana has been working with Manuela Ramos, a Kiva field partner, for about two years. She belongs to the "Las Romanticas II" communal bank. Ana used her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to purchase food for her restaurant business and also to purchase shoes which she sells to Pucallpa's prison.  Ana is currently requesting a loan of 1500 soles which she plans to invest in food for her restaurant as well as in beauty products, clothing, and sandals to sell. All of these investments will help her to continue to develop in the microbusiness environment.

Ana is grateful to Manuela Ramos for her loans and for the business education sessions she receives from the organization's loan officers at her communal bank's monthly meetings.

loans.use: Food for restaurant business and beauty products, sandals and clothing to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn P. runs a sari-sari (variety) retail store selling a variety of different products in her community. She also buys and sells green bananas and sweet potatoes in the local market. She is 30 years old, married and has four very young children. They are from the village of Barangay 3, Talakag, Bukidnon. Jocelyn has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children and supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To  purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 46 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 6 hijos y no ha tenido la oportunidad de estudiar., vive en el sector Mamani.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ganado menor como chanchos. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra ganado menor como chancho y ovino para engorde.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan las reuniones,  y las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Victoria is an associate of the communal bank “Manuela de Hoy II” which is located in the community of Camicachi in the district of Ilave, part of the El Collao province in the department of Puno. She is 46 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. She has not had the opportunity to study. She lives in the Mamani sector. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 3 years. Her inital loan was 300.00 nuevos soles which she used to buy small livestock such as pigs. At the moment she requires a loan of 600.00 Nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of small livestock like pigs and sheep to fatten up. Her desire is to continue working. She likes the meetings and the ease of access to loans with Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep and pigs

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya S., 25, currently in the business of selling beer at the bar and requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer, is married to a peasant and is the mother of three children, all attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children and provide them with scholastic materials.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase textiles.

loans.name: Fatoumata Sidi

texts.fr:
Madame  Fatoumata Sidi M.  est âgée  de 39 ans et  vit avec son mari et ses  5  enfants  et d’autres ménages dans sa belle famille dans le quartier Hamdallaye A de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir abandonné l’école en classe de 7ème (système éducatif Malien) elle commença les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère qui vendait des poissons séchés et  fumés au marché de Gao. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à côté de cette dernière et ayant bien maîtriser les rouages du petit commerce, elle décide d’évoluer en solo en optant pour le commerce de poissons séchés. Elle mène cette activité depuis maintenant  7 ans et jouit d’une grande réputation et notoriété au niveau de Ségou. 
Dans le souci de faire face à la demande de sa clientèle et de réaliser plus de bénéfices, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette institution depuis plus 1 an. Après  un 1er prêt individuel bien remboursé, elle est à son  2ème qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 80 kg de poissons séchés (Wulu Djèkè c'est-à-dire Poisson Chien). Elle s’approvisionne sur place auprès des grossistes. Madame Fatoumata Sidi M. vend  au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales et de participer à des événements sociaux (mariage, baptême etc.). 
Son ambition est de construire une maison à usage d’habitation à Ségou.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Sidi Maiga is 39 years old and lives with her husband, their 5 children and members of her family in-laws. They live in the Hamdallaya district in the city of Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After leaving school in 7th grade (Mali’s educational system) she started her business alongside her mother, selling dried and smoked fish in the Gao market. After many years of learning from her Mom and once she master the workings of a small business, she decided to go on her own selling dried fish. She has been managing her business for 7 years and she enjoys a good reputation and large client base in Segou.

In efforts to her clients’ demands and to increase her revenues, she approached Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). She has been in business with this organization for more than a year now. Following her first loan, which was successfully repaid, she is requesting a second loan in order to purchase 80 kg of dried fish (Wulu Djeke – meaning Dog Fish). She buys from wholesalers. Mrs. Fatoumata Sidi Maiga completes her sales on credit to a clientele made up of both men and women.

She hopes to generate a monthly income of 30 000 FCFA. This income will permit her to contribute with her husband towards the family’s expenses and to participate to social events (such as weddings, baptisms etc.).

Her dream is to build a residential home in Segou.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dried fish.

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.en:
Nuriddin is married and has three children. He uses his car to offer taxi services in his city and between neighboring cities as well. Nuriddin has been in this business for 9 years. Using the phone to get client’s orders, he always has plenty of clients. This business is the only source of income for his family. Nuriddin would like to borrow $1500 USD to fix his car engine. As he makes more profit, he hopes to improve his family’s living conditions. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of spare parts for repairing parts of his car.

loans.name: Santa Marta Group

texts.en:
The Santa Marta Women’s Committee was formed on the 21st of August 2008 thanks to its former Director Marcia L., who herself sells dry goods.  When Ms. L. contacted the counselor at a weekly meeting in her area to find out more about the Women’s Entrepreneurship program she brought together 15 women, all of whom have worked together ever since, and are now in their 5th loan cycle together.

The average credit drawn by each member is 680,000 Gs., which is used for different activities, such as the sale of food, dry goods, cakes and other pastries, lingerie, beverages, cosmetics, clothes, candy, and the cultivation and sale of pigs, etc.

All of them perform fundraising activities, help each other reach their common goals of growing their business and repaying their loans on time.

They actively participate in weekly meetings and have impeccable work solidarity.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Carlos Roberto

texts.es:
el señor Carlos Roberto E. tiene 25 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene una hija de 03 años, su pàreja es ama de casa. Carlos tiene su taller de mecanica en donde repara motores, hojas de resorte, frenos, mantenimientos y mucho mas para vehiculos livianos y pesados.
 
esta solicitando el prestamo para compra de una gata, caja de herramientas, aceite, filtros y repuestos para carros.
en esta epoca de navidad muchas personas le dan mantenimiento a sus vehiculos y esta es la oportunidad de ganarse un poco mas de dinero.
el desea darle todo lo mejor a su hija que es lo mas importante que tiene en la vida. dice que el va a trabajar toda la vida para darle lo mejor a su hijita.
texts.en:
Carlos Roberto E. is 25 years old and has a 3-year-old daughter with his common-law wife, who is a homemaker. Carlos has an automobile repair shop where he works on engines, suspensions, and brakes, and provides routine maintenance for lightweight and heavy vehicles.

He is asking for a loan to purchase a tool box, oil, filters, and replacement parts. During the Christmas season, many people want to have their cars serviced, and this presents an opportunity to earn more money.

Carlos wants to provide the very best for his daughter, and he plans to work hard his whole life to accomplish this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools, oil, filters, hoses, clamps, and spare parts

loans.name: Bayi Houévi Marie

texts.fr: H. Bayi Houévi Marie  est née le 17 Octobre 1965 à Agoué au Bénin. Marie vit depuis 8 ans à Bazoukpa, non loin de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à HOUENOU Léopold, un commerçant, Marie est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Marie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Bazounkpa. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Marie a fréquenté jusqu’au cours secondaire. Depuis environs 5 ans, Marie vend des tissus et des vêtements, par le système de distribution. C’est à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Marie s’approvisionne. C’est la première fois que Marie sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit lui servira à élever le niveau de son activité pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Marie envisage plus tard ouvrir une boutique pour y vendre ses produits.
texts.en:
Bayi Houevi Marie H. was born on October 17, 1965, at Agoue, in Benin. Marie lived for 8 years in Bazoukpa, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Leopold Houenou a businessman, Marie is the mother of for school aged children. Marie lives together with her children and husband in Bazounkpa. Together, the couple support the needs of the family. Marie has attended secondary school. For the last five years Marie has sold fabrics and clothing using a door to door distribution sales system. Marie buys her supplies from Lome in Togo, a country neighboring Benin. This is the first loan Marie has requested from ALIDe. This loan will be used to increase the size of her business to better meet the needs of her clientele. In the future, Marie hopes to open a kiosk to sell her products.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 pieces of fabric

loans.name: Maria Felipina

texts.en:
Maria Felipina O. is a 39-year-old married woman from Jala-jala, Rizal. She and her husband are blessed to have five children. She is a member of the Sipsipin center in Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) Rizal East Branch. She is a very determined woman, and she notes that she works hard to better her life. Despite hardships brought about by poverty, Maria Felipina remains strong and dedicated in her pursuit to improve her family’s standard of living. The love and support of her husband makes her life quite meaningful.

To earn a living, she buys and sells rice. She has been engaged in this business for five years. She joined ASHI, a micro-finance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 1999. During the course of her membership, she has been an excellent performer with respect to her attendance at meetings, loan repayment, and projects. She is now seeking her fifth loan, this time in the amount of 40,000 PHP ($875) to purchase additional sacks of rice. She is positive that, with access to additional working capital through ASHI and Kiva, her dreams of sending her children to a university so that they can complete their college degrees will be achieved. Her desire to give her children a brighter future is what drives her each day.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional rice

loans.name: Juan Filiberto

texts.es: Juan Filiberto tiene 63 años de edad, su actividad económica es la venta de granos básicos. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio, para ofrecer a sus clientes el consumo de productos diarios. El negocio inicia por cuenta propia ya que no tenía los ingresos necesarios para proporcionarle a su familia el pan de comida diario. A pesar de lo difícil que es mantener este negocio activo Juan es un hombre que le gusta su actividad ya que él se encarga de ofrecer a sus clientes los mejores servicios. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite y golosinas. Su deseo es seguir adelante con su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Filiberto, 63, sells groceries. He has been in this line of work for over 9 years. He began this business with his own initiative because he did not have sufficient earnings to support his family. Although it is very difficult to maintain this business afloat, Juan is a man that enjoys his work and he offers his customers the very best service. The funding will be used to buy rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, sweets. His wish is to continue with his work so as to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Fousseni

texts.fr:
Né le 1er Mai 1969 à Sikasso Monsieur Fousseni Traoré est marié et père des 4 enfants. Il réside dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Kaboïla II, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Traoré après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initié à cette activité de sonorisation il y a environ 5 ans. Il dispose à la fois une discothèque et d’une salle de jeu devant le domicile, il est beaucoup  sollicité  surtout lors des cérémonies de mariage, baptême, anniversaires, etc. Cette salle de jeu est équipée en  téléviseurs avec lesquels les jeunes viennent se divertir en  jouant le Play-Station.
 Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a quelque mois avec laquelle il sollicite son premier prêt individuel pour pour une diversification de ses services en achetant, un ordinateur (pour graver les sons et images) et des DVD. Il compte acheter ses marchandises au Ghana.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born the first of May, 1969 in Sikasso, Mr. Fousseni Traoré is married and father to four children. He lives in a large, traditional family which expands to Kaboila II, the center of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Mr. Traoré, after having tried many trades without success, began work in the audiovisual trade about five years ago. He manages a discotheque and a game hall in front of his home. He is often solicited for wedding ceremonies, baptisms, birthdays, etc. The game hall is equipped with televisions with which youth come to have fun and play Play Station. With the goal of better satisfying his ever-growing clientele, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso a few months ago. He is asking for his first individual loan to diversify his services by buying a computer (to burn sounds and images) and DVDs. He plans on buying this merchandise in Ghana. He sees making a monthly profit of 200,000 FCFA with this loan which he will use to increase his commercial funds, contribute to his family's needs, pay the interest on the loan, and invest the rest in his work.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Electronic Equipment

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Señora Francisca V. tiene 57 años y está casada por más de 30 años, La señora se dedica a la producción de leche y su posterior venta a una empresa que elabora toda clases de productos lácteos, y su esposo además de ayudar con la producción de leche también se dedica a la siembra de diferentes productos en la zona de Chapare, como ser banano y palmito.

La señora Francisca  vive en la zona de Itocta en Cochabamba,  es una zona bastante alejada de la ciudad y por lo tanto para ellos es difícil acudir a los bancos en busca de préstamo por eso fue que el Cidre tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona y descubrimos que existen muchos productores de leche cruda en pequeña escala, y nos cuentan que el alimento para ganado lechero subió mucho este último mes por los diferentes problemas climáticos por los que estuvo pasando Bolivia. Por lo tanto la señora Francisca utilizara este crédito para la compra de alimento para su ganado lechero (soya y alimento balanceado) para que sus vacas no sufran de es escases de alimento, y su producción lechera no se vea afectada. 

La señora Francisca nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es continuar con la producción de leche como siempre lo hizo, ver a sus hijos y nietos tener un futuro bueno y que algún día tenga suficiente ganado para dejarles una herencia a sus hijos que les ayude en la vida. Que cada vez está más dura en el país.
texts.en:
Francisca V. is 57 years old and has been married for more than 30 years. She produces milk to sell to a company that markets a wide range of dairy products. Her husband helps her with the production of milk and also grows a variety of crops, such as bananas and hearts of palm, in the Chapare area. Francisca lives in the Itocta area of Cochabamba. As her home is far from the center of the city it is difficult for her to go to banks in search of loans. Luckily, CIDRE took the initiative to go to her area and discovered that there were many small producers of raw milk in the area who were having problems because the price of feed for milk cows had increased in the last month due to poor weather conditions in Bolivia. Therefore, Francisca will use this loan to purchase feed for her dairy cows so that they do not suffer from a lack of food and their production will not be affected. Francisca's dream is to continue producing milk as she has always done, to see her children and grandchildren have bright futures, and to one day have earned enough to be able to leave her children an inheritance that will help them in life, as conditions in her country are becoming more and more difficult.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed for dairy cows

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 42-year-old widow with four children aged between 10 and 16 years. All her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and owns a two-roomed house where she lives with four people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water and gets three meals a day.

Aisha has a poultry farm in Kisaasi counting to a round 650 chickens: 350 broilers and 300 layers. Her major business challenges are thieves and the ever-increasing prices of chicken feeds in Uganda.

Aisha works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She works seven days a week and receives an average of twenty customers a day and sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale. She incurs transport costs to and from buying poultry feeds from Mengo, Kisenyi.

Aisha has been in this business for over fifteen years and with MCDT for ten years. She joined MCDT because it was near her home and it was easy to work with.

Aisha is servicing her twenty-sixth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of chicken feeds and 100 layer chicks. She is aspiring to owning 1,500 chickens.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of chicken feeds and 100 layer chicks

loans.name: Ann Njeri

texts.en:
Ann is 32 years old and married. She sells clothes at the Westlands market in Nairobi. This market is busy and Ann has customers regularly. This has been her primary business for the last three years now.
Ann was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by an existing member. This is her first loan with KADET and she has not borrowed from other financial institutions. With this loan, she hopes to buy more stock of new clothes and grow her business substantially.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Felistus

texts.en: Felistus is a single lady.  She has been doing carpentry for six years.  Since she became a member of Faulu Kenya, she has been saving her money with a group called Masachu Ushindi. She has benefited from the group because the members guarantee each other when a member takes out a loan.  She has requested a loan of Kes. 30,000 to buy timber and cushions to make furniture. Felistus is a hardworking lady who hopes to have a big furniture store in the future.

loans.use: To buy timber and cushions

loans.name: Shakil

texts.en:
Shakil H. is a 45-year-old man who breeds sheep in the small village of Saatli city. He started in this business at a very young age and now he has a lot of permanent customers who always buy good sheep for meat production from Shakil. 

Mutton is very popular among Azerbaijani people and sheep breeding brings stable income to Shakil. He is single and lives with his parents. Shakil believes one day he could marry, and, for this purpose, he works very hard. 

He has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase more sheep and fodder. As summer is a high season for wedding parties where barbequed mutton is very popular, Shakil hopes to fatten as many sheep as possible by June.

loans.use: To purchase 12 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania F. is 44 and married with four children (ages 6 - 16).  She is starting a business, selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam).  Melania needs a loan of WST $1500 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Melania joined SPBD. This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Melania's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: La Buena Fe 5 Group

texts.en:
Marta is the coordinator of her group L. Buena Fe (The Good Faith). Her story is representative of her group and generally of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, a sleepy agricultural town where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner.

Marta is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling jewelry. She intends to use the loan capital to purchase underwear in order to expand her offerings. She will use the profits to complete construction on her home and to invest in her children's education. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase underwear to sell

loans.name: Ana Del Socorro

texts.es: Ana Del Socorro tiene 31 años, ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Pues tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este negocio, que lo inicio con el motivo de generar ingresos, esa una mujer luchadora pues se levanta muy temprano desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche que llega a su vivienda, para realizar las visitas a su clientes, siempre está pendiente de lo que ellos le solicitan por encargo. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima. Desea llegar a tener su propia tienda.
texts.en:
Ana Del Socorro is 31 years old. She sells general merchandise. She has been working in this business for 5 years. She started in order to generate more income. She is a fighter who gets up very early at 5 in the morning to visit her customers, and arrives home at 7 at night. She is always on top of what they ask her to get for them. The loan she is asking for is to purchase raw materials. She wants to have her own store one day.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
A la vivienda del la señora francisca G. le esta haciendo falta el vitropiso en el cuarto de lavado.
Solicita un préstamo ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una fábrica.
texts.en:
The floor in Mrs. Francisca G.’s laundry room needs to be tiled. She is asking for this loan because she does not have the money to buy materials or pay for the labor. She plans to repay the loan with part of the income she receives from her job as a factory worker.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a tile floor

loans.name: Jovinsol

texts.en:
Jovinsol C. is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal East, in Bayombong in the province of Nueva Vizcaya. He is 38 years old. Jovinsol is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Jovinsol owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from cultivating coconut trees and harvesting the fruit to sell. Jovinsol has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jovinsol joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovinsol has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield. Jovinsol is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jovinsol from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Glerita

texts.en: Glerita B. is from the village of Barnagay Abingnan, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 44 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Glerita owns and operates a business raising livestock for breeding. Glerita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Glerita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glerita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Glerita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and medicines. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Glerita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and medicines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional goods to sell

loans.name: Jiguisèmè Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Jiguisèmè (sont toutes mariées) avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 4 enfants, vivent dans des  familles monogames à Ouayerma II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur cinquième  prêt, tous les passés se sont bien dénoués. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de friperie, de fruits et légumes et de tasses  avec AWA K..
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, 4 douzaines de tasses. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville. Les tasses sont vendues au marché de Ouayerma et souvent de façon ambulante dans les familles à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle ambitionne d’aider son mari à construire leur maison  à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The four women of the Jiguisèmè group are married and, on average, are 33 years old with 4 children. They live in monogamous families in Ouayerma II, one of the neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy their customers’ needs. They are on their fifth loan; all previous loans have been fully repaid. They run various businesses, including selling second-hand clothing and fruits and vegetables. AWA K. sells basins. With her loan, she plans to buy 4 dozen basins. She gets her stock at the large market in Sikasso. The basins are sold at the Ouayerma market and often door-to-door or from the home to a clientele composed of men and women and mostly in cash. They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 CFA of which a part will be used for the family’s needs and the remainder will be invested in the businesses. She hopes to help her husband to build a house in which to live.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basins

loans.name: Micah

texts.en:
Micah is the treasurer of Sise Tala-Tany group which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. He is a dairy farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya, where he has been farming for three years and employs one farmhand. He sells his milk to the local market and also earns income from his small-scale farming of maize which he sells locally.

Micah is 28 years old and married with two children aged 2 and 4. His eldest child attends school.

Micah has requested this loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children and improve the livelihood of his family.

Micah would like to acquire a pure breed of dairy cows and build a dairy unit in future. His primary challenges are lack of enough animal feeds and diseases which are too costly to treat.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Santos Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo P. Santos tiene 45 anos. Vive con su hermano en el Cantón de San Pablo en la Provincia Bolívar.

Hugo es socio del grupo ¨Integracion Microempresarial¨ de San Pablo de Atenas. Son 14 socios en total, la mayoría que se dedican a diferentes actividades como comercio, negocios, y agricultores como fuente de ingreso a sus familias.

Hugo se dedica a la agricultura como fuente de ingreso a su familia. Siembra maíz y arveja. Hace las compras de sus productos en el mercado de San Pablo y vende en San Pablo también. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas. Con el apoyo del préstamo le ayudaria en incrementar mas los insumos y semillas. Su sueno es ahorrar dinero para una enfermedad que tiene. 

Le gusta asistir a los festivales de su comunidad y de todos los santos.
texts.en:
Hugo P. Santos is 45 years old and lives with his brother in the San Pablo hamlet of the Bolívar province.

Hugo is a member of the “Integracion Microempresarial” group of San Pablo de Atenas.  There are a total of 14 members, most of whom support their families through different types of merchandising, businesses, and agriculture.

Hugo relies on farming to generate income for his family.  He raises corn and peas.  He buys and sells products as the San Pablo marketplace.  He is asking for this loan in order to buy farming supplies.  This loan will give him the means to increase his supplies and seeds.  He dreams of being able to save up some money to treat an illness that he has.  He would also like to attend his community’s “all saints” festivals.

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío Quemazón del distrito de Mórrope, un distrito agrícola situado en la provincia de Lambayeque. La zona se encuentra situada aproximadamente a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de dos años a la crianza y venta de aves de corral. El cría patos, pavos y gallinas en un corral situado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuando estos han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que siempre suelen visitar la zona. Adicionalmente tiene instalada una pequeña bodega en su domicilio con la cual ayuda a sus padres en el sostenimiento de la economia de su familia.

Elmer desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mas aves y alimento balanceado con los cuales pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir un mayor numero de ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Elmer es una persona bastante trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. El desea seguir creciendo como empresario para ayudar a sus padres a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Elmer is 21 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in the Quemazón village in the district of Mórrope, an agricultural district located in the Lambayeque province.  The area is about an hour from the city of Chiclayo. 

For over two years he has raised and sold poultry.  He raises ducks, turkeys, and chickens in a corral located in the rear part of his home.  When the birds are well developed, he sells them to neighbors and salespeople who often visit the area.  He also has a small store in his home which he uses to help his parents support the family.  

Elmer would like to grow his business by acquiring more birds and balanced feed which he can use to increase sales and earn more profits.  For this reason e has decided to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 1000 new soles to help him achieve his goal.  

Elmer is a very hardworking person with a desire to succeed.  He wants to continue growing as a business owner to help his parents get ahead.

loans.use: To grow his business by purchasing more poultry and balanced feed.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta R. is a 51-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fishing business.  She lives in Purok 5, Barangay Bonawon, Siaton, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing  business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of about $290. 

Julieta is borrowing 30,000 PHP so that she can purchase fishing gear and equipment. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Julieta aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Jhoyse

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR DE COYLLORITTY CACHIMAYO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cachimayo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jhoyse; tiene 30 años de edad, y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa para niños, ella tiene un puesto en un centro comercial de la ciudad de Cusco, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 p.m  hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa de niños como pantalones, polos y chompas.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “SR DE COYLLORITTY CACHIMAYO” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cachimay, part of Anta province and the department of Cusco.

The member is Sra. Jhoyse, age 30. She is married and has 3 children. She divides her time between her daily household activities and her business selling children’s clothing. She has a stall in a commercial area in the city of Cusco. She works from 9:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. She wants to enlarge her clothing sales business.

Sra. Jhoyse is applying for the loan in order to purchase children’s clothing such as trousers, polo shirts, and sweaters. She is thankful for the loan and promises to make all her payments on time.

loans.use: In order to purchase children's clothing such as trousers, polo shirts, and sweaters.

loans.name: Omega Group

texts.fr: Ntabalikirwa A. est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Omega,  âgée de 45 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants, tous étudient confortablement. Son mari est vendeur  des sacs et sachets emballages. Elle fait le petit commerce de vente habits usagés. Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Il ya 4 ans, qu’elle est en activité. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima. Elle installe ses produits  au marché central. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir renforcer son chiffre d’affaire. En plus, elle ambitionne devenir grossiste des habits usagés.  La cliente Ntabalikirwa A. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe Omega est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: Ntabalikirwa A. is a businesswoman and president of the Omega group. She is 45 years old, married, and mother of 8 children who are all studying. Her husband sells bags and packaging. She operates a small business of selling used clothing. She started her business thanks to funds given to her by her husband, and she has now been in business for 4 years. Later on, she received a loan from the Microfinance Insitution Hekima. She sets her products up at the central market. This new loan should help her increase her turnover. Moreover, her ambition is to become a wholesaler of used clothing. The client Ntabalikirwa A. would like to thank Hekima for its support to poor people excluded from conventional banking system. It should be noted that the Omega group members are mainly women.

loans.use: 1 Bundle of Used Clothing

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor es una joven de 18 años, es el hijo menor de 4 hermanos, acaba de volver de la republica de la argentina donde estaba 3 años trabajando en una empresa de costura, pertenece a una familia de escasos recursos económicos razón por la cual no ha llegado a estudiar ni siquiera hasta el bachillerato solo ha llegado a estudiar hasta la 3 grado.

Víctor vive en la comunidad de la maica central  con la madre en una habitación que todavía no ha terminado de construirse.

Víctor en la actualidad se dedica a la producción de la leche cruda como su madre y sus hermanos, con los ahorros de su trabajo en Argentina se compró 3 cabezas de ganado lechero también trabaja de albañil con su tío que es contratista mientras la madre le cuida el ganado pero todas la mañas muy temprano va a recoger forraje para todo el día.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de otra cabeza de ganado lechero, para que de esta manera pueda incrementar la producción de la leche.
Entre sus sueños y metas es construir su propia casa, en un terreo que su madre le heredara y lo más importante, crecer en su actividad de producir leche.
texts.en:
Víctor is a young man of 18.  He is the youngest of four siblings and has just returned from Argentina where he worked for a dressmaking company for 3 years.  He belongs to a family of few economic means which means that he hasn't managed to study, even for his high school diploma.  He only studied up to third grade.

Víctor lives with his mother in Maica Central community.  He lives in a room which is still not yet fully built.

Víctor currently works producing raw milk like his mother and siblings.  With the savings he made from his work in Argentina, he bought 3 heads of dairy cattle.  He also works as a construction worker with his uncle, who is a contractor, while his mother looks after the cattle.  However, every morning Víctor goes out very early to collect fodder for the day.

Víctor will use his loan to buy another head of dairy cattle so that he can increase his milk production.  His dreams and goals are to build his own house on a plot of land that his mother will give him as an inheritance and, most importantly, grow in his milk-producing business.

loans.use: To buy a head of dairy cattle to increase his operating capital

loans.name: Sann's Group

texts.en:
Eleven people are forming this village bank loan. They are living in Chong Kaoh village in Kandal province. The members of this village loan selected Mrs. Sann S., 43 years old, as the village bank president.  The members will each use their portion of the loan for their different needs.

Mrs. Sann S. and her husband, Mr. Ing Sok, are farmers who own a 1.2-hectare piece of land which they use to cultivate rice and corn for a living. To support this farm, Mrs. Sann S. decided to ask for a loan to buy corn, rice seeds, and fertilizers. Aside from farming their own land, they also work as farm laborers to earn a little salary to support their family. 

This couple works hard to support their three children, who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy corn, rice seeds, fertilizers

loans.name: Daysi Romelia

texts.es:
Doña Daysi, tiene 42 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, vive con sus ocho hijos y la casa donde habita es de una de sus hijas, doña Daysi se dedica a costurar y venta de hamacas, sus trabajos de sastrería los realiza en su casa y consiguió trabajar en la elaboración de uniformes por parte del gobierno para la escuela, también con la ayuda de sus hijas elaboran hamacas para vender.
Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser, y otra parte para materiales para fabricar hamacas, esta ayuda le dará una mejor disposición de materiales para hacer las hamacas y la adquisición de la maquina agilizara su trabajo entregándolo en menor tiempo y con la posibilidad de que reciba ayuda de otra persona para que no solo ella se dedique a este oficio.
Sueña con tener una vivienda, que sus hijas puedan encontrar trabajo y mejorar en unión  con sus hijos la condición económica de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Daysi is 42 years old. She lives in San Francisco Gotera, departament of Morazán. She lives with her eight children and the house where she lives belongs to one of her daughters. Daysi sews and sells hammocks. She does her sewing in the house and she was able to get work from the government making school uniforms. With her daughters' help, she also makes hammocks to sell.  

She needs a loan to buy a sewing machine as well as to buy materials to make hammocks. This help will give her greater materials availability to make the hammocks, and the acquisition of the machine will facilitate her work. She will finish in less time and have the possibility of getting help from another person so she is not the only one doing this work. 

She dreams of having a store, and for her daughters to be able to find work and with her children to improve the financial condition of the whole family.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and materials to make hammocks.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jesús Del Gran Poder se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par”. Porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mercedes, ella tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 1 hijo mayor de edad, el aun viven con ella y estudia en Universidad. Su esposo se dedica al comercio, vende repuestos de bicicleta.

Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa, con la idea de generar ingresos para el bien de su familia se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y de productos naturales de la marca Garden, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y  también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes. Además de esto también se dedica a al cría de pollos.  Trabaja todos los días en todas sus actividades, sus productos los deja a crédito  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la compra en  Guayaquil una vez al mes.

Este crédito lo va a dividir  en tres partes iguales y lo va a  invertir una parte  para comprar ropa, la otra para comprar pollos para la cría y la ultima parte para el negocio del esposo. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 8 años y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos.  Sus sueños son que su hijo sea un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the Jesús del Gran Poder community bank meets in the beautiful city of Calceta.  The city is known as 'Calceta la sin par' (Calceta, the city with no equal) because, as far as its residents are concerned, there is no city more beautiful in the world.

Here we meet Mercedes.  She is 55 years old, married and has one grown-up son who still lives with her and is studying at university.  Her husband is a salesman.  He sells bicycle spare parts.

As well as being a good housewife, in order to make income for her family, Mercedes also sells all kinds of clothes and Garden-brand natural products.  She makes her sales door to door and also sells from her home where her customers come to buy from her.  In addition, she also raises chickens.  She works every day of the week in all her businesses.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil once a month.

Mercedes will divide this loan into three equal parts and invest one part in buying clothes, one part in buying chickens to raise and the last part will be for her husband's business.  Mercedes has been a member of her community bank for 8 years and she likes it because the interest rates are low.  Her dreams are for her son to become a professional.

loans.use: To buy clothes, chickens and bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret N., who lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda, is married and has seven children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of her mother. For the past two years Margret has had a used clothing business, selling her products at the market six days a week. She is now requesting a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO in order to buy more clothes.

The main business challenge Margret faces is thieves. Her immediate goal is to pay the school fees for her children. Margret lives in a home that she owns with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, transport, and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing

loans.name: Ramiro De Jesus

texts.es: Ramiro lleva varios años en la fabricación y venta de helados y bolis de fruta, esta labor le ha permitido tener una buena calidad de vida para el y su familia, es por esto que Ramiro necesita un crédito que le permita tener mayor producción de sus productos y además poder iniciar el negocios de comidas rápidas y así generar nuevos empleos y empezar a conseguir su propio local.
texts.en: Ramiro has been making and selling ice cream and frozen fruit treats for several years.  This work has enabled him to provide a good quality of life for himself and his family.  For this reason, Ramiro needs a loan so that he can increase his production.  Later on he hopes to start a fast food business so that he can create new jobs and have his own establishment.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for his ice cream business

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera P. is a widow and has one 17-year-old child. She runs a small business selling various cosmetic items such as shampoos, hair dyes, soaps, and detergents. She has been in this business for 19 years. When Vera's husband died, she had to continue the business that he initially started. She worked hard, learned a lot, and finally was able to sustain the business and even open several more locations to make this business a success. She currently has five locations that provide jobs for 10 employees.

Vera is requesting a loan for 15,000 Grivnas to increase the assortment of shampoos, hair dyes, and soaps. Her business goal is to open one more location in her town. She wants to save enough money to be able to help her daughter attend college.

loans.use: To purchase shampoos, hair dyes, and soaps

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina nació en la ciudad D. Paruro del departamento del Cusco y tiene 53 años D. edad. Actualmente,  Faustina vive en la ciudad imperial D. los Incas (Cusco, Perú), ella es una madre responsable que se dedica a la venta D. chicha D. jora, ella tiene su pequeña picantería en el populoso distrito D. San Sebastián D. la ciudad del Cusco, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar cerveza e insumos para preparar mas chicha. 

Faustina es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Ana Jarvis III” D. la Asociación Arariwa D. la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en: Faustina was born in the city of Paruro, department of Cusco, and is 53 years old. She currently lives in the Imperial City of the Incas (Cusco, Peru). She is a responsible mother who works selling chicha D. jora [traditional corn liquor]. She has a small restaurant in the popular San Sebastián district in the city of Cusco. At this time, she needs a loan to increase her working capital. She would like to buy beer and ingredients for making more chicha. Faustina is a very responsible person who belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "Ana Jarvis III" communal bank in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy beer and ingredients for preparing chicha [traditional corn liquor]

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
El señor Heriberto y su esposa la señora Elvira tiene tres hijos que están estudiando pero tiene un problema en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la comprar de útiles escolares y pago de la colegiatura. 
Don Heriberto trabaja en una agencia aduanal como documentados y Doña Elvira realiza trabajos de costura en su casa para no descuidar a sus hijos. Esta son los ingresos que tiene para su familia y con los cuales una parte será para pagar el crédito.
Ya que desean que sus hijos sigan estudiando y que puedan terminar una carea profesional.
texts.en: Heriberto and his wife Elvira have three children in school but they have a problem right now in that they do not have the money they need to buy school supplies and pay school fees.  Heriberto works for a customs agency and Elvira does sewing work from home so that she can look after her children.  These are the sources of income they have for their family and they will use part of this money to repay their loan.  They would like their children to continue studying and for them to have a career.

loans.use: to pay for school expenses

loans.name: Rebeca Del Socorro

texts.es: Rebeca tiene 41años, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general desde hace más de 18 años tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, por lo que siempre está aportando lo mejor para mantener su negocio, este no es el primer financiamiento por lo que ha sido muy importante, para salir adelante. Por lo que el viaja a diferentes departamentos para buscar los diferentes productos que sus clientes le solicitan. El crédito es para la compra de toallas, sabanas, cosméticos, calzado y artículos para el hogar. Ella sueña con mejorar el servicio con sus clientes y proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Rebeca is 41 years old and has been selling general merchandise since she was 18.  She has two children who she supports and always does her best to maintain her business.  This will not be her first loan and the previous ones have been important in her getting ahead.  She travels to different departments in search of different products that her customers request.  She will use the money from this loan to buy towels, sheets, cosmetics, shoes, and household items.  She wants to improve her customer service and make some improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 50 años, es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Luz de 11 y Frey de 5 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo al que Maritza se dedica es la panadería, su labor comienza muy temprano, aproximadamente a las 4 am. Ya esta en pie y lista para amasar la masa y hacer los panes que disfruta todo su barrio. Ella es una panadera muy hábil y es que desde muy pequeña aprendió este oficio de su padre. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es hacer panes y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 5 años en este trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse todos los días temprano, ya que para ella no existen fines de semana, ni feriados. En adelante, anhela poner una tienda donde pueda vender ella misma los panes que hornea. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP y no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero, así que esta dispuesto a ahorrar día a día para poder pagarlo, él es muy responsable y respetuoso con las demás socias.
