Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas latas y estantes para los panes, además hará componer su horno.
texts.en: Maritza is 50 years old and is a very humble and hard-working woman. She lives in her own home along with her two beloved children, Luz, 11; and Frey, 5; for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Maritza makes a living with a bakery. She starts working very early, at approximately 4 a.m., when she is already up and ready to knead the dough and make the breads that everyone in her neighborhood enjoys. She is a very skilled baker, and that's because she learned the trade from her father since she was very young. What she enjoys most about her work is making the breads, which she does with a lot of care. She has had this job for five years, and the thing she considers to be the most difficult is getting up so early every morning, since for her weekends and holidays don't exist. In the future, her goal is to have a store where she could sell the items she bakes herself. This is her third loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she wants to have the funds to repay it, so she is ready to save day by day. Maritza is a very responsible member of her community bank and very respectful of her fellow members. With the 500 soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase new baking tins and shelves for her bread, as well as repair her oven.

loans.use: to purchase baking tins, shelves and repair her oven.

loans.name: 45.thiệu Dương-Thiệu Hoá Group

texts.en:
Chuc is 53 years old.  She is married and has 3 children and supports 1 additional dependent.  She is the group leader of the 9.1.45.Thieu Duong solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.  

Chuc works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle.  She has been involved in this business for 8 years.   She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main harship that Chuc faces in her business is the lack of capital.  With her profits, she hopes to make her business more successful and to remodel her house.

loans.use: buy baby livestock

loans.name: Ryamatumba Twimukye Group

texts.en: John is 55 years old, married, and has six children. His business is a butcher shop in Bushenyi Town. This business has been in existence for the last four years. He began this business with capital from his farming business. He has not dispensed with the farming business though because he says he still earns handsomely from it. The only challenge John cites in the farm sales business is competition. His weekly business sales profits are 150,000 shillings.  With this loan, John will purchase cattle for slaughter purposes.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Rasif

texts.en:
Rasif is 58 years old, married and has three children. For five years, Rasif has been providing welding services. He takes orders for making gates, doors and small stoves, and sells them at the market due to high demand. 

This is only one financial source in Rasif`s family. With the first loan from KIVA, Rasif was able to open his own workshop.  Now Rasif has applied for a loan to fully meet the demands of his customers. He is asking for a loan of 1,400 AZN to purchase materials and cover the high demand of orders. This loan with help to make his business successful and to provide all of his children with a better life.

loans.use: to purchase materials to cover orders

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Irvin

texts.es:
Irvin de 21 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

Irvin desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) y porcino (cerdos), su corral que se encuentra a unos minutos de su casa, los cuales son amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y  pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento  ideal, para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos personales.   También cuenta con tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar forraje para engordar a sus animales y fertilizante para mejorar sus tierras, al igual que su producto y así venderlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes, con esos ingresos podrá pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Irvin es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo que lo único que quiere es poder brindarle algunas comodidades a sus padres y poder estudiar algo en un futuro.
texts.en:
Irvin, 21, is single and lives in his parents' home which does not have basic services. It is located in the rural zone of the district of Tambogrande, which is part of the department of Piura. This zone is known for farming, cattle and artisan crafts. 

For some years Irvin has raised and sold sheep and pigs. His corral, which is large, is a few minutes from his house. He feeds his animals with balanced feed and natural grasses so that his animals grow to an ideal size to offer them to the different markets in the zone and get good profits to pay for his personal expenses. He also has farmland where he plants limes. 

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy fodder to fatten his animals and fertilizer to improve his land. This way he will also improve his product and be able to sell them to his customers for a better price. With this income he will be able to pay back his loan and improve his quality of life. Irvin is very dedicated to his work. All that he wants is to be able to give his parents some basic comforts and to be able to study something in the future.

loans.use: to buy fodder and fertilizer for his farm land.

loans.name: Siguitemasson Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les dix 10 femmes qui constituent le groupe SIGUITEMASSON IV sont toutes mariées avec en moyenne 33 ans, en moyenne 3 enfants et  vivant dans des familles polygames à Koula, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont essentiellement le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MARIAM, la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 women who make up the SIGUITEMASSON IV group are all married with an average age of 33 and on average three children, and they live in polygamous families in Koula, one of the villages of the rural community of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali. 

They are working together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate are essentially rice and peanuts. They are on their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. 

With this loan, MARIAM, second from the left, standing, intends to buy farm inputs and small agricultural material and pay plowing costs to maintain about 0.25 hectares of peanuts. 

The produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco, and N’Golobougou, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. The group members expect to make an average profit of 25,000 F CFA per growing season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and small agricultural material.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is from the village Pirveli Maisi, Samegrelo Region. She is 52 years old, unmarried and lives with her family: 41-year-old brother and parents (retired). Clara and her brother are leading the agro business of the family, which is the main source of income for them. In particular, the family has 3 milk cows. Clara produces, on average, 60 kg of cheese per month. She sells it on the local open market. Also, they own a pig and sell approximately 10 piglets per year. Along with the above-mentioned, Clara and her brother have 1 hectare of land where maize is grown. One ton of the harvested corn is sold on local market and the remaining 2 tons are used for feeding the livestock. 

Along with the above-mentioned, Clara has a small trade business. She brings seasonal clothes from Tbilisi wholesale market to the village and sells them. She brings the new clothes with the value of 200 – 300 GEL twice a month. Her monthly profit from this business is 200 – 250 GEL per month. 

Clara requested credit for purchasing additional clothes for resale. She will purchase more clothes and offer a wider assortment to the villagers. Also purchasing the clothes in larger amounts will allow her to save transportation costs. Clara will get more profit and will be able to make some savings, because in the near future she will need to change the roof of the house.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothes for resale

loans.name: Luisa Maribel

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Mujeres Activas.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Luisa, tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 9 hijos, uno mayor de edad y ocho menores seis de ellos estudian en colegio y  escuela. El marido se dedica a la agricultura.
 
Ella al ver que lo que hace su esposo en el campo no le alcanza para solventar los gastos del hogar  se dedica a la cría de pollos para lo cual tiene una granja en la cual mete hasta 200 pollos por temporada, nos cuenta que ella compra los pollitos en una incubadora en Portoviejo y luego los mantiene por espacio de tres meses tiempo adecuado para que tengan un buen crecimiento para luego entregarlos a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa y también distribuye a algunas tiendas locales, además de vender en su casa a los vecinos y personas de la localidad.

Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimento y medicinas  para que los pollos tengan un buen desarrollo. Lleva 3 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Sus sueños son tener buena salud ella y su familia.
texts.en:
In the 24 de Mayo Canton in Manabí province, known for its beautiful scenery, its forests, its varied fauna and for its kind, hardworking people dedicated to farming and animal husbandry, the “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) communal bank meets every two weeks.

Luisa, 37, lives in this place.  She’s in a common law relationship and has nine children.  One is an adult and eight are minors.  Six of them go to secondary and elementary school.  Her husband is a farmer.

Seeing that what her husband earns in the field was insufficient to cover household expenses she started to raise chickens.  She has a farm where she can raise up to 200 chicks per season.  She tells us that she buys the chicks from an incubator in Portoviejo and then raises them for a period of three months which is enough time for them to reach good growth and be sold to merchants that come by her house.  She also sells to some local stores as well as from home to her neighbors and local people.

This loan is to buy chicks, feed and medicine for them so that they will have good growth.  She’s been in the communal bank for 3 years and likes it because the loans are easy to do.  Her dream is that she and her family enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy chicks, fed and medicine for them.

loans.name: Murtazo

texts.ru: Муртазо честный и добрый человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Его жена домохозяйка и она иногда помогает мужу. Муртазо занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур, а также занимается откормом скота. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль. Муртазо хочет видит своих детей в будущем как образованными и воспитанными людьми. Муртазо запрашивает займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки семена, минеральных удобрений и скота. Прибыль, который приносить ему данный бизнес, он планирует использовать часть его на учебу своего сына, а другую часть на расширения бизнеса. Он заранее благодарен за Кива и Кива кредиторы за их поддержку и милосердие.
texts.en: Murtazo is an honest and kind person.  He is married and is a loving father of three children.  His wife is a homemaker and she sometimes helps her husband.  Murtazo is involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up livestock.  He wants to expand his business and maximize his profit.  Murtazo wants to see his children in the future as educated and well-mannered people.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of seeds, mineral fertilizers and livestock.  He plans to use the profit from this loan partially to pay for his son's education and partially for expanding his business.  He thanks Kiva and Kiva creditors in advance for their support and mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and livestock

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en: Larisa is from the village of Ashotck in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is happily married with four children – two daughters (forty and forty-two years old) and two sons (thirty-six and thirty-eight years old).  Larisa has a secondary education and has been farming for the past forty years.  She also supports her relatives living in the city with produce grown on the family farm.  Larisa would like a loan to purchase animal feed and fix the livestock shed.  She expects this investment to increase the family income by fifteen percent.  Larisa is pleased with the services of microfinance, especially that the loan payments are collected in the village.  Larisa really enjoys the life of a farmer living in Ashotck.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed

loans.name: Teressa

texts.en:
Teressa is 30 years old.  She is a married woman with one child who is not in school.  She has a business selling sodas in South Sudan and has been in this business for five years.

Teressa requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase sodas to  resell.  She says that she will use the extra income from this loan to build a permanent house in the future.

loans.use: buy soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy shoes, skirts, suits, blankets and jeans.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 56 años, es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de Raúl, su esposo desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero solo cuidan a 2 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de San pedro de saño. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, sus sembríos constan de maíz y papa. Los cuales cuida con mucho esmero pues tiene que cuidar la calidad de sus cosechas, ya que en temporada de recolección los mismos comerciantes visitan sus terrenos para negociar los alimentos. La ayuda de su esposo es vital, pues juntos toman decisiones para afrontar las dificultades; como la falta de peones o las plagas que azotan sus cultivos. Como es una mujer del campo, también se dedica a la ganadería; con la crianza de 2 vacas que le brindan la leche que después vende a los pobladores de su localidad. Ahora ella desea comprar más terrenos agrícolas, porque tiene planes de seguir sembrando en mayor cantidad. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “san pedro” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Rosa de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra de maíz.
texts.en: Rosa, 56, is a cheerful woman. She lives with Raul, her husband of 20 years. They have 3 children but only take care of 2 of them in their own house which is located in the annex of San Pedro de Saño. Her main economic activity is farming. She plants corn and potatoes which she tends with great care as she must ensure the quality of her produce as at harvest time the very merchants visit her farm to negotiate for the produce. Her husband's help is crucial as together they make decisions to confront any difficulties such as a lack of labourers or the pests that afflict her crops. As she is a country woman she also keeps livestock, breeding 2 cows which give her milk that she subsequently sells to people of her area. She now wants to buy more farmland because she has plans to continue planting in large quantities. She belongs to the communal bank "San Pedro" and this is the 7th loan with MFP. She hopes for your collaboration so as to pursue her goals. She also promises once more to make her repayments. In addition, she likes being a part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible people and very united. Rosa, on receiving your support, will invest the money requested in the purchase of several sacks of natural fertilizers for her next crop of corn.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Went Plus Group

texts.en:
“Went Plus” is a community bank made up of 16 micro-entrepreneurs.  Its chairwoman is Josée.  These members are united with the same goal; to grow their businesses.
 
Josée sells fresh food in the north eastern and most populated areas of Kinshasa.  She began her business in 2009.  Hard work and good management has helped her succeed at making a profit.

She is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC and has already received three loans and repaid them properly.  

With this loan, Josée will buy three boxes of fresh food to resell.  The business gives her a profit of $60 every week. 

Josée is 43 years old, married and the mother of three children who ages vary between three and 12 years old.  Two attend school.  Her ambition is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase three boxes of fresh food to resell.

loans.name: Triwana Sari Group

texts.en: With her current loan, Ni K. successfully maintained two pigs and successfully sold them to earn a net profit of Rp. 500,000. To get more benefits from the business, Ni K. needs another new loan to improve her income. This time she is using the loan to purchase three superior piglets. She hopes the result will be better than before.

loans.use: To buy three superior piglets

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes nació en la ciudad del Ollantaytambo pero vive en la comunidad de Paucarbamba, ella tiene 46 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cinco hijos.  

Mercedes desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, ella se dedica a  la agricultura y ganadería, ella también se dedica a elaborar jora de maíz para hacer chicha de jora. Ya son varios años que se dedica al  negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Mercedes requiere el préstamo para comprar maíz.  
 
Mercedes se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Mercedes pertenece al banco comunal “Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Mercedes was born in the city of Ollantaytambo, but she now lives in the community of Paucarbamba. She is 46 years old and married. From this union, she has five children.   

Mercedes carries out her daily and economic activities in the city of Ollantaytambo. She works in agriculture and ranching. She also works preparing yellow corn to make chicha [a traditional beverage]. She has worked in this business for several years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the dedication she puts into her work. 

Mercedes needs the loan to buy corn.  
 
Mercedes is grateful for the opportunity provided to her in this way, and accordingly, she is committed to making her payments on time. Mercedes belongs to the “Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar” ["Immaculate Conception of Pachar"] communal bank, of the Arariwa Association, in the city of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en: Crisanta is 39 years old and married with two children. Crisanta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000-Philippine-peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store. Crisanta has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for nine years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Crisanta aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita cuenta con 45 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja tiene 3 hijos que están estudiando la mayor esta en su carrera de informática 3 semestre, Vicente en 2° de prepa y miran 2° de secundaria.

Su esposo se llama pedro es operador de estrella blanca, ella vende ropa inicio el negocio con su mama y ahora que ya no esta su mama lo tiene ella pero dice que le esta yendo muy bien  e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de ropa para la temporada espera que le vaya muy bien ya que le gustaría incrementar y establecer un local para allí vender su ropa.
texts.en:
Margarita is 45 years old living in a common law relationship with her spouse; they have three children attending school.  The oldest is in third semester majoring in computer sciences, Vicente is in 11th grade and Miran is in 8th grade.

Her husband’s name is Pedro and he is an Estrella Blanca bus driver.  She sells clothes.  She started the business with her mother and now that her mother is no longer here she’s running it by herself but she says she’s doing very well and will invest her loan in the purchase of seasonal clothes.  She hopes to do well because she’d like to increase and set up a locale to sell her clothes there.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo que se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de la ciudad de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su  artesanía como los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 23 y 22 años de edad, ambos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer. Nuestra amiga es artesana hace varios años, estuvo en una academia de corte y confección en la cual aprendió muy bien esta profesión.

Ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa lugar donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que requieren de sus servicios, además también vende ropa de todo tipo la cual lo realiza puerta a puerta aunque le mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su propio taller. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar. Lleva más de 10 años dedicada a estas actividades y le va bastante bien.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito con la finalidad de seguir adelante en su negocio ya que con los créditos se financia y continua adelante, nos cuenta que le fue muy bien con el crédito anterior y que obtuvo muy buenas ganancias, con lo cual no tuvo atrasos en los pagos.
 
Ella realiza este nuevo crédito para comprar ropa de todo tipo para vender esta mercadería en este mes que es muy bueno. Para ella los créditos son tan importantes ya que a través  de ellos ha mejorado su negocio y su vida en familia. Esta desde el inicio en el banco comunal y le gusta porque la institución es muy seria y confiable.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su vida diaria y mejorar con el paso de los días.
texts.en:
The “Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo” (“With Love and Faith Towards Development”) communal bank meets every two weeks in Los Bajos in the city of Montecristi, a city known for its cultural riches and for its artisan work such as the Panama hat, known both throughout the country and outside of it.

In this place we meet Ana, 45 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has two children, 22 and 23 years old. Both of them live with her. Her husband is a driver. Our friend has been an artisan for several years. She went to a sewing and dressmaking academy, where she learned this profession very well.

She has a small dressmaking shop in her house, where she has sewn clothes for many years. She works based on orders from particular people who need her services. She also sells all kinds of clothing, which she does door-to-door, although most of her sales take place in her own shop. She works every day from 6:00am until 10:00pm, and sometimes later when she has orders to deliver. She has been doing this work for more than 10 years, and it’s going pretty well for her.

She is taking out another loan with the goal of moving forward in her business, since with the loans she finances herself and continues moving forward. She tells us that the previous loan went very well for her and she obtained very good earnings, and she had no delays in making the repayments.

She is taking out this new loan in order to purchase clothing of all kinds to sell this month, which is a very good one. For her, the loans are so important, since through them she has improved her business and her family’s life. She has been a member of the communal bank from the beginning, and she likes it because the institution is very serious and reliable.

Her dreams are to continue moving forward in her daily life and to improve with the passing of time.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a single man. He has one child. He describes himself as determined. He operates a butchery where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy meat to sell. His business goal is to have multiple outlets within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Manuela Natividad

texts.es: La cliente reside en la ciudad de Libertad.  Inició tiempo atrás, cuando se percató de la necesidad de buscar más ingresos para su hogar y fue ahí cuando decidió montar su tienda.  Trabaja junto a sus hijos y esposo de 7 am hasta las 10 pm.  Su esposo se dedica también a la pesca artesanal.  No tiene ya hijos menores.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de colas, jugos y arroz para su venta.

loans.use: Compra de víveres

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Zainab from Waterloo2, Western rural, in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with six children. After her wedding, Zainab established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to create a permanent source of income for her family. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 5:30 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and a proper business location.

Zainab requires a loan in order to purchase sugar, gari and soap to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Zainab plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, gari and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Mahoulome Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOULOME est composé de trois personnes qui font des tontines ensemble. Bernadette, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 39 ans est mariée à un maçon du nom de Didier. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et trois à leur charge. Bernadette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Bernadette et son mari. Bernadette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour ce faire, depuis vingt ans, Bernadette vend des produits vivriers et des sacs de charbon de bois dans sa région. Bernadette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Bernadette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOULOME un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des produits vivriers et des sacs de charbon de bois.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a single parent of two children, Marilyn is 39 years old and works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig raising. 

Marilyn is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials paints, iron, tire, etc for her motorcycle transport business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials paints, iron, tire, etc

loans.name: Levani

texts.en:
Levani is 29 years old, from Gardabani district. The only employed person in the family is his father, who works as a guard and gets fixed salary. Levani wants to generate his own income and make better living condition for his family members. Levani couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions, because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program began which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The program allows poor people like Levani to get a chance for starting or re-starting business. Levani plans to be involved in agricultural activity and set up a poultry-farm. He will purchase chickens and after raising them will sell in a good price. 
The new business initiative will give Levani chance to have financial stability and monthly income as well as expand the business in the future. He will be very thankful for the financial support and kindness.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and set up poultry-farm

loans.name: Maria Socorro

texts.en:
Hi, my name is Maria Socorro. My main activity is to sell firewood and also cosmetics which I distribute through retail sales and special order. I have been operating this business for several years and have a good customer base. Thanks to this business I can generate enough income to contribute towards my family expenses and to meet my obligations with suppliers.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch:

Hola mi nombre el Maria Socorro, mi actividad principal es la venta de leña y tambien la venta de cosmeticos, los que distribuyo de manera ambulante y por emcargo, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de negocio, cuento con buena clientela, gracias a esta actividad puedo generar ingresos para comtribuir con los gastos familiares y otros compromisos con los proveedores.

loans.use: To purchase wood and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Yekaterina

texts.en:
Ekaterina loves candy. This is essentially what led her to start her business selling candy and baked goods. She runs a small kiosk at the local market that has quickly acquired a reputation for high quality service. After 5 years in business, Ekaterina’s business has blossomed due to her entrepreneurial skills and the kindness she shows to her customers. Today her business yields $2,000 a month in gross income with an investment of $3,000 in inventory. Ekaterina has requested a loan for $700 to purchase candy and baked goods in bulk. This amount will enable her to purchase 230 kg of sweets, paying only around $2-6 per kg. She believes that broadening her product line will increase her income and allow her to improve the well-being of her family. Ekaterina is raising her 5 year old son by herself. She would like to invest some of her earned income to have a natural gas pipeline put into the house where they currently live so they can enjoy cheaper hot water and heating.

Катерина дуже любить солодощі. Саме це й спонукало її почати власну справу з продажу солодкого та кондитерських виробів. Катерина – власниця невеличкого кіоску на місцевому ринку, який швидко здобув гарну репутацію завдяки високоякісному обслуговуванню. Цим бізнесом Катерина займається вже 5 років. Він став успішним завдяки її завзятості та ввічливості у роботі покупцями. Зараз в неї 2000 доларів щомісячного доходу, в товар вкладено приблизно 3000 доларів. Катерина просить про позику в 700 доларів для того, щоб оптом закупити солодощі та кондитерські вироби. Ця сума дасть їй можливість придбати 230 кг цукерок, заплативши лише приблизно 2-6 доларів за кілограм. Катерина вважає, що збільшення асортименту товарів збільшить її прибуток та сприятиме покращенню рівня життя її родини. Катерина сама виховує 5-річного сина. Вона планує використати частину отриманого від торгівлі прибутку для того, щоб прокласти газовий трубопровід у власній оселі, завдяки якому в неї з’виться гаряча вода та опалення.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Mrs. Joy Abharo hails from the Edo State of Nigeria. She is married, with eight children, and is happy to be a LAPO client. She says that LAPO has brought rain to her family. She is asking for $250 to expand her business of selling garri.

loans.use: To buy more bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan T. is 37 years old, mother of 3 children, and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To support her family, T. sells a kind of dessert to the people in her community, while her husband works as a farmer. Together they make on average around $6 per day in income. This loan will be used to purchase a plot of land to grow more crops; the remainder will go to buy to buy tools and some utensils for her store.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land to grow more crops; the remainder of the money is to buy tools and utensils for her store.

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.es:
My name is Reymundo and I deal in selling basic market products for popular consumption to the villagers in my town and others that pass through this part of the capital. Ours is a family business and it provides us with revenue to support my kids, helping us economically fund their schooling. At this time I need to replenish my market now that it's the time of year when sales are high. I want to provide my clients with a variety of quality products.

 Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva Volunteer.



Mi nombre es Reymundo y me dedico a vender productos de la canasta basica, de consumo popular entre los vecinos de mi colonia y otros que pasan por este sector de la capital. Mi negocio es familiar y nos da ingresos que ayudan con el sostenimiento de mis hijos, ayudando economicamente en sus estudios. En esta temporada necesito surtir mi mercadito ya que vienen las temporadas de bastante ventas y quiero brindar a mis clientes productos de calidad y variados.

loans.use: The purchase of drinks, bread, eggs, stuffing, meats, cheese, and other market products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her stock.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
As she describes it, Eunice N. is in the business of selling clothes and “ndogo ndogo” (small, small) things. She hopes to increase her monthly profit of $100 by using a loan of $350 to buy additional items in bulk to sell to her customers. Eunice is 35 years old and a single mother with one son, John, who is 13.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not credit-worthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing and other items to sell.

loans.name: Buguju C (Iii) Group

texts.en:
Stella is 33 years old and divorced with three children. She sells textiles and clothings to earn a living. With the profits earned from this loan, she wants to buy a piece of land and pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more textiles and cloth fabrics.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru:
Nargiza G. is 28 years old, is divorced and has 2 children. She lives separately from her parents. She owns 12 rams and 1 cow. She is very interested increasing the number of animals she owns. She milks the cow herself, sells part of the milk and uses the rest to feed her children. Because animals currently sell for cheap, she would like to borrow money to purchase more animals and resell the summer time. She also works at home making yarn from wool. She would be happy to try using a loan as source of investment.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Гуфранова Наргиза возрост 28 лет , имеет 2их детей,разведена.Сейчас живет самостоятельно от родителей.Имеет 12 баранов и 1 корову.Очень заинтересована в размножении скота.Сама доит корову с которой имеет молоко ,также помимо продажи в своей махале она кормит своих детей им. Т,к, сейчас на базарах дешевый скот она хочет взяв займ купить еще скот и где-то летом продать его. Также она на дому подрабатывает по производству пряжи из бараньей шерсти. Она была бы рада попробовать использовать займ.

loans.use: Cattle raising

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary O. is married with 5 children. She is 38 years old and comes from the eastern part of Nigeria.

Mary sells plastic products like chairs, jars and tables in her store. She has been in business since 1998. Mary needs a loan in the amount of $350 so she can buy more plastic products for sale.

loans.use: To buy more plastic products for sale

loans.name: Miriam's Group

texts.es:
Miriam, Karina, and Elisa have belonged to the Santa Rita Communal Bank for 2 years, 8 months, and 4 months, respectively.

Miriam is 24 years old, married and has 3 children. Miriam sells different items depending on demand; for example, she sells crafts during Holy Week and fireworks for Christmas. Miriam also sells grains in bulk to markets and has an Internet cafe in the city of Huanta.

Karina is 22 years old and lives with her partner. The couple sells clothing in the "April 12th Market" and also travels to different regional fairs.

Elisa is also 22, lives with her partner and has a 3-year-old daughter. Elisa has a cafe on the campus of the Local University. She also has a car, which her partner uses as a taxi. Elisa travels to regional fairs, where she sells ceviche (raw fish cured in lemon).

Miriam, Karina and Elisa need loans of 1000 soles, 400 soles, and 1400 soles, respectively. The money will be spent to buy upholstry, polo shirts, jackets, pants and to make car payments.

Miriam, Karina and Elisa dream that their children will become working professionals, of getting married, and of owning their own homes, businesses and bulk goods stores.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Miriam, Karina y Elisa pertenecen al Banco Comunal Santa Rita hace 2 años, 8 meses, 4 meses respectivamente.

Miriam es casada, tiene 24 años y 3 hijos, Miriam vende diferentes productos dependiendo de la demanda, como artesanía en semana santa, cuetecillos en navidad, entre otros productos. También Miriam vende cereales por mayor a los mercados. Además Miriam tiene cabinas de Internet en la ciudad de Huanta.

Por otro lado Karina es conviviente y tiene 22 años, Karina junto a su esposo venden ropa en el mercado 12 de abril y también viajan a las diferentes ferias de la región.

Mientras que Elisa es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hija de 3 años, Elisa tiene un cafetín en una facultad de la Universidad Local. También tiene un carro con lo cual trabaja su esposo haciendo taxi. Además Elisa viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región donde vende Cebiche (comida preparada con pescado y limón).

Miriam, Karina y Elisa necesitan un préstamo de 1000 soles, 400 soles, 1400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de tapices, polos, casacas, pantalones y para comprar su carro (parte del pago).

Los sueños de Miriam, Karina y Elisa son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener casa propia, una tienda de venta por mayor, un negocio propio y casarse.

loans.use: Purchase upholstry, polo shirts, jackets, pants and make car payments

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen is very pleased for having made the decision to sell recognized brands of beauty products for the last three years, which for her was a new line of business. Now her market has expanded, as she continually explores new areas that allow her to make substantial earnings. She goes out each morning in search of new horizons while also working part-time as a seamstress. She is seeking a loan to acquire a greater quantity of cosmetics and fabrics at wholesale prices to fortify her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Carmen, está muy contenta por haber tomado una buena decisión. Hace 3 años tuvo la oportunidad de vender productos de belleza de reconocidas marcas para lo cual emprendió lo que para ella era una nueva forma de hacer negocio, ahora su mercado se ha expandido y cada vez explora nuevas zonas de intervención que le permiten obtener mayores ganancias. Sale todas las mañanas en búsqueda de nuevos horizontes y a la vez también dedica parte de su tiempo libre a la costura. Solicita un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de cosméticos y telas al por mayor para el afianzamiento de sus actividades.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics and fabrics at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, is a very active and hard working. Her neighbors are witnesses to her daily efforts and labor that benefit her beloved family, they respect and appreciate Julia for her dedication. Her wish is to enhance her farming activities, however it is necessary to inject a sum of money to achieve her goal. Through Prism she extends her request for a loan and is committed to doubling her dedication to achieve her dream.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia, es una dama muy empeñosa y trabajadora y testigo D. sus esfuerzos y labor diaria en beneficio D. su amada familia son sus vecinos quienes respetan y aprecian a Doña Julia por su dedicación. Desea mejorar aún más sus actividades y es muy necesario la inyección D. una suma D. dinero para lograr lo que se ha propuesto y a través D. Prisma les extienD. su petición con el compromiso D. doblar su dedicación para alcanzar su sueño.

loans.use: Increase in capital to improve her farming and ranching.

loans.name: Ram Maiya

texts.en:
Ram Maiya S. is a tailor in the town of Bholdhoka, lalitpur. She has four members including herself in her family. Her husband's name is Chabi Lal S., and he is a laborer who does house construction work. She has one son and one daughter. Her son and daughter are studying in secondary school.

Mrs. Ram Maiya S. works in a tailoring shop. The condition of her family is not good because her husband's work is not permanent. So to upgrade the living standard of her family, she wants to utilize her morning and evening time to sell fresh green vegetables in a local market. So to start her new business, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 NPR to buy various types of green vegetables and furniture for her business.

loans.use: To buy fresh vegetables for her new business

loans.name: Barkat

texts.en:
Barkat baji is the widow of M., and she has been living in the city of Riwind, Pakistan for the last 20 years. Barkat baji is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Her oldest son has a shuttering business, and he has been in this profession for the last 10 years; her other sons work at a factory; and her daughter is in school (in 8th standard). Barkat baji is a housewife, and she prefers to do work around the house.

Importantly, Barkat baji successfully repaid three previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now, she is seeking another loan in order to buy shuttering materials (beams and ropes) for her son’s shuttering business.

loans.use: To buy construction materials (beams and ropes) for her son's business

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi: Chị Quê năm nay 42 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó có 1 con đang đi học. Năm 1998 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào xưởng mộc của gia đình. Đến nay qua 10 năm vay vốn làm ăn xưởng mộc của gia đình chị đã ngày càng được mở rộng với rất nhiều loại sản phẩm như bàn ghế, cửa gỗ phục vụ nhu cầu sử dụng của nhân dân địa phương.  Với mức thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng từ công việc sản xuất và bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ kinh tế gia đình chị  ngày càng phát triển. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua gỗ về sản xuất các sản phẩm bán cho người dân địa phương.
texts.en:
Ms. Q. is 42 years old. Her family consists of 3 children, 1 of which is in school. In 1998, she joined the organization to invest into her family business of woodwork. After 10 years of borrowing, her family business has grown; producing a variety of furniture, wood doors, and other wood furnishing to meet the demand of the people in her community. Her monthly income is 3.000.000d/month in which she makes from producing and selling wood furnishings. The family’s business is growing day to day and so has the income. This next loan, she is requesting 15.000.000d to invest in buying supplies/materials to make furniture, selling them to the people in her community.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Jennet

texts.en:
Jennet is married to Mr. P. God Fred. They are blessed with nine children, six of whom are below the age of 15. Jennet was unable to further her education because her father could not pay her school fees. Later on, she became blind. Worst of all, a thief recently broke into her home, shot her 10-year-old son, who almost died, and stole money from her house. In addition to this, her children are unable to study freely because of the fees, and they are also unable to have three square meals a day.

Jennet was motivated by her situation to become a member of GHAPE in 2006. Since then she has successfully borrowed and repaid two loans that totaled 120.000 FRS. The profit from these loans helped her pay her children's school fees and provide some basic needs, such as food for the family.

With this loan, Jennet plans to buy piglets, pig feed, soya beans, koki beans, and palm oil to continue her business. She is convinced that her business is going to be successful because she has a lot of experience in both pig farming and her restaurant business, and she has many customers. She says the profit from this loan will be used to send her children to school and to do maintenance on her house.

Jennet plans to pay her loan in 18 months, with the first installment being repaid four months from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase piglets, feed, soya beans, and koki beans

loans.name: Ye

texts.en:
Mr. Ye Y. resides in Trapaing Toem Village in Kampong Cham Province where he cultivates rice on a small piece of land that he owns. His wife, Mrs. Seng Soen, is a duck breeder upon whose behalf Ye is requesting a loan to buy duck food. He hopes to increase family income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

Ye is 45 years old and the father of four children, one a garment factory worker, another a boxer, and two students in the local school. His wife is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase duck food.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
La señora María Gloria Morínigo, es casada, vive en casa propia,     tiene dos  hijos, quienes  son  mayores de edad. La misma cuenta con una lavandería para ropas. En Paraguay, las personas llevan sus ropas a las lavanderías para que las personas ahí se encarguen de lavarlas y plancharlas pagando por el servicio, a diferencia de otros países en donde las personas hacen uso de las máquinas solamente y se encargan de lavar sus propias ropas.

El negocio lo tiene muy bien ubicado, situado a dos cuadras de la Avda. Eusebio Ayala, que es una de las principales avenidas de la ciudad. Se inició con un de aproximadamente U$ 650 que fue ampliando con el correr de los años, pues actualmente cuenta con una amplia cartera de clientes.

La señora María Gloria Morínigo retira el préstamo para la adquisición de un secarropas más para poder abastecer con los trabajos que tiene.

Uno de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente este negocio, en lo que se refiere  al equipamiento o mobiliario,  y poder ofrecer un ambiente más cómodo y ameno a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Gloria Morínigo is married, lives in her own house, and has two children that are already grown. She has a landromat. In Paraguay, people bring their clothing to laundromats so that the people there deal with washing and ironing them, paying for that service, which is different from other countries where people make use of machines and take care of washing their own clothes.

The business has a very good location, situated two blocks from Avda. Eusebio Ayala, which is one of the main streets in the city. She started with approximately US$ 650, which has increased with the passage of time, and nowadays she counts on a broad client list.

Ms. María Gloria Morínigo withdraws this loan to acquire another dryer to be able to keep up with the work that she has.

One of her aspirations is to be able to expand this business soon, referring to the equipment or furnishings, and to be able to offer a more comfortable and pleasant environment for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dryer for clothes

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sari

texts.id: Pada periode pertama pinjaman Ni Ketut Sari dipergunakan untuk menambah jumlah barang dagangan yang dijual sehingga pada saat ini Ibu ketut sari dapat meningkatkan omset penjualannya. Tidak sampai disana saja Ibu ketut sari dalam usahanya, tetapi Ibu sari mau meneruskan dan meningkatkan penjualanya sehingga mereka akan melanjutkan pinjamannya yang merupakan  Pinjaman periode kedua deangan jangka waktu 12 bulan dengan pelunasannya dibayar pada akhir periode pinjaman.  Jumlah penjualan pada saat ini sudah menjcapai Rp 300 000,-  dengan keuntungan Rp 20.000,- Per hari NI Ketut Sari ingin meningkatkan persediaan barang dagangan yang lebih lengkap lagi. Dengan keuntungan yang lebih meningkat dia akan bisa menambah penghasilan keluarganya.
texts.en:
In the first period, Ni Ketut Sari's loan were used to add amount of the sales items, so that Mrs. ketut sari could increase he sales volume. Not only that far, in running her business, but Mrs sari like to move further in increasing her sales, and they are continuing their loan for a second period for 12 months, with payment at the end of the loan period. Total sales today are about Rp 300,000,- (Translator's note: 1US$ fluctuates between Rp10,000 to Rp12,000) with a profit of about Rp 20,000,- Daily NI Ketut Sari likes to increase her items selections to something more complete. With increase profit she could add family's income.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase business capital to buy sales items (Menambah modal usaha dengan membeli barang dagangan)

loans.name: Zenayda

texts.es: Doña Zenayda es casada, de 45 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, ellos no estudian, pero trabajan y le ayudan con los gastos del hogar; Zenayda trabaja como responsable del cementerio de Juigalpa desde hace 21 años, su esposo trabaja en el hospital como camillero y tambien apoya en el hogar, esta solicitando su 8vo credito para utilizarlo en mejorar su vivienda como es cambiar el techo y levantar paredes de su cocina, sus creditos anteriores los ha pagado en tiempo y forma, siendo hasta el momento tipificada como cliente "A", todos sus creditos los ha utilizado para el mejoramiento de su vivienda hasta llegar a poseer una vivienda con algunas condiciones, faltando todavia mucho por hacer, pero esta segura que con sus creditos llegara  a cumplir con el su sueño.
texts.en:
Doña Zenayda is married, aged 45, has 2 children. They aren't studying, but they work and help with the household expenses. Zenyada has worked as a cemetery warden in Juigalpa for the last 21 years, her husband works in the hospital as a stretcher-bearer and also helps in the home. She is asking for her eighth credit to use it in order to improve her house by changing the roof and putting up kitchen walls. Her previous loans have been paid back on time and in full, so she is classified as an "A" grade client. All her loans have been used to improve her house in order that she may possess a well-built house. There remains a lot to do, but she is sure that with the credits she will achieve her dream.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change roof and construct walls

loans.name: César

texts.es: César R. G., es un hombre trabajador, el cuál vela por su esposa e hijos día tras día. A sus 54 años de edad, reside en el cantón Chancuyo, departamento de Ahuachapán. Tiene tres años de invertir su trabajo en un pequeño negocio propio, en el cuál se comercializa productos lácteos y embutidos, tales como queso, salchichas, crema, entre otras cosas. Debido a que su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico tiene muchos clientes, es por ellos que solícita un préstamo para poder de esta manera invertir más en su negocio, ya que ha pesar de sus limitaciones ha logrado incluir otros productos como golosinas y pan. Es por ellos que su deseo más grande es poder obtener la capital necesaria para incrementar sus productos, brindar un mejor servicio y obtener mejores ingresos los cuales contribuyan a su economía familiar.
texts.en:
César R. G. is a hard working man who looks after his wife and children. He is 54 years old and lives in the county of Chancuyo, in the suburb of Ahuachapan. He has owned his own business for the past 3 years, which sells dairy and deli products, such as cheese, sausage, and cream among other things. Because his business is located in such a favorable location, he has many clients. As a result, Cesar is asking for a loan to invest in his business so that he can expand his offerings to include bread and soft drinks. For these reasons his greatest desire is to obtain a loan so that he can increase his inventory, offer a better service and increase his income, which will improve his family's finances.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand product offerings

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Sou S., 20, is married and sells baskets in the Siem Reap province. She started making baskets and selling them at the market in 2007. She is able to make $6 per day. Her husband, pictured here, stays at home and helps her make the baskets.

This couple needs a loan to purchase bamboo so that they can make more baskets to sell to their customers.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo

loans.name: Ogechukwu

texts.en: Ogechukwu sells various food products to the people of her community. She learned this business three years ago, and has been active in it ever since.  Ogechukwu is 40 years old, married and has six children. She has borrowed from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years and has made good use of her loans to boost her business and her profitability. Ogechukwu has applied for a new loan to buy more foodstuffs to sell to her customers. She is very happy with the support she has received from Kiva, and she wishes to say thank you to your generous support.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mata De Palma En Desarrollo - Group 7

texts.en:
This is the newest group of five to join the Mata de Palma en Desarrollo Bank of Hope in Hato Mayor. They are taking their first loan with Esperanza International, Kiva's partner. In view of the slow movement of the economy in the past few months, many people have decided to become self-employed as an alternative to unemployment. Hato Mayor is one of the provinces with the lowest population in Dominican Republic, and many of its inhabitants are forced to perform their work activities elsewhere, or commute to other provinces to work. This results in an additional burden to their businesses and families, as on many occasions, our clients have to be away from home either for work or to restock their inventory. 

Altagracia S. has been appointed as group representative. She has 4 children; the oldest is 19 and the youngest is 6. Her group mates recognize her as a leader and trust her to do a good job in keeping the group together. Altagracia has set up a clothing sales business, so she will use her loan to buy new clothes to sell. For the present time, she will sell from her own home and visit her acquaintances with her merchandise. She hopes to eventually set up a store where her customers can come to her instead. She also wants to start building a house with her sales profits and be able to help her children acquire a college education. 

Please help us support this group of new micro entrepreneurs through this Kiva loan.
Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase new clothing items to resell.

loans.name: Luzira Posta Babirye Catherine Kitibwa Group

texts.en:
Ms. B. Catherine K. is a single lady aged 34 years. She has two children, aged 13 and 9 years. Both her children go to school.

She requests to use this loan to sell airtime, timber, poles for building houses, and for her boutique which has shoes and clothes. She has been in the business for over 3 years. Her business had less capital but now it is increasing because of the loan. She likes to serve people in her community with food supplements, timber and building poles, and with the shoes and clothes in her boutique. She is active, hardworking and encouraging. Her dream is to help the needy.

loans.use: To sell airtime, timber, poles for building houses, boutique (shoes and clothes)

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is 30 years old and she is married with two children. She has a store where she sells provisions. She hopes for the loan of N80,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Hương Thị Đỗ was born in 1975.  She lives with her father in-law, husband and two children. She makes and sells brooms. Her monthly income is about 2.000.000 VND. She wants to borrow 2.204.000 VND to buy bamboo to make brooms.

loans.use: Buy bamboo to make brooms.

loans.name: Sendia

texts.en:
Sendia is married with two children. She sells women's clothing at the central market in Vinogradovo city. She has been in this business for 7 years. When she graduated from high school there were no jobs available, and Sendia decided to start her own business. She saw that there was a high and constant demand for women's clothing, so she decided to go into clothing sales.

The business began to grow little by little. Today her net income is 5,000 UAH per month and is a stable source of income for her family. Sendia would like to borrow 6,500 UAH to increase the assortment of her goods. She hopes to receive additional income and further improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of her goods

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus S. manages a small hog raising business in their village. She is 45 years old and she is presently living in the rural place of Barangay Manano Mallig, Isabela. She is a loving wife to a 45 years old Perfecto S. who also is a loving husband too. Her husband is a farmer and they used to plant rice and corn which are the major crops produced in their municipality of Mallig. They have four children and they happily live in their poor village despite of the difficulties in life.  

Her goal in life is to become successful in her business. She wanted to have raised more pigs to generate more income, however she lacks the capital to sustain the business with enough pig feed. That is why Venus is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos for the maintenance of her hog raising business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng K. is an older single mother of sixty-eight years old. She has three married sons; two of them are trailer motor-taxi drivers who pick up tourists to visit Angkor Wat Temple in Siem Reap Province, while the other one is a construction worker. All of her children have used their incomes to sustain their family’s expenses and needs.

Seng K. currently works as a 'requirement worker'. She gets hired by farmers to harvest their produce during the mature crop season. Seng K. would like a loan to replace her son’s motor taxi that has broken.

loans.use: To replace her son’s motor taxi that has broken

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en: Nergui J. lives with his wife and three school-aged children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. He is 35 years old and has lived in his hometown since birth. In 2004 he started a food trading business with his brother, but in 2007, the two ended their partnership. Now, with the help of his wife, Nergui runs his business from a rented container shop at the local market. Thanks to their hard work, the business has been very successful. This success has much improved the family's quality of life and enabled them to buy their own home. One of the main reasons for his business' success is Nergui's strong customer service practices. Nergui treats all of his customers openly and nicely so that they come back over and over again. His dream is to one day own a spacious and comfortable workplace from which he can expand his business. Nergui is requesting a 2000,000 tugrugs loan to purchase food products for his store from Mongolia's capital, Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Chanvitol

texts.en:
Mr. Chanvitol T., 18, has been a hairdresser in Phnom Penh for about two years. He has five siblings and lives with his parents on National Road Number One, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. (He was not available for the photograph and was replaced by his mother.)

Chanvitol is in the process of building a new house where he lives, but he doesn’t have enough money to finish it. Therefore, he is requesting his first loan of $1,000 USD to finish the house and build a fence around it.

loans.use: To add to his own money to finish building his house and erect a fence around it

loans.name: Oyun-Erdene

texts.en:
Oyun-Erdene is 43 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family all live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.

Oyun-Erdene owns and operates a meat retail trading business in her town. She started her business in 1997 with working capital of 80,000 tugrug (~55 USD). With the support of her family, the business has since grown to exceed working capital of 1,400,000 tugrug (~980 USD).

Oyun- Erdene has gained considerable business knowledge and skills in the twelve years of operating her business and hopes to be able to be able to not only expand and own operating space for the business, but to pass her knowledge and skills on to her children. She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase more meat and supplies so that she may increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more meat and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase tools

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is fifty-two years old. She is married with two children who are currently schooling.

Matilda is a food vendor who sells fufu. Fufu is prepared from cassava and plantain, cooked and pounded together and taken with different kinds of soup. It is a very popular traditional food among the Ashanti tribe of the Ghanaian society. It is enjoyed either as lunch or supper.

Matilda wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Joshua Anyona

texts.en: Joshua runs a retail store selling household goods such as soda, sugar, salt, and bread. He has been in this business for the last five years, but in recent years a number of new retail stores have opened in the area making for very stiff competition. Luckily, Joshua has strong customer loyalty because he has always provided good service. Besides the business challenge of increased competition, another challenge is customers not paying their debt.  In order to stay competitive, Joshua is requesting a loan of KES20,000 to buy more households goods and make his shop a one-stop solution.  In the future he would like to be a wholesaler of household goods.  Joshua describes himself as someone with a good discipline in financial management. He is married and has a one-year-old daughter.

loans.use: To buy more household goods for his retail shop.

loans.name: Diéba

texts.fr: Diéba D. est une femme de 45 ans elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle développe un commerce de tissu à partir duquel elle se procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent d'équiper sa maison et de participer à la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Diéba D. is a 45-year-old woman who is married and the mother of six children. She is developing a fabrics business from which she derives profits that enable her to furnish her house and to help educate her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Patricia Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señorita  PATRICIA ELIZABETH B. R. tiene 19 años, vive en el distrito del PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia  es soltera y actualmente se encuentra cursando el 4to ciclo de la carrera de Ingeniería Agro Industrial en la Universidad. Desde pequeña, hasta la actualidad, se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de  golosinas como: galletas, chocolates, chicles, caramelos, cigarrillos, gaseosas, etc. Con el dinero obtenido colabora económicamente en su hogar y cubre sus propios gastos personales y de sus estudios.
Este es su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles el cual lo utilizará para la compra de golosinas como: galletas, chicles, caramelos, chocolates, cigarrillos, gaseosas, etc. para estar abastecida y poder continuar con sus ventas. 
Ella sueña con tener su tienda de comestibles en su  domicilio para lo cual esta ahorrando y trabajando arduamente.
texts.en:
Miss Patricia Elizabeth B. R. is 19 years old. She lives in the district of Porvenir, part of Trujillo provence in the La Libertad region of Peru. She is single and is currently in her fourth year of an Agroindustrial Engineering major at the university. Since she was small until the present, she has operated a convenience stand, selling such items as cookies, chocolates, gum, candy, cigarettes, soda, etc. With the money earned, she contributes to her household, covering her personal expenses and studies.

This is her first loan of 300 Peruvian soles, which she will use to buy merchandise such as cookies, chocolates, gum, candies, cigarettes, sodas, etc. to be stocked and to be able to continue with her sales.

She dreams of having a grocery store in her home, for which she is saving and working hard.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Kurten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products such as  cookies, chocolates, gum, candies, cigarettes, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. is married and has four children. She has received senior high education.

Felicia is a hairdresser who owns a beauty salon. She sells assorted wigs and bush meat at Akotoyir near Abura, a suburb in Cape Coast, which she has been doing for the past four years. Her husband is a contractor. Felicia uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Felicia will use the loan to purchase hair attachments, weave-ons (hair extensions) and bush meat for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Felicia plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase hair attachments, weave-ons and bush meat for resale

loans.name: Norma Argentina

texts.es: Her business began 34 years ago when Norma wanted to find a way to contribute to the household income when the father of her children left them. Norma sells a variety of merchandise, but principally cosmetics, on foot. Once a week she travels to Honduras to sell items like powdered milk, feminine products and other items on hand. Upon her return she brings the cosmetics that she sells. Norma has six children between the ages of 38 and 16, only the youngest is in her care. Norma is an excellent client of Fundación León 2000 with a very good credit history. Her dream is to be able to afford home improvements. She will use this loan to buy more inventory, mainly perfumes.

loans.use: She will use this loan to buy more inventory, mainly perfumes.

loans.name: Maria Hortensia

texts.es: Maria Hortensia tiene 53 años y su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace más de 23 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella tiene 8 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente y ayudan a su Mama, Maria trabajaba fuertemente para poder proporcionarle a todos sus hijos el alimento diario y además sostener las necesidades del hogar, todavía es una mujer muy fuerte pues trabaja diariamente. Con el financiamiento lograra comprar productos como leña, maíz, cal y bolsas plásticas. Su deseo es obtener una casa nueva que sea para sus hijos y les quede de herencia.
texts.en:
Maria Hortensia is 53 years old, and her business is the preparation and sale of tortillas. She has had this business for more than 23 years. She has 8 children, all of whom work independently and help support her. Maria works hard to be able to feed her children every day and take care of household expenses. She is still a strong woman, working every day. With this loan, she will buy products like firewood, corn, the mineral lime, and plastic bags. Her goal is buy a new house that she can live in with her children and leave to them as an inheritance.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Firewood, corn, the mineral lime, and plastic bags for the production of tortillas

loans.name: Respect Yourself Group

texts.en:
Sarah C. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Respect Yourself. She is 66 years old, widowed, and has two children who are 45 and 30 years old.

For over 20 years, Sarah has been selling cooked bowls of food at the Rally Town Market. Her children gave her money to start her business.  Sarah knows a lot about her business, which keeps customers coming back.  

Sarah plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 24,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy ingredients to cook with and bowls in which to serve food.  Her goal is to help her children and grand-children build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Sarah is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase cooking ingredients and bowls in which to serve cooked food.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 39 year old single mother of three children and the bread-winner in her family. She lives and conducts her business in Fort Portal, Uganda selling clothes, shoes, blankets and children's wear.  She started as a hawker of clothes, then rented a premises jointly with her sister, but with the help of a Hofokam loan, she managed to get her own full premises in which she operates alone.  Her dream is to sell clothes, shoes, blankets and children wear at wholesale to retailers.  She is using the loan to pay school fees for the children and add more clothes, shoes and children's wear stock in her business.

loans.use: Business inventory and school fees

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 33-year-old single mother of four children, who are between the ages of 3 and 16. All her children go to school. Josephine resides in and owns a three-roomed house where she is staying with six people. There is no electricity and piped water at home. Josephine takes care of additional family members. The family gets three meals a day. She resides in and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.

Josephine sells second-hand clothes in the Bwaise Market. She works seven days a week. She receives 12 customers a day. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. The major challenges she faces in her business are monthly market dues, medication, thieves, feeding the family and the increasing prices of clothes. 

Besides this clothing business, she also sells fruits. Josephine has been in this business for four years and with Kiva partner MCDT for five years. She is servicing her 11th loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of clothes. Josephine aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business structure.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes

loans.name: Bendiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bendiya est composé de femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et  4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux et résident dans le village de Sido, dans la préfecture de Bougouni,  troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Ces  femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce. 
Dans l’intention d’augmenter leur ressource financière et de faire assez de stocks enfin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce des condiments alimentaires. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de groupe et  tous les neuf  précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, 50 boites de 2kg de concentrée de tomate, 20 sacs de 25kg de sel de cuisine, 30 paquets de 100 morceaux de cube maggi, 100kg d’arachide qui sera transformé en pâte d’arachide et diverses autres qualités de condiments. Une partie des produits seront achetée auprès des grossistes de Bamako et l’autre partie sera achetée localement dans le village de Sido. Elles effectuent leurs ventes dans le grand marché de Sido à  une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes, en détail au comptant ou à crédit. 
Avec ce prêt les femmes comptent obtenir un bénéfice de 30.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé dans leur activité.
texts.en:
The Bendiya group is made up of married women with an average age of 32 and 4 children. They live in nuclear families with their husband and children in the town of Sido in the 3 administrative district of Mali, Bougouni. These women know each other through family and business relationships. With the intention of increasing their financial resources and to have enough back-stock to meet their clients needs, they have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution. Their business is selling food goods. They are on their 10th group loan. The previous nine were properly repaid. With this loan they count on buying 50 boxes of 2 kg tomato puree, 20 twenty five kg bags of kitchen salt, 30 packs of 100 count bouillon cubes, 100 kg of peanuts, they will make into peanut butter and a variety of other condiments. A portion of the product will be purchased wholesale in Bamako and the rest will be purchased locally in the town of Sido. They will conduct their sales at the main market in Sido to a clientele of primarily women, paid for in cash or with credit. WIth the loan the women count on earning a profit of 30.000 FCFA per month that will be used for their business.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of food condiments

loans.name: Rio De Oro Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Rio D. Oro inicia su cuarto ciclo con 23 socias. Las socias son del barrio D. Río Seco.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. cereales, abarrotes en general, animales menores, artesanía, ropa, frutas, verduras y L. mayor parte D. las socias se dedican a brindar el servicio D. bordado.
Como es el caso D. L. Señora Fabiana que es casada, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Fabiana tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, golosinas, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Fabiana se dedica al bordado D. correas, bolsas, vinchas, servicio que brinda a una empresa exportadora. Su préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. azúcar, jabón y detergentes. Los sueños D. Fabiana son estudiar cosmetología, surtir su tienda y que sus hijos estudien en L. universidad.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles haciendo un total D. 10,950 soles.
texts.en:
The “Rio D. Oro” (River of Gold) communal bank, composed of 23 members from the Rio Seco neighborhood, is in its 4th loan cycle The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities such as: cereal sales, general grocery sales, small farm animal raising, sale of crafts, clothing, fruits and vegetables; most of the members proviD. embroidery services. Such is the case of Fabiana, 43. She’s married, has three children and runs a grocery store from her home; she sells assorted groceries like snacks and beverages every day. In addition, Fabiana embroiders belts, purses, and hair bands for an exporting firm. She will use the funds to buy sugar, soap and detergents. Fabiana’s dream is to become a cosmetologist, stock her store and that her children go to university. The members need various loan amounts: 300, 600, and 900 soles totaling 10,950 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap and detergents.

loans.name: Ubaid
