texts.en:
A married father of 5 children, Ubaid was born in 1963 in Shahrinav district, where he currently lives. A farmer for 12 years, he has mastered farming techniques and always achieves good agricultural harvests, especially when the climatic conditions are favorable. The good yield, Ubaid realizes, is in general due to the seeds he uses. His current seeds have already been used for 3 years and are beginning to lose their productivity and need to be replaced by new ones. However, the lack of investment capital is his current problem. For this, Ubaid is asking for a loan of $3000 USD to buy selected seeds and fertilizers to revitalize his business. The improvement of his yield will give him the financial means to meet the needs of his family.
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase the seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

loans.name: Mala

texts.en:
Mala is a 27-year-old married woman living with her husband and two sons in Akurassa, part of the Galle area of Sri Lanka. She is a hard-working woman and enthusiastic. Her husband is also helps with the business.

Mala has managed her clothing business for one year. She has requested a 15,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to buy clothes for the business.

Mala is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her. Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy clothes for her business

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto tiene la actividad de venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio por lo que le ha gustado conversar con sus clientes, pues el siempre se esfuerza por proporcionar un buen servicio para no perder la clientela. El visita a muchas personas pues tiene que salir a ofrecer sus diferentes productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como cosméticos, perfumes, bolsos, sabanas, colonias entre otras cosas. Su deseo es obtener nuevos clientes y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto sells general merchandise, and he has had this business for more than 5 years. He enjoys conversing with his customers, and he is always striving to provide the best service so as to avoid losing customers. He visits many people because he has to go out to offer his different products. The loan he requests is to buy merchandise such as cosmetics, perfumes, handbags, bed sheets, colognes, and other things. He hopes to get new customers and expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy merchandise such as cosmetics, bags and perfumes

loans.name: Salome Monserrate

texts.es:
En un hermoso valle, lleno de tamarindos, se encuentra la capital de los manabitas, Portoviejo, una ciudad hermosa, habitada por gente muy sencilla y solidaria, gente trabajadora y forjadora de sueños, como  Salome.

 Ella se dedica a vender productos farmacéuticos en la ciudad de Portoviejo, como Alcohol, crema belladona, merthiolate entre otros, trabaja junto al esposo, él se encarga de hacer la entrega a farmacias, el negocio lo tiene en su casa y trabaja sobre pedidos, tiene un vehículo que le es de vital importancia a la hora de hacer las entregas de los productos, en lo que concierne a inversión según lo que se va vendiendo va pidiendo a los laboratorios  o a  la casa comercial con la cual trabajan, por ahora se le ha agotado el stock y con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir en surtir de nuevo su negocio, son 10 años ya  y según nos cuenta le va muy bien que no ha pensado en cambiarlo, está casada, su esposo es agente vendedor y también trabaja para un laboratorio, ella visita  las farmacias cada 15 o 30 días, deja a crédito, a pesar que tiene que  compra en efectivo todos los productos que necesita.

Sueña con hacer arreglos a su casa, es propia y por eso quiere hacerle mejoras que no vendrían nada mal afirma, también le gustaría viajar a otros países, conocer otras tierras y culturas.
texts.en:
You will find the capital of Los Manabitas, Portoviejo, in a beautiful valley full of tamarinds. It is a lovely city, which is inhabited by unassuming and supportive people. The people are hard-working and dream builders like Salome. She sells pharmaceutical products in the city of Portoviejo. She sells things like alcohol, belladonna cream, “Merthiolate” (an antiseptic), and other things. She works with her husband. He takes care of making the delivery to pharmacies. She has the business in her house, and she works filling orders. She has a vehicle, which is of vital importance to her when it is time to make delivery of the products. She requests items, according to what is selling, from laboratories or commercial houses that she works with. But now her stock is depleted. With the new loan she will be able to invest in stocking her business again. It has been ten years now. She tells us that it is going very well for her, and she has not thought of changing it. She is married, and her husband is a sales agent. He also works for a laboratory. She goes to the pharmacies every 15 or 30 days. She gives them credit even though she has to buy all of the products she needs for cash. She dreams of fixing up her house. It is her own, and she wants to make improvements so that nothing bad happens. She would also like to travel to other countries to know other lands and cultures.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy alcohol, hydrogen peroxide, creams, and antiseptic, etc.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Amalia R. le está haciendo falta los acabados del exterior de la casa pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material ya que uno de sus hijos de encargara de llevar acabo la obra. 
Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y así realizar la mejora antes que llegue la temporada de lluvias. 
Doña Amalia vive con ella uno de sus  hijo el joven Abraham Romero Reyna quien le ayuda a los gastos de la casa y quien se encargara de pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
The home of Sra. Amalia R. is lacking the exterior finishes, but she does not have the necessary funds at the moment to buy materials to complete the work. One of her sons will be in charge of finishing the job.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can make this improvement before the rainy season begins.

Doña Amalia lives with one of her sons, Abraham Romero Reyna, the young man who helps with the household expenses and will be responsible for repaying the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to complete the exterior of her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sweet peppers, yuca, bananas, and melons

loans.name: Sharofat's Group

texts.en:
Sharofat H. leads this loan group. She is 55 years old, married, and has two sons. One works in Russia, while the other works in construction with his father. Ten years ago Sharofat invested 10,000 soms in a business that sells fruits and vegetables, and now makes 5,000 soms per month. She will use her portion of this loan to buy more produce to sell to her customers. 

Karimahan A., 55, is a widow with two sons. One works in Russia and the other is a farmer. Five years ago, she used a 5,000 soms investment to go into business as a cook. She will use her portion of this new loan to buy a calf for breeding. 

Sapilahon S., 41, is married and has a daughter and a son. Her son is a student and her daughter makes dresses. Two years ago, she used 1,000 soms to begin making dresses and curtains. She now earns 3,000 soms a month, and has applied for a new loan to buy fabric to make more items to sell to her customers. 

Bubuyahon H. is the treasurer of this group. She is 38, married and has two sons and one daughter. Her sons are at school but her daughter is too young to enroll yet. Her husband works in Russia. She plans to use her portion of this loan to buy the materials she needs to do needed repairs to her house.  

Sapilahon B., 58, is a widow who has raised one son and two daughters, Her son works in construction and her daughters are married and live with their families. Eleven years ago, she took a 3,000 som investment to go into business selling fruits and vegetables.  She now makes 4,000 soms a month, and plans to use her portion of this loan to buy potatoes and cucumbers to sell to her customers.  In the future, she plans to expand her business and start repairing her house. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the three principles of People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (being environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and see a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Youmina

texts.en: Youmina A. makes a living selling sorghum, millet and other items and has applied for a loan to buy more millet to sell to her customers. She is 49 years old and married to a policeman. She has five children, all of whom go to school.  With the extra profits made possible by this loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar to sell beverages that are popular locally.

loans.use: to buy more millet to sell to her customers

loans.name: Tabaksneh Group

texts.en:
These are microentrepreneurs from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, seeking a loan of 1,500,000 leones each to enable them to expand their businesses. With their loan, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses and make more sales and profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living, send their children to school and feed and clothe them. 

Mohamed D. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. Mohamed was born in one of the villages that make up Sanda, near Makeni. This 41-year-old is married and has three children:  two in secondary school and one in primary school. Mohamed sells slippers and has been managing this business for countless years. With his share of the loan, he will buy dozens of slippers to add to his current stock. 

Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy dozens of slippers

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has a mixed farm in Murang'a town in central Kenya that produces coffee. She has been farming for 20 years and employs one farmhand. She sells her coffee through a cooperative society in her location.

She has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of the amount of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to expand her poultry farm. She says the income from this project will improve the livelihood of her family. Her biggest challenge is the changes in climatic conditions that affect poultry. She hopes to expand her poultry farm in the future by rearing as many chickens as possible.

Susan is 50 years old and a single mother of two children, ages 21 and 22.

loans.use: To expand her poultry farm

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: La señora María Mercedes tiene 30 años, ella es casada,  y tiene dos menores de edad a su cargo. Maria se tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general, cabe señalar tiene ocho años de tener este negocio y también posee una clientela ya establecida en su comarca. La mayoría de sus ventas son al contado, sin embargo también realiza ventas a crédito. Este negocio nació por la necesidad de incrementar los ingresos familiares, para mejorar económicamente. Ella desea invertir este crédito en la compra de camisas, faldas, cosméticos, toallas, sabanas y calzado. El préstamo mejorara sus ganancias. Su sueño es tener otro medio de ingreso para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Mercedes is 30 years old, married, and has two youngsters under her care. María’s business is selling general merchandise and it is worth noting that she has had this business for eight years and has an established customer base in her area. The majority of her sales are paid for in cash, but she also makes sales on credit. This business was born out of the necessity to increase family earnings to improve financially.

María wants to invest this loan in the purchase of shirts, skirts, cosmetics, towels, sheets and shoes, which will improve her earnings. Her dream is to have another form of income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa María tiene 21 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en un sector urbano – marginal del distrito de La Victoria, una zona ubicada cerca a la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de jugos en un puesto de venta ubicado en el Mercado Modelo de la ciudad de Chiclayo (el mercado de abastos mas grande de la zona). Ella atiende en su negocio durante las mañanas y se vale del mismo para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. El negocio cuenta con buena acogida debido a la calidad del servicio brindado.

Rosa María desea realizar algunas mejoras en su domicilio para prevenir algunos daños que puedan presentarse producto de las lluvias que suelen presentarse en verano . Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una joven emprendedora y que desea lo mejor para su familia. Por ello se esfuerza diariamente trabajando para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa María is 21 years old, married, and resides with her family in a marginalized urban sector in the District of La Victoria, which is located near the city of Chiclayo.

For the past year, Rosa María has been selling juices from a vending post located at the Modelo Market in the city of Chiclayo (which happens to be the largest food market in the area). She manages her business in the mornings and also helps her husband with the family finances. Her business has been well-received because of the quality of service that she provides.

Rosa María wants to make some improvements to her home that will prevent any damages that could occur from the summer rains. Therefore, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN.

Rosa María is an enterprising young woman who wants the best for her family. For this reason, she strives each in her work to get ahead.

loans.use: Pay for home improvements

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es:
El Señor Ariel S. O., El cliente curso hasta 4to. de Secundaria, es soltero y no tiene hijos, el trabaja en el magisterio en como profesor de primaria, e dedica al servicio de moto taxista en Ivirgarzama hace mas de 1 año, El vive solo ya como 4 años, es de escasos recursos ya que trabaja como chofer de moto taxi, el está afiliado al sindicato de moto taxista "CARRASCO", el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

 Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una, es por eso que solicita el crédito para ser independiente y poder tener su propia herramienta de trabajo y de esta forma poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida.

 Cabe señalar que el señor Ariel S. O. se apersono a solicitar su préstamo luego de que sus compañeros de trabajo le  comentaron de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Sr. Ariel S. O. completed his education through the fourth year of high school. He is single and does not have children. Ariel works as an elementary school teacher, but he also has been providing his services as a motorcycle taxi driver in Ivirgarzama for more than a year. He has already lived on his own for four years and has limited resources from his job as a motorcycle taxi driver. Ariel is affiliated with the Carrasco taxi drivers union. The service he provides is profitable because he has many people in need of this form of transportation for its ease, speed, and efficiency. The union has stops and routes for each of its members at different points within the town of Ivirgarzama where people are requesting this service.

This is the first loan Ariel will receive from CIDRE. It will be used to purchase a motorcycle. He is requesting this loan so that he can be independent and have his own vehicle to use for work. This will help him provide better service to his customers and allow him to earn more income as well as improve his quality of life.

It should be noted that Sr. Ariel S. O. showed up to apply for his loan after his co-workers told him about the good credit terms being offered by CIDRE.

loans.use: Purchase a new vehicle for his work

loans.name: Ambrocio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Ambrocio; el tiene 50 años de edad y es casado y tiene 5 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de verduras, el tiene un pequeño terreno donde siembra maíz, papa y verduras y luego los vende en diferentes ferias de la provincia de Anta, el socio quiere mejorar las tierras de cultivo. 

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ambrocio belongs to “Los Líderes” (The Leaders) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Ambrocio is 50 years old.  He is married and has 5 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business buying and selling vegetables.  He has a small plot of land where he grows corn, potatoes and vegetables which he then sells in different markets in Anta province.  He would like to improve the plot of land where he grows his crops.

He is grateful to those who will take part in his dream by funding his loan and pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for the plot where he grows his crops

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es: Milagros, de 37 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Manuel de 38 años, que es minero y de sus 4 hijos menores de edad. Cada día esta emprendedora mujer se despierta muy temprano para atender a sus hijos, además abre su tienda que esta ubicada en su casa. En su negocio brinda el servicio de corte de cabello y peinados, por lo que esta muy satisfecha porque obtiene regulares ganancias, y como es tranquilo no descuida la crianza de sus hijos, que aún son muy pequeños. Además de este negocio instaló en el mismo lugar una pequeña vitrina donde ofrece útiles escolares, y también, desde hace 2 años, realiza el servicio de fotocopias, y ambos negocios tienen bastante acogida porque en su zona no hay competencia. Por todos sus logros esta muy satisfecha y tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de surtir mejor su tienda e implementar su salón de belleza con mejores instrumentos de peluquería. Es el  primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Milagros tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de juguetes pues quiere surtir mejor su vitrina para aprovechar esta campaña navideña que ya se encuentra próxima, además tiene varios pedidos pendientes.
texts.en: Thirty-seven-year-old Milagros lives in her own home with her husband, Manuel, who is 38 years old and a miner, and their four young children.  Each day this enterprising woman wakes up very early to take care of her children and open her store, which is located in her home.  She cuts and styles hair; she is very pleased with this work because it gives her a steady income.  Since she is relaxed, she is able to properly care for her children, who are still very young.  She also installed a small glass case from which she displays school supplies, and, for the last two years, she has provided photocopy service.  Both of these businesses have been doing well because there is no competition nearby.  She is very satisfied with her accomplishments and has many plans for the future, such as more comprehensive inventory for her store and more equipment for her beauty salon.  This is her first loan from MFP (local lending institution), and she promises to make her payments on time.  She doesn't want to disappoint those who have made it possible for her to continue working and seeking progress.  Milagros plans to invest this loan in a large number of toys to better supply her store and take advantage of this Christmas season.  Also, she already has several orders.

loans.use: Purchase a large number of toys to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica tiene 38 años, vive con su 3 hijos en su casa propia. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura ya que desde su niñez, siempre ha cultivado papa, habas maíz y otros productos nativos de la zona.  Siendo esta actividad apoyada por sus hijos, tanto en la siembra como en la cosecha, En ocasiones cuando el trabajo requiere de mucho esfuerzo, contrata peones para dicha tarea. Sin embargo ha tenido problemas en la cosecha debido al mal tiempo que se presentaba perjudicándolo. Para el futuro espera mejorar e intensificarse en la agricultura. Es su crédito número 2 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece  a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y el pago de alquiler de yunta (instrumento de madera que se utiliza para remover la tierra) que los usará para su tiempo de siembra.
texts.en:
Mónica is 38 years old.  She lives with her three children in her own home.  She has been farming all her life, since she was a child.  She has always grown potatoes, beans, corn and other products which are native to the area.  She is supported in her business by her children, both in sowing her crops and in harvesting.  Occasionally, when the work requires a lot of effort, she hires laborers for the task.

Mónica has had problems with her harvest owing to the bad weather which the area has had, damaging her crops.  In the future, she hopes to improve and intensify her farming.  This is her second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She likes being a member of her community bank because she knows all the members and they are responsible and very supportive of each other.  Mónica would like to thank everybody who will help make her loan possible since it will be very useful to her and help her make progress in her business activity.  She will invest her loan in buying sacks of manure and paying to hire a yoke (a wooden instrument which is used to turn over the land).  She will use it at sowing time.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and to pay to hire a yoke

loans.name: Javzandulam

texts.en:
Javzandulam J. is 36 years old.  She lives with her husband and two children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia.  The family live in their own house on their own fenced lot.  Both of her two daughters attend a local school. 

Javzandulam and her husband operate a meat trading business in their town. They started this business in 1996 in Zanabazar market in their town.  Since 2007, they have been traveling to the countrysides to sell their meat. For delivery, they are using own car.  Javzandulam hopes to continue her success, and for the future wants to buy new car for her meat business. 

Javzandulam  is a responsible and hardworking woman. She needs more funds to buy a large amount of meat at whole sale price. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to sell

loans.name: Las Colibris Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en el negocio de la de la Sra. Piedad R., una integrante del grupo  Las Colibrís, que esta ubicado en el Estado de Morelos en  México, en la fotografía se ve el horno rustico que utiliza para hacer el pan, es un horno  hecho de ladrillo y barro, utiliza leña para hornear el pan. Ella se dedica a la venta de pan,  negocio que inicio hace 20 años junto con su esposo, en sus inicios  rentaban el local donde hacían el pan, ahora ya tienen un local propio,  Solicita el préstamo para comprar una batidora y unas charolas para colocar el  pan. Sus clientes se sienten contentos porque siempre los atiende con amabilidad y el sabor especial que tiene su pan casero. Al momento de solicitar el préstamo se siente contenta porque tendrá su batidora con lo que podrá aumentar la producción. Tiene 40 años de edad estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria es casada tiene 2 hijas una casada de 20 años y la menor de 13 años. Con las ganancias de su negocio desea seguir dándole estudios a su hija para que llegue a tener una carrera.El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in Piedad R.' business.  Piedad is a member of the 'Las Colibrís' (Hummingbirds) group which is located in the State of Morelos in Mexico.  In the photograph you can see the rustic oven that she uses to make her bread.  The oven is made from brick and mud and runs on firewood.  Piedad's business is selling bread.  She has been in this business, together with her husband, for 20 years.  Originally, they used to rent the premises in which they made their bread but now they own their own premises.

Piedad is requesting this loan to buy a mixer and some trays on which she can place her bread.  Her customers are happy because she always serves them with kindness and they enjoy the special flavor of her home-made bread.  At the moment of requesting this loan, Piedad feels happy because she knows that she will get her mixer which will help her to increase her production.

Piedad is 40 years old and studied up to the third year of high school.  She is married and has two daughters.  Her eldest daughter is 20 years old and married, and her younger daughter is 13.  Piedad would like to use the profits from her business to continue providing her daughter with an education so that she can eventually become a professional.  This group has 10 members.

loans.use: To buy electrical appliances for making bread

loans.name: Genara Marcelina

texts.es: Genara tiene su actividad económica que acopio y pesca artesanal. Por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de generar ingresos para su negocio, este no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos por lo que se encuentra muy contenta por lo que han sido gratificantes. Por lo que su inicio los realiza desde 8 años, por lo que no tenía un trabajo estable que le proporcionara ingresos. Ella se levanta temprano para realizar los quehaceres del hogar y realizar la venta ambulante de sus productos. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima. El sueño de Genara es tener un lugar propio para ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en: Genara has a trapping and fishing business. She has always looked for a way to generate an income for through her business. It is not the first time she has accessed a loan and she is very happy with the past experiences because they have been successful. She started her business 8 years ago when she did not have a stable employment to generate an income. She starts her day early in the morning to do the house work and sell her products itinerantly. The loan she requests is to purchase merchandise. Genara's dream is to have a store of her own from where to sell her products.

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, all of whom go to school. For the last 28 years, she has made a living by selling clothes, working six days a week in a small shop. She is applying for this loan from MCDT SACCO, for 800,000 Ugandan Shillings, to buy more clothing to sell and also to begin selling beverages such as soda and piped water. She will use the additional income made possible by this loan to buy food, and pay school feels and the rent for her house, which has electricity and piped-in water. The main challenge she faces is the seasonality of her business. Her long-term goal is to build rental houses, because this is a far less seasonable business.

loans.use: To buy new items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Cecilia del Carmen M. S. ella es trabajadora activa de una entidad estatal desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación  Primaria tiene treinta    años  de trabajar para esta institución  como docente, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  seis créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para invertirle a una pequeña pulpería  que acaba de poner en su casa, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cecilia del Carmen M. S. has worked as an Elementary School Teacher for 30 years in a state school.  She has two school age children.

She’s had six Ceprodel loans that she’s used to buy building materials and supplies like: sand, cement, stone, gravel, concrete blocks, etc. to enlarge her house.  She’s asking for this loan to invest in a small grocery store she’s just recently installed in her house.

Ceprodel loans have been of great benefit for her because they have improved her and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy basic grains for her grocery store.

loans.name: Rizza Joy

texts.en:
Rizza Joy A. is from the village of Namnama, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 18 years old and single. To make a living, Rizza Joy has a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She is just starting this business.

In 2011, Rizza Joy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Rizza Joy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Enkhbaatar

texts.en: Enkhbaatar is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a small wooden house, which he recently build on his own land. Enkhbaatar's wife, Naranchimeg, is 40 and operates a clothes retail business from a rented stall at the market. His two children attend a local secondary school. Enkhbaatar has been running a transportation business for the last five years. He transports coal, firewood and construction materials. He is a very hardworking, optimistic person whose goal is to extend his business and provide his children with a good education. Enkhbaatar is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase some construction materials to finish the house that he recently built.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to finish his house

loans.name: Las Dalias Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS DALIAS” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva, de la que es secretaria de actas la señora Susana. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de alfombras y edredones, venta de CD’s, venta de frutas, pensión, tejido de cubrecamas, mandiles y chompas, venta de comida.

La señora Susana,  indica que hace dos ciclos que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de los asesores y compañeras de su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de chompas a máquina, el que lo realiza en su C.. Nos cuenta también, que ella aprendió este negocio en la C. de su tía y lo viene realizando hace un año atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para forma un capital de lana (materia prima para sus productos), este material lo comprará de la calle Max Paredez  (lugar comercial de la ciudad de La paz). Posterior a la elaboración de sus productos los comercializará de forma ambulante, ya que ella no cuenta con un puesto fijo.; los lugares son indistintos, pero en su mayoría en la Ceja (zona comercial de la ciudad de El Alto) o cerca de los colegios. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.

En la foto, hay una persona que acompaña al grupo, es la hermana de la señora María, pero cuando se les saco la foto prefiere darse la vuelta.
texts.en:
“LAS DALIAS” community bank is about to start its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación regional office.  This group has nine members and is managed by a board of directors.  The group's secretary is Susana.  The businesses that the women are engaged in are varied and include: selling rugs and comforters, selling CDs, selling fruit, running a small restaurant, knitting bedspreads, aprons and sweaters, and selling meals.

Susana tells us that this is her second loan cycle with Pro Mujer.  She joined through an invitation from the organization's advisers and some friends from her area.  Susana's business is machine knitting sweaters at home.  She tells us that she learned this business in her aunt's home and has been carrying it out for one year.

Susana's current loan will be used to buy yarn (raw material for her products).  She buys her yarn in Max Paredez Street (a commercial area in the city of La Paz).  After making her products, she sells them as an itinerant street vendor because she doesn't have a fixed sales location.  She sells mainly in La Ceja (a commercial area of the city of El Alto) or near schools.  This work allows her to make money to support her family.  She lives with her partner and has one child.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training.

In the photo, there is an additional person accompanying the group.  This is María's sister but when the photo was taken she preferred to turn her head.

loans.use: to buy yarn

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto L. Martínez vive en Pérez Zeledón, tiene 43 años y es conocido  por ser amante del ganado.
Hace poco don Gilberto compro 4 hectáreas sembradas  de pasto, con el fin de tener su propio ganado, es por eso que el necesita un préstamo de ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de  terneros de engorde para su finca.
El es socio de la empresa de Crédito Comunal Bancruce una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Gilberto L. Martínez lives in Pérez Zeledón, is 43 years old and is known for being a lover of livestock. A little while ago, Gilberto bought four hectares of grass with the goal of having his own livestock. That is why he needs a loan of ₡500 000 (five-hundred thousand colones) to purchase calves to fatten for his farm.

He is a member of the loan company Bancruce Communal Bank, which is one of the 110 member companies of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy calves.

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es:
Marlene del Socorro ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de algunos materialies de construcción tales como zinc, perlines y el pago de la mano de obra para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que así lo requiere debido a que los fenómenos naturales la han ido maltratando poco a poco y hoy en día requiere ser mejorada.

Ella espera muy confiadamene y paciente la aprobación del crédito porque con éste se beneficiará no solo ella sino también su familia que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Marlene del Socorro has approached CEPRODEL to ask for a loan to purchase some construction materials such as zinc and beams and to pay for labor. She wants to improve her living conditions, since due to weather and natural disasters her home has been mistreated over time and now requires improvements.

She waits patiently and is very confident that the loan will be approved since this will benefit not only her but also her family whom she loves.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as zinc and beams, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en: Benita, 53 years of age, is married to a driver. They are blessed with two children. Benita rents gowns in their village. She has wedding gowns, party gowns, and ordinary gowns in her boutique. She has operated her rental business for almost 27 years. Her monyhly net income is 6,000 PHP. She's asking for a loan for 18,000 PHP to purchase additional gowns to rent. Her loans in the past have been extremely helpful in providing her family's daily needs. She hopes that Kiva lenders will continue to support her.

loans.use: To purchase additional gowns to rent

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 29 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with two children. Edna works in the fish industry, catching and selling fish for a living. She has been doing this for six years. She has requested a loan to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix, a 34-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda, has operated a pub for three years; in spite of its small size it has enjoyed tremendous growth in sales over that time. Bad debtors are his major business hardship.

Felix intends to use the loan to buy crates of beer to sell at his pub, and he aspires both to venture into a wholesale business and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer to sell at his pub.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Joayhu Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Joayhu está integrado por 10 mujeres de la ciudad de Santaní. Ellas se unieron con miras a obtener un poco más de ingresos para sus casas. Ellas trabajan dentro de un ambiente de colaboración reciproca y solidaria.
Ellas se definen como mujeres cabezas de familia que luchan día a día por mejorar el estilo de vida de sus respectivas familias.
La Sra. Felicia se dedica a la cría de animales de todo tipo, gracias a este trabajo ella consigue los ingresos para mantener a su familia. Dice que todo lo que hace es por proporcionarle a su familia una vida digna y decorosa. Ella sueña con tener un establecimiento más grande donde albergar a mas crías.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de más animales, como así también para los alimentos de los mismos. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le está brindando.
texts.en:
The Joayhu committee is made up of 10 ladies from the city of Santaní.  They got together so that they could get a little more income for their households.  They work together within an atmosphere of mutual cooperation.

They define themselves as heads of their households who struggle daily to improve their families’ quality of life.

Felicia raises all types of animals and thanks to this work she obtains the income she needs to support her family.  She says that she does it all so that she can give her family a dignified way of life.  She dreams of having a larger establishment where she can house more animals.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy more animals and also be able to feed them.  She is grateful to the foundation for the opportunity they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy livestock and feed.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 29 year old a single mother of two children, ages twelve and  ten. She has been running a butchery for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 15,000 which she uses to support her children’s needs.

Beatrice is applying for her first loan from KADET  LTD,after being introduced by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to buy goats and  a cow for her stock.

With the anticipated profit from the business Beatrice hopes to open a green grocer. Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children, buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy goats and a cow for her stock

loans.name: God's Power Group

texts.en:
Friday is 21 years old and has a natural buoyancy and good-humored spirit that strikes people. He exudes nothing but confidence and good humor. Even at his young age, Friday has already started a butcher shop in one of the biggest trading centers in Mubende. He says that is it more worthwhile to engage in a profit-making business venture than in the counterproductive activities of many of his peers. Friday sells goat, beef, and chicken meat and his products sell well. Before opening his shop, he sold bananas. He has been running his business for three years and has learned a lot of the nitty-gritty of doing business. Friday purchases most of his meat in bulk so that he never runs short and is able to cope with high demand. His daily business returns are 600,000 UGX.

Friday is requesting a loan to purchase more meat and also construct a small kiosk to sell food.

loans.use: to purchase meat and construct a small kiosk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy glue and hard paper to make shoe boxes

loans.name: Glenda Dalila

texts.es: Glenda Dalila D. veintidós años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta D. comida en el lugar D. su residencia, es muy conocida en la localidad pues los platillos que prepara tienen un sabor inigualable prepara ricos desayunos y almuerzos, todo la comida es D. muy buena calidad. Glenda tiene buenos precios  y su lugar D. trabajo es totalmente higiénico, además el servicio que ofrece es excelente, siempre los recibe con gran alegría y amabilidad; para ella la motivación D. superarse la ayudó a comenzar pero ahora el habito D. trabajar le permite continuar, quiere ver crecer su negocio y no cuenta con dinero propio y es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima granos básicos, carnes, verduras, lácteos, embutidos, entre otros que compra semana a semana para la preparación D. sus ricos platillos. Glenda Dalila tiene la confianza D. que su trabajo le permitirá darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Glenda Dalila is 22 years old and owns a house where she lives with her life partner. She sells food from her home and is known locally for her dishes that have a unique flavor. Glenda prepares delicious breakfasts and lunches. All of her food is of high quality. She offers good prices and her work area is kept completely sanitary. In the addition, the service she offers is excellent since she always welcomes her customers with great joy and kindness. The motivation to succeed has driven her to press forward, but now she wants her work habits to continue by growing her business. Glenda does not have money of her own, which is why she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral.

This loan will be used to buy basic grains, meats, vegetables, dairy products, sausages, and other products that she uses week after week for preparing her delicious dishes. Glenda Dalila is confident that her work will allow her to proviD. her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meats, vegetables, dairy products, sausages, and other products.

loans.name: Mehrikhon

texts.ru: Мехрихон трудолюбивая и ответственная  женщина. Она занимается куплей абрикосовых ядер и продает их с наценкой 10% в основном на рынке сухофруктов. Муж Мехрихон в России, у нее три несовершеннолетних детей. Они помогают ей в сортировке сухофруктов, когда начинается сезон. Муж Мехрихон переводит с России  деньги семье, на эти деньги она купила дом. Мехрихон заботливая мать и жена она помогает мужу тем, что обеспечивает семью. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес, поэтому она хотела бы получить займ в размере 1000$ США. Мехрихон благодарит за понимание и поддержку.
texts.en: Mehrikhon is a hard-working and responsible woman.  She buys apricot kernels and sells them at a 10% add-on primarily at a dried fruits market.  Her husband is in Russia, and they have three adolescent children.  They help Mehrikhon with sorting dried fruits during the season.  Mehrikhon's husband wires money to the family from Russia, and Mehrikhon bought a house with this money.  She is a caring mother and wife, and she helps her husband by providing for the family.  She wants to expand her business and wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1000 for this purpose.  Mehrikhon is grateful for the understanding and support.

loans.use: to buy apricot kernels

loans.name: Linda Azucena

texts.es:
Linda de 28 años, una mujer muy trabajadora que se desempeña por lo que hace.
Ella inicio su negocio debido a que el sector donde vive no existía ninguna papelería, entonces ella se decidió poner este negocio.

Trabaja con la ayuda de su mama, ya que su mama le ayuda a controlar sus niños mientras ella trabaja.
La dificultad de ella es la delincuencia y el lugar donde alquila el local. El sueño de ella es tener su propio su local.

Ella solicita el préstamo para invertir en cuadernos, papeleria y asi agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Linda is 28 years old.  She is a very hard-working woman who does her work well.  She opened her business because, in the area where she lives, there wasn't a stationery store.   She decided, therefore, to set up this kind of business.  

Linda works with the help of her mom as her mom helps her to look after her children while she is working.  The difficulties that she faces are crime and the place where she rents her premises.  Her dream is to own her own premises.

Linda is requesting this loan to invest in composition books and stationery supplies, so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy composition books, erasers and scissors

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows to rear.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana María es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Con Futuro. Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali. Tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos.
Lleva un año trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos,  se dedica  a la venta  de pasamanería, negocio que lo realiza en su casa, acondicionó parte de su sala para poner su pequeño negocio, su hija es la que le ayuda cuando no va al colegio. 
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 caja de mentol, 1caja de vinagre bullí, i caja de betún, 1 caja de hisopos, 3 tiras de champú, 1 caja de lapiceros, 1 docena de esmalte, ½ docena de coloretes.
Son cosas que tiene más salida y que no deben faltar en su negocio, que aun es pequeño pero lo está surtiendo cada vez que saca su préstamo.
Con su negocio puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, porque él trabaja  en una compañía que esta fuera de la ciudad, y lo ven cada fin de mes que es cuando viene a cobrar.
texts.en:
Señora Ana María is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Con Futuro, of the Calleria district in the department of Ucayali. She is 44 years old and has 4 children. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos loans for the last year. She sells ornamental trimmings for garments, a business she runs from home where she converted part of her lounge to install her small business. Her daughter helps her when she isn't at school.

With her new loan of S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles (PEN) she will buy 1 carton of menthol, 1 carton of boiled vinegar, 1 carton of shoe polish, 1 carton of ball-point pens, 1 carton of cotton buds, 1 dozen bottles of nail polish, 1/2 dozen boxes of rouge.

These are products that have a big outlet and should not be missing from her business, which although small she is stocking more with each loan she takes. WIth her business she can help her husband with the household expenses because he works at a company that is out of town and they see him at the end of every month which when he comes to be paid.

loans.use: to buy a carton of menthol, 1 carton of boiled vinegar, 1 box of cotton buds, 3 strips of shampoo, 1 carton of ball-point pens, etc.

loans.name: Guguli

texts.en:
Guguli is 60 years old, married and lives with her husband, Jemal in the village of Bobokvati, Georgia.  Guguli and Jemali are retired and their pensions and agriculture are their main sources of income.  

They have a milk cow and citrus garden on a 0.3 hectare piece of family owned land.  They sell dairy products and citrus at the local market.  Their average monthly income is 500 Laris. 

Guguli will use the loan to pay expenses related to harvesting a citrus crop (purchase boxes for storing harvested products, paying the workforce).  Also, part of the loan will purchase hay used to feed their milk cow during winter months.

loans.use: to purchase hay for milk cow and citrus harvest expenses.

loans.name: Kikai Complex Group

texts.en:
Pamela is the facilitator of the Kikai Complex group. Her group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Pamela takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices. In the recent 2011 season, Pamela had an excellent maize yield harvesting seven and a half bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Pamela was only able to harvest three and a half bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Pamela and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Pamela will invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Kikai Complex group will each plant maize plots between half and one acre of land.
In the photograph above, Pamela is pictured with her group members. The field officer appears on the far left of the picture.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Aleja

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”HUCHUY QOSQO”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Lamay en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Aleja;  La socia tiene 38 años de edad, la socia es casada, la socia tiene 4 hijos de 20, 17, 11, 5 meses de edad; la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de calzados, la socia tiene un stand en Calca en el exhibe sus diferentes calzados para damas, caballeros, niños, la socia trae de la ciudad del Cusco al por mayor y los vende en su stand, ella abre todos los días excepto los domingos porque desea pasar con sus familia, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y se esfuerza mucho para sacar adelante su hogar, ella administra la economía y distribuye los refrigerios y pasajes para todos en casa, la socia suele viajar cada 15 o 30 días para Cusco muy temprano por la mañana para traer la mercadería. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir el pago total de su mercadería y de este modo poder implementar para tener listos en la feria navideña.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "HUCHUY QOSQO” communal bank.  The communal  bank is located in the district of Lamay in the province of Calca and department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Aleja.  She is 38 years old and married.  She has four children, aged 20, 17, 11 and 5 months.  The member works buying and selling shoes; she has a stall in Calca where she displays a variety of shoes for women, men and children.  The member gets the shoes at wholesale in the city of Cusco, and sells them at her stall.  She is open daily except for Sundays, which she wants to spend with her family.

The member is a very hard-working woman who puts in great effort to move her family ahead in life.  She manages the finances for her household, and distributes snacks and tickets for everyone in her home.  The member usually travels to Cusco once or twice a month to get her merchandise, leaving very early in the morning.  

The member is requesting the loan to invest in full payment for her merchandise, and in this way to be able to put in place what she needs to be ready for the Christmas holidays.

The member is grateful for the loan and agrees to comply with her repayments in accordance with the repayment schedule..

loans.use: to invest in full payment for her merchandise, and in this way to be able to put in place what she needs to be ready for the Christmas holidays.

loans.name: Tunas Rahayu Group

texts.en: After succeeding at the last loan, Ni Putu is continuing to take out a loan from MUK, The loan will be used to purchase two superior piglets. With the last breed, she earned enough profit to supplement her family income. Because of the business, Ni Putu could provide the needs of her children's education. She hopes she can save more for future needs.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets.

loans.name: Remedios  Teresita

texts.es:
La señora Remedios  se dedica  a la venta de joyería desde hace un año ella nos cuenta  que le gusta mucho su negocio por que le deja buenas ganancias y sale a localidades vecinas a ofrecer su mercancía.
Esta  felizmente casada con el señor José Luis con quien tiene dos hijos  por quien trabaja y lucha cada día.
Ellas nos cuentan que  también  vende cosas usadas  y fierro viejo  ya que también  le deja buenas ganancias.
Pidió el préstamo para comprar más joyería para la venta como es: anillos, cadenas, esclavas, gargantillas y pulseras.
Le da las gracias a fundación por apoyarla en los momentos más difíciles de su vida.
texts.en: Remedios has sold jewelry for the past year. She says she is really enjoying her business because she is making good profits and she goes to neighboring towns to offer her merchandise. She is happily married to José Luis, with whom she has two children whom she works and fights for every day. She says that she also sells used goods and scrap metal because it earns good money. She is requesting the loan to purchase more jewelry, such as rings, chains, bracelets and necklaces. She is thankful for the support during a difficult time in her life.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Vanessa Alexandra

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo que se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de la ciudad de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su artesanía como  los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Vanessa, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 8, 6 y 2 años de edad, los  dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es controlador de un bus.

Ella es una muy buena esposa que  para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también trabaja a base de pedidos que le realizan  sus clientes. Trabaja tres días de la semana pero sobre todo por las mañanas ya que a estas horas aprovecha que sus hijos están en la escuela y ya en la tardes no sale porque tiene que ayudar a sus hijos con las tareas de la escuela.  Deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita, lleva dos años dedicada al comercio y le ha ido bien con sus ventas.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que su negocio ha estado muy bueno y mucho más en este último mes, razón por lo cual necesita de mucha urgencia del crédito para ir a comprar más mercadería  como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños ya que tiene varios pedidos y espera quedar bien para ganar más clientela. Ella en  los pagos no tuvo ningún problema y que  le gusta cumplir para seguir adelante con los créditos, con lo que gano del crédito anterior hizo varios arreglos en su cocina con lo cual ha mejorado mucho su vida, ella siempre utiliza sus ganancias para mejoras en su hogar.

Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 6 ciclos  y le gusta porque es muy fácil conseguir los créditos.

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo” (Toward Development with Love and Faith) meets every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its rich culture and its handicrafts. For example, its straw hats are known within and outside of the country.

Here we met Sra. Vanessa who is 24 years old, married, and has three children (ages 8, 5, and 2). The two older children are in school. Her husband is a bus driver.

Vanessa is a good wife who helps her husband with the household expenses by selling clothing of all types. She sells by going door-to-door and taking orders from her customers. Vanessa works three days a week, but only in the mornings so that she can take advantage of the time while her children are at school. She does not sell in the afternoons so that she can help her children with their schoolwork. Vanessa extends credit to her customers and collects payment at the end of the week. She travels to Guayaquil to purchase her merchandise as often as needed. Vanessa has been in business for two years and has done very well with her sales.

She is taking out another loan because her business has done very well and even more so in the last month, so she wanted to get an urgent loan to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes since she has several orders to fill and she wants to live up to expectation so she can gain more customers.  She has never had a problem making payments on the loan and is committed to making payments on time so she can take out future loans.  She used the earnings from the last loan to fix up her kitchen which has improved her lifestyle.  She always uses the money she earns to carry out home improvement. She has been with the Communal Bank for six loan cycles and likes being a member because the loans are very easy to obtain. Her dream is to give her children the best she can.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Mr Koffi âgé de 40ans,IL est père de 03 enfants qui sont scolarisés et il marié à une revendeuse. Il exerce comme activité la vente des plaquettes de télévision depuis 2004 et s'approvisionne généralement dans la zone portuaire. Manquant de liquidité pour renforcer son activité, il fait son second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des plaquettes de télévision afin de revendre aux clients. Il espère dans un  avenir  proche avoir une boutique pour augmenter ses activités et assurer l'épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Koffi, who is 40 years old, is father to three children who are at school and married to a retailer. He has been selling television brochures since 2004 and generally gets his supplies in the port area. As he does not have sufficient liquidity to boost his business, he is taking a second loan from WAGES so that he can buy television brochures to sell to his customers. He hopes in the future to have a shop to increase his activities and he also wants to see his family flourish.

loans.use: to buy television brochures.

loans.name: Ruqiya

texts.en: Day by day increasing expenditures compelled Ruqiya  to initiate her own business selling animals. She is 46 years old, married woman doing business  with the help of her son(also shown in the photo). Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 6 children. She is working very hard for providing her family with the basic necessities of life. She has requested a Murabaha loan of 35000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers

loans.name: Nureddin

texts.en:
Nureddin is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Xodjali. He settled with his family in Absheron region Binegedi shosse. He is 24,  married,  has a child. He is hard worker, has own grocery.  In the beginning his business he sold the greens. He borrowed the loan amount of $400 to be engaged in sale of greens. For the second time he borrowed the loan of amount $1000 to start the sale of agricultural produce. 
He applies for the loan $1800 to expand the area of his grocery  and to increase  the agricultural produce assortments

loans.use: To expand the area of his grocery

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai is 34, and her husband Quang is 36. They have one child who is a student in junior high school. They have no land, but have rented 7,000 square meters from a neighbor. Hai's husband cultivates the papaya trees daily, plus a few kinds of vegetables. Hai is in charge of selling them at the local market.

At the present time their current papaya crop is ready for harvest. Their main income from produce is about $9 per person/month. Now they plan to expand and improve their papaya production, so they need a loan of $75 in order to buy the papaya seeds and some fertilizer. After they learned about the Kiva program from the staff of Mekong Plus, they hoped that they would B. given a loan so that they could initiate their plan. They promise to repay monthly.

loans.use: To purchase papaya seeds and some fertilizer in to expand and improve their papaya productivity

loans.name: Eremen

texts.en: A 33 years young dynamic woman, Mrs. Eremen R. speaks with zealousness when talking about the impact of LAPO loans on her business.  She is married with five (5) children, and says that ‘money is business’.  She knows this from the changes she experienced when she got her first loan from LAPO.  She is now requesting a loan of $400 to expand her business.

loans.use:
To buy more crates of drinks &
provisions to sell.

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en: Mrs. Chorn S. is 27 years old and is a street-vendor, selling men's and women's clothes near Ta Prum temple, where many tourists and local people pass by. With this business activity, Chorn S. can typically make up to $10 each day, while her husband works for a tourist company and earns around $6 a day. Chorn S. has recently requested a loan that will allow her to increase her inventory by adding more fashionable clothes to satisfy her clients’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for her inventory to meet her clients' demands

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo Valdez is 59 years old, married to Venancia Aquino, and father of four children who are all married.

Domingo sells mandioca, also known as yuca. It is a root plant very commonly consumed in Paraguay along with meals.

Domingo distributes his merchandise early in the morning to grocery stores and other larger stores in the city so that businesses will have madioca to sell when they open their business. He uses a cart pulled by horses to sell his mandioca.

Domingo wishes to continue his business and to progress further. He is asking for a loan of $400 to improve the infrastructure of his house, which he can use to hold his merchandise. He wishes to buy a small pick-up truck in the future to distribute his merchandise in a better way.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Domingo Valdez tiene 59 años de edad está casado con Venancia Aquino y tienen cuatro hijos mayores ya todos casados. Domingo se dedica a la venta de mandioca, la mandioca o yuka es una raíz o tubérculo muy consumida en Paraguay, es parecida a la papa, y se consume como acompañamiento con las comidas. Domingo distribuye su mercadería de madrugada las despensas y a grandes comercios de la ciudad, para que a primera hora los negocios tengan mandioca para vender. Dicha labor la realiza en un carro tirado por caballos. Domingo desea seguir progresando, por lo que solicita un crédito de $ 400 para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, ya que la misma funciona también como depósito. Desea en un fututo no muy lejano comprarse una camioneta para poder distribuir sus mercaderías con mayor facilidad.

loans.use: To improve the infrastructure of his house to use for his business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
S. David is the father of two girls, aged 1 and 4 years. He has been selling new blankets, sheets, and suitcases for 4 years now. David’s business is located in one of the city suburbs of Kampala (Kalerwe), a few kilometers from the capital city. This trading center serves a large population, with hundreds of people going to shop there daily.

Unfortunately, David no longer has sufficient stock to meet the demand. Wholesale prices have risen, and he can buy less inventory than he could a few years ago with the same amount of capital. He has realized that he needs to increase his stock if he is to make enough profit to provide bread and basics for the family. He is requesting a loan of $600 to increase his inventory and make it more appealing. The loan will be paid back in a period of six months.

loans.use: To increase inventory of blankets, bedsheets, and suitcases

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María Magdalena D. is a single woman with five children, four of which are school age. Her children have been her reason for living and they are the reason she has made such an effort, giving them an education for the future so they may improve their standard of living.

17 years ago she dedicated herself to the sale of tortillas, but then found a better opportunity in her path and in this way she began her business selling clothing bought wholesale and then sold individually.

This business is one of the most outstanding today. Her sales have increased over the years, and while before she placed her product with daily payments, she now has a fixed stall with the income obtained by expanding and improving considerably. Her initial capital was C$20,000 (Córdobas), which she had saved.

María Magdalena has worked with CEPRODEL for two years and is very satisfied because the credits that they have granted her have been timely and she’s been able to buy business necessities and satisfy customer demand. She has a record of 20 credits.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

María Magdalena D. es una mujer soltera con cinco hijos, de los cuales cuatro se encuentran en edad escolar. Sus hijos han sido la razón de vivir y por ello es que ella se ha esforzado, brindándoles así una educación para el futuro de ellos mejorando así su nivel de vida.

Hace 17 años se dedicaba a venta de tortillas, sin embargo logro una mejor oportunidad en su camino y fue así que ella da inicio a su negocio de venta de ropa donde compra al mayorista y vende al detalle.

Este negocio es uno de los más destacados hoy en día sus ventas han incrementado al paso de los años antes colocaba el producto con abonos diarios, actualmente tiene puesto fijo con los ingresos obtenidos ya que ella ha ido ampliándolo y mejorando considerablemente. Su inicio capital fue C $ 20,000.00 (Córdobas)los cuales eran de ahorro.

María Magdalena trabajo con CEPRODEL desde hace dos años y se siente muy satisfecha ya que los créditos que se le han otorgado brindados estos en momento oportuno ayudándola así a suplir necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un récor de 20 créditos.

loans.use: Buy clothing merchandise

loans.name: Mwamvua

texts.en:
Mwamvua, age 37, is married with 3 children (ages 17, 15, and 13). She has a clothes selling business which she began in 2004. She works from 8am to noon every day, and now makes a monthly profit of about $168 from her sales.

Mwamvua hopes for a loan to buy more clothes to sell. She belongs to the loan group, Nguvu Kazi, totaling 36 members who ensure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy clothing stock

loans.name: Neth

texts.en: Mrs. Neth C. T., 27, is married with three children and is a housewife who stays at home to look after the children and cook food for her family. To supplement their living condition, her husband Mr. Ngov Leang Nghy, 36, works as a motor-taxi driver and he normally makes on average around $4 a day of profit. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a new motor-bike for their son to use as a motor-taxi driver to sustain the standard of living. When the business goes forward and it provides more benefits, this couple will use the money to run another business by opening a grocery stand. Moreover, Mrs. Chanthu will bring all her children to school. Finally, this couple would like to thank for all lenders who contribute the capital to make their business grow.

loans.use: Neth would like to purchase a new motor-bike for her son to use as a motor-taxi driver to sustain their standard of living.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 39 year old Martha K.. She is single with four children, between the ages of 9 and 25.

In 2001, Martha established a charcoal and small retail business. Working seven days a week for nine to twelve hours a day and assisted by her children, she earns about $225.00 per month from this business. Martha now requires a loan to purchase additional stock in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $170.00. In the future, Martha also plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

Note that these small, black, and dirty pieces of dry earth are important not just to charcoal sellers but to their customers, who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags, or kerosene to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

loans.use: To purchase stock of charcoal and small general items for resale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is a member of the Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, and is located at Jr Elmer Fauceet 753 in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 40 years old and has three children. Her husband is a merchant.

She has a shop, where she also works, and used profits to purchase a motorcycle with the aim of increasing the family income. Her husband does the motorcycle runs, while Gloria tends to the shop with her children.

With this loan of $925, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy food supplies, such as rice, sugar, milk, soap, detergent, oil, bread, eggs, shampoo, preserved food etc. One part of the loan will also be earmarked for maintaining the motorcycle.

Gloria says that the support she receives from Manuela Ramos is a great help, enabling her to save, to make purchases, to care better for her children and to continue looking ahead.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

En la actualidad continua con su bodega y con las ganancias obtenidas compro un motocarro para aumentar mas los ingresos en su familia, su esposo es quien maneja el motocarro mientras Gloria con la ayuda de sus hijos atienden su bodega.

Con este préstamo recibido de S/. 2,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará abarrotes como: arroz, azúcar, leche, jabón, detergente, aceite, pan, huevos, champú, conservas, etc, y una parte de su préstamo destino al mantenimiento de su motocarro.

Gloria dice que la ayuda que recibe de Manuela Ramos es un buen apoyo y le permite ahorrar para poder comprar otras cosas y darle lo mejor a sus hijos y seguir adelante sin mirar atrás.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop.

loans.name: Erica

texts.es:
Erica and her husband have worked in his dental practice for the last two years. Her husband is the dentist and Erica works as his assistant. Erica’s involvement has enabled them to expand their small practice and lease new premises in a more central location. The quality of service they offer has increased both the number of patients seeking their services and their income. Her vision is to expand further and become a well-equipped dental practice with the latest technology in dentistry.

They ask for a loan to install an air-conditioning system in their waiting room and to make their dental practice more appealing.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Erica y su esposo trabajan desde hace 2 años en su propio consultorio dental. Su esposo es odontólogo de profesión y Erica es su asistente su comprometido trabajo les ha permitido con el tiempo mejorar su pequeño consultorio y mudarlo a un local céntrico que arrendaron, su visión es poder ampliar y convertirse en un consultorio dental bien equipado con lo último en tecnología dental. La calidad de servicio que ambos ofrecen les ha permitido mejorar sustancialmente sus ingresos y el incremento de sus clientes que acuden a solicitar sus servicios. Solicitan un préstamo para acondicionar su salita de espera y mejorar el tractivo de su consultorio.

loans.use: Improvements to their dental practice

loans.name: Jesus Alonso

texts.es:
Two years ago, Jesus Alonso began his own home business of selling car tyres to support his family and educate his son, when he was unable to find a job and his wife became too ill to work and required medical treatment.

He asks for a loan of $625, repayable over six months, to expand his business and to separate the storage area of the business so that they no longer have to live next to all the car tyres.

With your help he will achieve his aim.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Alonso Inicio el negocio por falta de trabajo ya que necesitaba de un ingreso propio para poder costear los estudios de su hijo y poder mantenerlos ya que no tenia trabajo y su esposa se encontraba enferma y no podia apoyarlo economicamente. Comenzó hace 2 cuando perdió su trabajo y tenia que pagar los gastos de su hijo para la escuela y de la casa no podía encontrar un trabajo además que su esposa necesitaba un tratamiento. fue asi que decidio poner su negocio de venta de llantas que hasta ahora es lo que lo ha ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia.

El solicita un prestamo por US $ 625 que pagara en 6 meses para ampliar su negocio ya que no cabe con todos sus productos donde esta actualmente. Con tu ayuda podra logralo.

loans.use: Remodelling of business premises

loans.name: Patricia Maricela

texts.es:
Patricia is married and has two children, one six-year-old son and one 2-year-old daughter. She started her business due to financial need, since her husband does not make enough money working as a bricklayer. She started helping a friend selling cosmetics by commission, then decided to start selling on her own and has been doing so for 5 years, which generates a higher income.

She needs a loan of US $300, which she will repay in 6 months, to stock her business and sell more products since she wishes to continue expanding it. She hopes that in the future she can also open a haberdashery in her home. With your help, Paty will accomplish her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.
