Patricia es casada y tiene 2 hijos un niño de 6 años y una niña de 2 años, inició el negocio por la falta de dinero, porque su esposo no gana lo suficiente trabajando como albañil, así que ella empezó ayudándole a una amiga a vender productos de cosméticos por comisión, después decidió vender por su cuenta y ya tiene 5 años en el negocio, lo que le genera mejores ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir una factura extra y vender mas productos ya que desea seguir creciendo, ella quiere en un futuro tener en su casa una mercería, con tu ayuda Paty lograra su meta.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to continue with the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Veysal

texts.en: Veysal was born in 1960; he is married, with 2 children.  He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Jabrail region in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, now settled in the town of Khirdalan. Veysal has run a taxi business for 10 years. Now he is requesting a loan of $625 to buy spare parts to maintain his taxi.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Phoeurn

texts.en: Phoeurn T., a 53-year-old widow, earns about $4 each day, has four children, and lives in the Kdoldaunteav Commune in the Battambang Province in western Cambodia.  Three of her children live at home; her son is a bricklayer, her elder daughter (who is pictured) makes brooms and grows vegetables, and her other daughter works as a hairdresser.  Phoeurn also earns a living by making brooms, which she sells throughout her village.  She recently realized that she could expand her broom business if she had the capital to purchase more materials and build up an inventory.  Therefore, Phoeurn is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase more materials for making brooms.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to make brooms

loans.name: Maranatha Group

texts.en:
"Maranatha" is a large group of 35 people. Right now, 20 of its members are seeking loans, all excited about the chance to improve their situation and life, and hoping this loan will be the start of that change. Maribel, the chosen leader of this group, is a hardworking mother of four young children, all under the age of 10. She realized some time ago that she needed to do something to help her young children have a good life, and this loan will present her with the opportunity to start a small business selling food.  Mirabel dreams of having a thriving business that will support both her and her children. 

The whole group is ready for this loan and ready to make a major change in their lives. On behalf of Maribel, the group, and Esperanza International---- Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: To become a food vendor

loans.name: Sababu Group

texts.en:
This is the Sababu group: Manty S. and Mabinty K.. They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT. The last loan they received was for Le 600,000 each. Previous loans have made a meaningful impact in the lives of these people. Nevertheless, they still need additional loans of Le 800,000 each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses.

Mabinty is the leader of this group. She was born in Falaba, about forty-two miles from Kabala. She is married with five children. Three of her children are in secondary schools and one in primary school. The eldest is now a housewife. Mabinty's husband is a diamond miner in Kono in eastern Sierra Leone.

Mabinty has been selling cooked rice for over eight years now. She intends to use this new loan to buy bags of rice, barters of palm-oil (five gallons make a barter), and other cooking materials. This will prevent her from buying these items from the market in more expensive amounts. As a result, she will be able to make more profit from the materials she sells. Higher profits will solve most of her challenges, which include feeding the family, educating the children, and providing medical care in case any member of the family becomes sick.

loans.use: To buy cooking materials, rice, and palm oil.

loans.name: Feliciana Isabel

texts.es:
El pinol es la bebida típica de Nicaragua y a la venta de esta bebida desde hace 9 años se dedica la señora Feliciana P. en su establecimiento en el mercado La Estación de León. Vende el pinol en polvo listo para preparar y son muchos los clientes que le visitan diario para comprar este producto. 

Una necesidad que hoy mismo la señora Feliciana atraviesa es la urgencia de adquirir el dinero para comprar el maíz, la leña y las bolsas para prepara el pinol o pinolillo. Es por esto que espera que Ceprodel le brinde un crédito para la compra de esta materia prima para continuar preparando la bebida más sabrosa en Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Pinol is Nicaragua's traditional drink and selling it has been Feliciana Perez's livelihood for the last 9 years. She operates her business from a space in the La Estacion market in Leon. She sells powdered pinol, ready for mixing, and has lots of customers who stop by daily to buy from her.

Feliciana needs a loan to buy maize, wood and containers for making pinol or pinolillo. She hopes that Ceprodel will extend the loan so that she can buy the basic supplies she needs to continue making Nicaragua's most delicious drink.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for beverage business.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en: Mrs. Yorn T. lives in Lvea Sor Kroam Village in Kandal Province. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Thuo Vann, makes big pots which can hold water. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy materials, including cement, to build more big pots to sell. Mrs. Yorn T. is 44 years old and the mother of seven children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while two others are big pot makers. Two other children attend the local school while the youngest child, five years old, is too young to work or study. Her husband is present on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy materials, including cement, to build more big pots to sell.

loans.name: Touy

texts.en:
Touy C., a 37-year-old mother of three children, currently works as a rice farmer, earning about $2 a day. Her husband, a construction worker who builds houses, earns about $3 a day.

Touy is requesting a loan of $1000 to begin a new business. She will use this money to rent a cashew nut farm, and believes that this loan will help her to improve her family's standard of living and move her closer to fulfilling her dreams.

loans.use: To rent a cashew nut farm.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: Rosmery cuenta con 27 años de edad, vive con su pareja hace 9 años y tiene un hijo. Por la noche descansa en su casa, pero prepara los alimentos en la casa de su madre. De pequeña realizaba las labores agrícolas y el cuidado de las vacas, ahora con su propia familia, siembra mayormente espinaca; pero le es más rentable comprar por chacras porque al comprar se puede calcular por un aproximado de 40 canastas, pero al cosechar saca entre 60 o 70 canastas, esto le permite pagar peones y transporte de los productos, así gana un 50 % más de lo invertido. Asimismo también se dedica a repartir leche junto a su madre; la que lleva haciéndolo por más 27 años, reparten la leche a los restaurantes y pastelerías, pero en forma alternada es decir;  una semana su madre y la otra ella. Rosmery está muy contenta con lo que realiza y tiene planes de incrementar sus siembras de espinacas y avena para la alimentación de las vacas. Rosmery es una socia muy emprendedora y muy puntual en las reuniones que el asesor programa, este es su 12vo préstamo, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos de acuerdo al cronograma programado. El dinero  que ha solicitado es para la compra de grandes cantidades de avena para alimentar a sus vacas y que no deje de faltarles la leche, y de ese modo cubran sus gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Rosmery is 27 years old, has lived with her husband for 9 years and has a son. At night she sleeps at her home, but prepares food in her mother’s home. Since she was young she has worked in farming and raising cattle. Now that she has her own family, she mostly grows spinach. Spinach is profitable because when you purchase a field and calculate that it will yield about 40 baskets of spinach, it will actually yield between 60-70 baskets during the harvest. The extra crop allows her to pay workers and to transport her products, and she earns 50% more than she invests. At the same time, she also works with her mother delivering milk. For the past 27 years her mother has delivered milk to restaurants and bakeries. Now Rosmery and her mother alternate weeks—one week Rosmery delivers milk and the next her mother delivers it. Rosmery is very content with what she does and has plans to increase her spinach crops. She will also increase her oat crop in order to feed her cows. Rosmery is an entrepreneurial member [of the community bank] and very punctual at their programmed meetings. This is her twelfth loan and she has always been on-time with her payments. The money she is asking for will be used to buy large quantities of oats to feed to her cows so they will continue producing milk and she can pay for her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy oats to feed to cattle

loans.name: Milka

texts.en: Milka A. is a 40-year-old mother of 5 children, aged 20, 19, 17, 14, and 8. She sells clothes to pay for their schooling and to keep up their house. She is asking for a loan because she hopes to continue to expand her business, but does not have the capital to buy clothing in bulk. She would like Kiva users to know more about her family -- something we may follow up with in a journal.

loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en: His family has 2.73 ha of agricultural land, which he received from privatization. He also works on 5.46 ha of land, which belongs to his retired parents. He has been working on this land since 1999. He has no agricultural technique. The work is performed by service providers in the village. He accomplishes manual work with his wife and he pays workers to do weeding and harvesting. He uses a minibus to transport workers in the field. He also uses the minibus to transport his agricultural products to the market. He has planted one ha of Moldova sort vine. Last year he had trouble achieving grapes; they cost four lei for one kg and take the money received with delay. This year he wants to plant 0.5-1 ha of potatoes and onions. He grows wheat and corn for his household needs and he sells the surplus to the collectors of wheat. This loan was used to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer and payment services.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer and payment services.

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr:
K. Rose est née vers 1966. Rose est mariée à MIKPONHOUN Nestor et mère de cinq enfants dont quatre sont scolarisés. Rose réside dans un quartier de Cotonou où elle exerce ses activités commerciales de  vente de condiments pour la sauce. Rose achète les condiments pour faire la sauce au marché international du Bénin à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Rose veut répondre au mieux aux besoins de sa clientèle; et pour ceci elle a besoin de renforcer son fonds de roulement. C'est pour cette raison que Rose sollicite un prêt auprès de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
K. Rose was born around 1966. She is married to MIKPONHOUN Nestor and is the mother of five children, four of whom are in school. She resides in a district of Cotonou where she does business selling condiments for making sauces. She buys these condiments at the international marketplace of Benin in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Sometimes she alternates with her domestic help (see photo) in doing the selling. Rose wants to respond better to the needs of her customers. To do so, she needs to boost her working capital. This is why she’s requesting a loan from Alidé. Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments (fresh and canned tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, spices, bouillon cubes, pasta, sacks of salt, etc.)

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Mrs. Emilda S. is 42 years old, married and resides at Sangay Daku Ozamiz City. She has four children. Two of them are married and two work at LUAN CHING farm located at Pulot Ozamiz City. She is a business-minded woman engaged in a sari-sari store.  She started her business through financing by Paglaum MPC. She has shown strong leadership in her group and as a center officer. Now she is applying for her 8th cycle for PHP 14,500.00 to use as additional capital for her business. She also works as a care taker at LUAN CHING farm. 

She hopes that someday she can own a sari-sari store with her efforts and financing from KIVA..

loans.use: Capital for her sari-sari store

location.town: Ozamis-Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy is 62 years old and married with six children. She sells loaves of bread. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more loaves of bread to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: S., 39, lives with her family members in the province of Pursat. S. and her husband are engaged in farming and they also raise animals for their offspring. Besides this, the couple has also been hired by other farmers to harvest their crops. The couple now has five single children, all of whom help with farm work when not studying. To alleviate farm plowing, S. seeks a loan from Kiva to purchase an oxen. She will rent out the oxen to farmers as other income.

loans.use: To purchase an oxen to rent out to other farmers

loans.name: Yomny

texts.en:
Mr. Yomny G. is 26 years old and is married to Amelia Franco, who is 31.  Together they have a daughter, Nadia, who is 16 months old.  

Inspired by the advice of a friend, Yomny decided to start his own small business selling used car batteries, scrap metal and boxes. 

The money from the loan will go toward the purchase of new batteries that are brought from Brazil at a very good price, which assures a larger profit margin.  Additionally he would like to purchase bottles, cans and other products for those who are interested in these products.  His dream is to have a country with greater opportunities for people who want to work.

loans.use: for the purchase of batteries

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.en: I. Firdavs is 26 years old. He is married and is the father of two children. Firdavs is a livestock breeder. He buys and sells cattle from different market places and has been in the business for the last three years. His main customers are butchers and livestock farmers. With the loan from Kiva, Firdavs plans to increase his herd of cattle for trade and, if possible, to open up his own butchery. This, he says, will increase his turnover. He plans to see his children go through higher education and be able to get good jobs, unlike himself. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a 41-year-old mother of four. The eldest son is 19 years old and in college while the youngest is a one-year-old girl. She lives in Tanay, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is hardworking and optimistic that she can bring her family out of poverty.
The courage and persistence to get out of poverty is burning in her. In 2003, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFi and KIVA partner in the Philippines, hoping to have access to capital for her business resale. Her previous loans were carefully spent on resale of silver jewelry and frozen foods. The business is well managed and it brings her enough income to sustain her family needs.
Now she proposes a loan of 45,000 pesos as additional rolling capital for her business. The loan will be used to pay for silver rings, earrings, necklaces, ladies' and men's bracelets, dressed chicken, pork and rice, all for resale.
She is hopeful that with the trust and confidence given by ASHI and KIVA, she can have her own silver shop someday and also be able to sustain the needs of her children in school.

loans.use: To pay for silver rings, earings, necklace, ladies and men's bracelets also dressed chicken, pork and rice.

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
48-year-old Edna was successful in the business she had established through her five times loan in ASHI since 2004. However, most of the financial and emotional investments she had then vanished when her husband died just recently. She spend thousands of money for her husband's medication before the death and even until the burial. Having her only 11-year-old child beside her, Edna realized she has to be strong to restart running her general store business for her child's education and future.

From a Php12,000 previously, Edna chose to lessen the amount she will loan now despite her qualification for loaning large amount because she will start all over again and for the first time, without her husband's support. In the near future she believes that she will be able to grow her business again with loans she will be getting from ASHI.

loans.use: Will be used to finance her general store business.

loans.name: Korina

texts.en:
"Korina S. (0) is a 29-year-old woman living in the town of Savalalo.  She is married and has 1 infant-aged child.  To make a living, Korina is starting a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling baked goods in the local community.  Korina has just started operating this business and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Korina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Korina is requesting for the first time a loan from SPBD.    Korina is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Korina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Cerina

texts.en:
Cerina G. is 30 years old and married to a teacher. She has three school-aged children. Cerina is currently in the business of selling tea, bread, paste and tomatoes, and is requesting a loan to purchase cooking oil and onions to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees and purchase food for home consumption.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil and onions to sell

loans.name: Naing

texts.en:
K. is a 39-year-old married woman who is blessed with three children who are teenagers. She currently stays at home to sell a few produce items in her small store in front of her home. Her husband is a local farmer who raises a few pig from home.

Recently, K. has been very busy at her business because she has many clients who need more of her products, but she does not have enough supply to meet her customer's needs. That is why K. has requested a loan to buy extra grocery inventory. Note: K.'s husband appears in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more grocery inventory

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is twenty-six years old. She is single. She has owned and operated a beauty salon for the past five years. Linda is very skillful and a talented hairdresser who adds beauty and value to the hair of her many customers. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service. She wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators, etc. to avoid shortages and poor service. She hopes to raise a good income to finance the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase assorted pomades and hair creams in bulk

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort, age 35, is the married mother of two children, who are both still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the town of Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town, but the majority of its inhabitants practice farming as a hobby or as a major occupation in addition to other trading activities. 

Comfort sells maize and other foods, such as yams. She buys her goods in nearby communities. Comfort sells in the local market and also treks to markets farther away. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 14 y 11 años en su casa propia.
Desde hace 13 años se dedica a la agricultura; siembra papa, trigo y cebada, esta activada la realiza en compañía de su esposo, pues ambos comparten estas arduas tareas, tanto en la época de siembra, como el la cosecha.
Una vez cosechados sus productos los venden directamente a los comerciantes del mercado central de su ciudad y es así como tienen mayores ganancias, sin intermediarios, que por lo general éstos pagan un precio que no compensa el grande esfuerzo.
Maruja y su esposo desean seguir adelante en estas tareas, por lo que aumentarán su  producción, viendo las posibilidades de adquirir terrenos propios y arrendar otros que les servirá para aumentar su producción.

Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP, y en todo este tiempo (aproximadamente 4 años) ha notado los beneficios del trabajo en equipo, por lo que está muy animada a continuar junto a su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y el pago de un tractor para remover la tierra.
texts.en:
Maruja, 33, lives with her husband and two children, 14 and 11 years of age, in her own house. She has been a farmer for the last 13 years. She cultivates potatoes, wheat and barley with her husband, who shares these arduous tasks with her both in planting time and during the harvesting. Once harvested, the products are sold directly to merchants in the city's central market. This way, their profits are higher; no middlemen, because, generally, middlemen pay prices that don't even make up for all the hard work. Maruja and her husband want to continue with this work, increasing their production, and looking into the possibility of both acquiring their own lands and leasing others to increase production. This is their 8th loan with MFP and in all this time (about 4 years) she has noticed the benefits to be had from working as a team for which she is very encouraged to stay with her group. The funds requested will be used to buy sacks of natural fertilizer and to pay to hire a tractor to till the land.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Angelica De

texts.es: Angélica tiene 45 años de edad, es casada con dos hijos, la familia vive en un domicilio bajo la modalidad de anticrético. Posee un minibús que es de su propiedad, presta servicios de transporte de pasajeros. Su competencia en el mercado es alta por estar afiliada al sindicato de transportes. El préstamo está destinado para la compra de llantas para su minibús. Tiene buen historial crediticio en el sistema financiero.
texts.en:
Angélica, 45, is married and has two sons. The family lives in a home under the "anticrético" system (Anticretico is a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you). She has a minibus with which she provides passenger transportation services. She faces a high degree of competiton because she is affiliated with the transportation service providers union. The funding will be used to buy tires for the minibus. She has a good credit history in the financial system.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy minibus tires.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena E. sells corn (a cereal that most Ghanaian dishes are prepared from, such at porridge, banku and so on) as a hawker in Abura on the Cape Coast. Abena has no educational background. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a harvester. 

Abena has been selling corn for the past two years. She supports her husband to educate the children and pay utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more maize in larger quantities to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business as savings for expanding her cocoa farm.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more maize in larger quantities to sell.

loans.name: Teresa Lucinda

texts.es:
El  Banco Comunal Jardín de la Artesanía se formo en  Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, aquí la mayor parte de su gente se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías.

Teresa esta casada desde hace veinte y cinco  años tiene tres hijos, es oriunda del cantón Santa Ana, se caso y se radicó en Montecristi,  ella junto a su familia tienen un  taller de cerrajería desde hace quince años  ubicado en su propia casa, aquí  se dedican a pintar muebles, ventanas, puertas y  todo lo relacionado con la soldadura,  el hijo se encarga de  entregar a sus clientes el  trabajo terminado.

 Con el nuevo préstamo que la Fundación le entregue  lo invertirán en comprar más materiales como pintura, hierro, suelda  y todo lo necesario para terminar los pedidos pendientes,  el material  lo compran a los distribuidores en Manta y lo hacen  todas las semanas porque es bastante la demanda que tienen.
texts.en:
The Jardín de la Artesanía ("Garden of Craftwork") community bank was formed in Montecristi, province of Manabí, where the majority of the people make a living in arts and crafts. Teresa has been married for 25 years and has three children. She is a native of the Santa Ana region, but settled in Montecristi following her marriage. She and her family have run a blacksmith workshop for the past 15 years out of their own home, where they make a living painting furniture, windows, doors and everything related to welding. Her son is in charge of delivering the finished products to the customers. With the new loan, she plans to invest in the purchase of materials such as paint, iron, welding supplies and other items necessary to completing pending orders. She buys the material from distributors in Manta, and makes purchases every week because of the demand for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase paint, iron, welding supplies, etc.

loans.name: Edelma

texts.es: Edelma tiene 66 años de edad, ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 por lo que es una excelente cliente. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa usada. Hace más de 27 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que inicio desde muy joven para poder mantener a sus 6 hijos que actualmente laboran de manera independiente, ella como madre responsable les proporciono lo necesario para que sean personas de bien. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos. Su deseo es seguir viviendo para seguir adelante con este negocio.
texts.en:
Edelma is 66 years old. She has worked with the Fundación León 2000 for a long time, and she is an excellent client. She buys and sells used clothes. She has been in this business for over 27 years. She started when she was very young to be able to support her six children. The children currently work independently. As a responsible mother, she gave them what was necessary for them to become good people. She is requesting this loan for working capital to buy pants, shirts, skirts, and dresses. Her wish is to keep living to move forward in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Las Rosas Y Las Guindas Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Las Rosas y las Guindas, inicia su 6to ciclo con 17 socias, está ubicado en el distrito D. Lircay, departamento D. Huancavelica, L. actividad principal D. L. comunidad es el comercio.
Sus socias se dedican a L. venta D. verduras, abarrotes en los mercados y ferias D. L. comunidad.
Una D. sus socias es Teodora, que es casada y tiene 3 hijos, 2 varones y 1 mujer, empezó su negocio D. ventas D. verduras con un pequeño puesto en las ferias D. L. comunidad, ahora gracias a los prestamos tiene más capital para invertir y sus ventas han crecido, con el préstamo que va a recibir implementará su negocio con L. venta D. abarrotes, comprará al por mayor arroz, azúcar, aceite y productos D. primera necesidad que tienen mayor venta. El sueño D. Teodora es tener un almacén D. mercadería, para tener su negocio con productos variados y que nunca le falten.
texts.en:
The community bank Las Rosas y Las Guindas starts its 6th cycle with 17 members; it is located in the district of Lircay, department of Huancavelica; the group’s main activity is commerce. Its members sell vegetables and groceries in the markets and fairs of their community. One of the members is Teodora; she is married and has three children, 2 boys and 1 girl. She started her business of selling vegetables with a small stall in the community’s fairs; now, thanks to the loans, she has mO. capital to invest and her sales have grown. With the loan she will receive, she will add the sale of groceries to her business; she will buy wholesale rice, sugar, oil and basic necessity products that sell the most. Teodora’s dream is to have a grocery stO., a business with assorted products, always in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic necessity products to sale

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a 34 year old married man with two children in school.   He was formerly farming and running a grocery shop so as to earn a living.  He then started operating a retail shop where he sells shoe soles.  But he still earns extra income from farming. He wants to take his first loan from Faulu Kenya and hopes that his business will expand and improve. He plans to add stock and expand his business with the loan of Kes.15,000.  He hopes that his income will increase for him to meet his family’s need.  He sees himself having better living standards in a few years time.

loans.use: Add stock of soles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk for business.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 38 years old, married to Jeniffer Wanjiru, with two children who go to school. Since 2005, he has been in the motorcycle transport business ferrying  people and goods from one place to another.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to renew his PSV (Public Service Vehicle) license and buy a helmet for his passengers. He hopes to grow his business and even in the future to buy a mini van.

loans.use: To buy a passenger helmet and renew his PSV license

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools and equipment.

loans.name: Freshta Mary Group

texts.en:
Freshta is the group leader of the Freshta Mary group. She lives in district 12 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is 35 years old and she has four children who are students. She wants to take a loan for her business of embroidery. She needs this loan because she wants to rent a new shop for her business and purchase important supplies such as different kinds of threads, needles and so on.

In the future, she desires to have a progressed business and to support her husband and children in a better way.

loans.use: To rent a new shop for her business

loans.name: Tsevegmid

texts.en: Tsevegmid G. is a 56-year-old widow who lives in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. She lives in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent called a “ger”. Tsevegmid's business is called “Oit Hangai” LLC. She operates tree and seed planting, afforestation, and forest maintenance services. She has been operating her business since 2002, and has steadily expanded it over the past eight years. Tsevegmid has been planning to expand her business by opening a lumber processing facility and market. She is a very hardworking person and attributes her success to her strong managerial skills. Tsevegmid enjoys working to better the environment by planting trees and flowers. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to plant tree seedlings and to maintain the forest.

loans.use: To plant tree seedlings

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es soltera y vive con su mama, Felicitas vive en la comunidad de Chacco y se dedica a la siembra de verduras en sus terrenos, además compra los mismos productos de otros productores para luego de acopiar llevar a los mercados de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Su préstamo será invertido para comprar verduras y abono.
Felicitas desea tener mas extensión de terrenos para producir mas verduras y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Felicitas is single and lives with her mother. Felicitas lives in Chacco and works planting vegetables in her lands. Also, she buys the same products from other producers to then bring in bulk to the food markets in the city of Ayacucho. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of vegetables and fertilizer.

Felicitas wants to extend her land more to produce more vegetables and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fertilizer

loans.name: Ena Susana

texts.es:
la sra. Ena Susana S. tiene 11 años de dedicarse a la elaboracion y venta de pan y rosquillas, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación con ayuda de una empleada, su producto lo distribuye en diferentes negocios de la zona.
con los ingresos que le genera el negocio le ayuda a su esposo a cubrir los gastos en el hogar, tiene tres  hijos a su cargo los cuales estan en la escuela de la localidad, 
Ena a logrado comprar un molino para moler el MAIZ para elaborar su producto facillitandole de este manera la elaboracion de su producto ya que antes tenia que pagar para moler maiz. 
su producto hoy en dia es bien buscado por su clientela.
Ena alquila la casa donde ella habita y es por eso que uno de sus sueños es tener su propia casa.
 su esposo es de gran ayuda, ya que trabajan los dos y se aytudan mutuamente para cumplir con los
compromisos y lograr que sus sueños se hagan realidad.

el credito lo utilizara para comprar materiales para la fabricacion del pan y de las rosquillas.
texts.en:
Ena Susana S. has been making and selling bread and “rosquillas” (a ring-shaped cookie) for 11 years. She makes them in her house with help from an employee. She distributes her product to different businesses in the area. She uses the income that her business generates to help her husband with the household expenses. She has three children under her care, and they attend the local school. Ena bought a mill to grind corn in order to make her product. This way making her product is easier than before when she had to pay to grind the corn. Now her product is requested a lot by her customers. Ena rents the house where she lives. That is why one of her dreams is to have her own house. Her husband is a big help because they both work and help each other to fulfill their obligations and to make their dreams come true. She will use the loan to buy materials to make bread and rosquillas.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, flour, shortening, sweetener, eggs, sugar, cheese, and firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Maynard

texts.en:
Maynard A. is from the village of Del Pilar Baliangao Misamis Occidental. He is 50 years old. Maynard is widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Maynard owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Maynard has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maynard joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maynard is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maynard from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Sadiatou

texts.fr: il y a plus de 10 ans que cette femme s'est spécialisée dans le commerce de tissus et de bazins, elle maîtrise parfaitement ce marché. elle fait ce commerce de façon ambulante pour toucher plus de clients; elle s'approvisionne au burkina faso, un pays voisin  et à lomé. le stock actuel de marchandises ne lui permet pas de subvenir aux besoins de ses clients. elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de divers tissus et divers bazins de différentes qualités. elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants
texts.en:
For over ten years, Mrs. K. Y. has been a specialized dealer of fabrics and Guinea brocade (bazin); she is now a master of this trade. She sells door to door in order to reach more clients. She buys her cloth in Burkina Faso, a neighboring country, and in Lomé. Her current stock of fabrics is not enough to meet the needs of her clients, so she is asking for a loan from WAGES to buy assorted fabrics and bazins of various quality. She is married and is the mother of 5 children.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics and Guinea Brocade

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man living with his parents and seven siblings. He is still quite young, but he has proven to be a successful entrepreneur with his computer and games shop. He has owned and run this shop for more than three years. With his loan request of $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will improve his business and purchase new computers at good prices and he needs this amount to add to his saving to buy them. Those computers will allow him to significantly increase his productivity and also his income. He is positive about his business prospects and plans to further expand. He is hoping to open a new branch of his shop in the coming year. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages them to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen: Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l., we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: purchase new computers

loans.name: Andryi

texts.en:
Andryi is married and has two children, a 14-year-old son and a 4-year-old daughter. He is the only breadwinner in his family and has made a living as a taxi driver for the last three years. Currently, he offers transportation services to many parts of the Ukraine. He is a very determined, hard-working man who sometimes puts in a 24-hour day. He currently makes about 4,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Andryi is requesting a loan of 7,500 Grivnyas to remodel his vehicle, improve its efficiency and allow it to run more smoothly and quietly. This will not only help his cut his costs, but also reduce the environmental impact of his vehicle.

loans.use: to make his vehicle op[erate more smoothly and efficiently

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema S. is a married woman with two children who attend school. She has been operating a retail shop and she also sells second hand clothes.Her major customers are the neighboring community and passersby. Rehema faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She has no other source of income. Rehama owns a house with no electricity and no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Rehema's major aim in working with Yehu is to access loans to boost her business. With a loan of  Kshs 30,000,  Rehema wants to purchase a bale of clothes and stock of sugar, wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for her retail shop.

loans.use: To  purchase a bale of clothes and stock of sugar, wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for her retail shop.

loans.name: Franz

texts.es:
El joven FRANZ B. P. es conyugue de la señorita GABRIELA CAILLOMA FLORES, desde hace dos años ellos viven el Barrio Piraicito de la Zona del Plan 3000. Tienen un hijo de 3 años, viven en la casa de los Padres del señor B., 

El se dedica a la Fabricación de Carritos Metálicos  que son de hierro y los hace trabajar en los parques de diversiones, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 3 años el trabaja en el taller de su padre que es por la zona del Mechero de la ciudad de SANTA CRUZ

El necesita del préstamo para mejorar sus ingresos comprándose sus propias herramientas con las cuales pueda ser independiente y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
The young Franz B. P. lives with his girlfriend Gabriela Cailloma Flores. And for the past two years tehy have lived in the district of Patricio in the Plan 3000 region. They have a 3 year old son together and they live with Mr. B.'s parents.

He makes carousel cars for midway rides in the parks. He has had this business for the past 3 years. He works in his father's shop located in Mechero, in the city of Santa Cruz.

He requires a loan to improve his income, to purchase his own set of tools. He will used those to make himself independent and improve the quality of their life.

loans.use: To purchase hardware tools.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben L., 37, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. 

L. sells groceries, earning an income of about 5 USD per day. Her husband is a soldier, earning an income of  2.50 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. L. has to spend 70 USD on food, 10 USD on electricity and water supplies, and 60 USD on other necessary expenses every month.  

L. is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Delia Ercilia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Constructoras Del Éxito, esta ciudad se la conoce desde hace mucho con el nombre de Ciudad Del Valle por estar encerrada por muchos cerros que rodean la urbe.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Delia, tiene 32 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 10 y 7 años los mismos que estudian en la escuela. El marido es músico. Estudio estética y estilismo en la Academia Manuela Cañizares de la ciudad de Portoviejo.
 
Es estilista y trabaja en una peluquería, realiza trabajos a domicilios en sus tiempos libres y los sabados que tiene libre realiza trabajos casi todo el día,hace tinturados y corte de cabellos, pinta las uñas y otros trabajos mas, aprovecha las noches para dedicarse a su trabajo ya que en el día trabaja en un salón de belleza. Además de esto también vende productos naturales cuando realiza sus otros trabajos.

Este crédito es para comprar productos naturales y para comprar más herramientas de trabajo. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal. Su deseo es tener un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
The “Constructoras Del Éxito” (Builders of Success) communal bank meets in Portoviejo every two weeks.  This city has been known for a long time as City of the Valley because the city is surrounded by many hills.

We find Delia, 32, here.  She is in a common law relationship and has two children who are 10 and 7 years of age and who go to school.  Her husband is a musician.  She studied hair styling and esthetics at the Manuela Cañizares Academy in Portoviejo.

She is a hair stylist and works in a barber shop.  On her free time and all day on Saturday, which is her day off, she performs these services at customers’ homes.  She does hair coloring, hair cuts, applies nail polish and other tasks.  She does most of these jobs at night because during the day she’s employed at the beauty salon.  In addition to this she also sells natural products while performing the other jobs.

This loan is to buy natural products and to buy more work tools.  She is a founding member of the communal bank.  Her wish is to have her own beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy beauty supplies like: dyes, nail polish, tools and natural products.

loans.name: Rommell Amed

texts.es:
Rommell tiene 18 años de edad, estudia en II año de Ingenieria Agropecuaria, decidio estudiar esta carrera porque sus padres se dedican a este tipo de actividad y es en el ambiente que el se crio. Ayuda a su Mamá, en una Pulperia. Tambien tienen una distribuidora de Gas Butano.

El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Cultivar Repollo.

Agradece a KIVA por la oportunidad que le brindo para llevar a cabo este proyecto con sus compañeros de la Universidad. Desea terminar sus estudios, ser independiente y crear su propio Capital.
texts.en:
Rommell, 18, is a second year Agriculture and Cattle Raising student.  He decided on this career choice because his parents are in this occupation and it's the environment he grew up in.  He helps his mother in a grocery store and they also have a butane gas distribution business.

He negotiated this loan to buy supplies for a university project: to grow cabbage.

He thanks KIVA for the opportunity it gave him to complete this project with his companions at the university.  He wants to finish his studies, become independent and create his own capital.

loans.use: Agronomy Student Project: Vegetable (Cabbage) Farming.

loans.name: Alma Emprendedora Group

texts.es: El grupo Alma Emprendedora cuenta con 11 integrantes, el grupo fue nombrado asi porque todas las clientas tienen en común las ganas de emprender una lucha diaria en su negocios asi como en la vida misma, y prueba de ello es que han formado el grupo para obteber un beneficio. Fabiola V. iniciadora del grupo es actualmente la tesorera,  tiene 28 años, tiene 3 hijos( 2 varones y 1 mujer) estudió hasta la primaria. Ama de casa y comerciante invierte su credito en  material galvanizado para hacer artículos de fantasía.Inició su hogar con un par de cuartos modestos solo de tabique y lámina de cartón, anteriormente tenía una tienda de abarrotes (casi 6 años) así se inició en el comercio tambien de dulces  y refrescos  por lo cual redujo su casa a un solo cuarto para establecer su negocio. Posteriormente decidió cerrar la tienda por el motivo del espacio en su casa pero gracias a sus ahorros y a los creditos emprende el negocio en la venta de fantasia el cual puede realizar en sus ratos libres. Con el credito pretende hacer crecer su negocio y futuro hacer crecer su casa.
texts.en:
The Alma Emprendedora ["Entrepreneurial Soul"] group has 11 members.  The group got its name because all of the members share a desire to undertake the daily struggles both of their businesses and of their lives.  The fact that they have formed this group in order to gain a benefit is proof of this.  

Fabiola V., who started the group, is now the treasurer.  She is 28 years old, has three children (two boys and one girl), and studied until primary school.  She is a homemaker and a businesswoman and she will invest her loan in galvanized metal for making novelty items.

She started her home with a pair of modest rooms made only from brick and pegboard.  She used to have a small grocery store (for almost six years) and this is how she got into business.  She also sold sweets and soft drinks.  In order to establish her business, she had to reduce her home to only one room.  Later, she decided to close the store because of space reasons in her house.  Thanks to her savings and the loans she received, she undertook her current business of selling novelty items, which she is able to do in her free time.  She intends to use this loan to grow her business and, in the future, to expand her house.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal for making novelty items

loans.name: Carmencita Rodriguez's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Carmencita R. is from Bagakay, Ozamis City. She is 61 years old, widowed and has eight adult aged children. Carmencita is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Carmencita R. ‘s Group. 

Carmencita owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Carmencita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from PMPC. Carmencita is now requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third taken from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
About Group Loans 

In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: used to purchased additional products to sell

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline A. is a married woman of fifty years, her husband is called Nathan Ekesa and together they have three children.  They live in a roadblock area in Eldoret Town where she does her business of selling second hand clothes, she has been in this business for four years now and gets a monthly income of four thousand shillings.

This will be Pauline's first loan from Kiva partner KADET LTD, and she wants to use the entire loan to buy two bails of used clothes for resale. With the additional income she is going to get she plans to expand her business by renting a shop instead of selling in the open air. 

In the future, she hopes to open a wholesale shop where she can sell second hand clothes in bulk and therefore raise her family's living standard.

loans.use: To buy bails of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Cumawas Group

texts.en:
Jonalyn C. lives in the village of Miputak. She is 31 years old and leads a two-person loan group that receives funding from PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan for their fellow group member if one is delinquent or defaults.

Jonalyn is married and has two school-aged children. She makes a living by raising pigs in her backyard. She has been in this business for more than 3 years and earns about 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2007, Jonalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid seven previous loans from PMPC, and used each of them to buy piglets and feeds. 

Jonalyn and her loan group are applying for a new loan of 14,900 PHP to buy additional piglets, feeds and construction materials for her business.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, feeds and construction materials

loans.name: Carmen Del Socorro

texts.es:
Carmen del Socorro R. Ramos, comerciante activa del Mercado Israel Lewite, desde hace más de cinco años, ella trabaja de lunes a sábados de 7 de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde, es casada, con dos hijos y estos se encuentran uno en la universidad y el otro en el colegio, ella, su esposo y sus hijos dependen únicamente del negocio.
 El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de mercadería para su negocio, ha trabajado varios prestamos con ceprodel (9) y estos han sido para su negocio el cual ha venido incrementando gracias a los financiamientos que ceprodel le ha brindado.
Ella acude nuevamente a ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería para su negocio como: Compra de colchones y espejos.
texts.en: For over five years, Carmen del Socorro R. R.has been an active saleswoman at the Israel Lewite Market. She works from Monday through Saturday, from 7 am to 6 pm.  She is married and has two children, one of which is at the University and the other is in school.  She, along with her husband and her children, depend on her business.  The loan that she is seeking would be used to purchase merchandise for it.  She has applied for various loans from Ceprodel (9 total), all of them went towards her business and they have helped it grow.  She plans to use this new loan to purchase pillows and mirrors for her business.

loans.use: Purchase pillows and mirrors.

loans.name: Mwanahuru

texts.en:
Mwanahuru is a divorced woman with eight children, three of whom still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She operates a doughnut-selling business, selling at the market and from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanahuru hopes to expand her business and open a retail shop business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to pay school fees for her son who is in secondary school. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to educate her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son who is in secondary school.

loans.name: Adama Kamara Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the Adama K.’s group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. This is the second loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Adama K.. She is 29 and was born in Makeni, where she is currently residing together with her husband and children. Her husband is a businessman and both of her children are attending primary school. For four years now, Adama has been selling shoes, school bags, and womens’ clothing. With this loan, she will buy more of these items at wholesale to add to her business.

(Also included in the right of the photo is Zainab Bangura, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: To buy shoes, school bags, and womens’ clothing at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda is a 28-year-old single mother of two children renting a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in a retail shop for the last two years. She started with a capital of 200,000 shillings and increased to 700,000 shillings. Her hardship is low sales as a result of power shortages and her vision is to buy a generator and build a house. Brenda needs the loan to buy bread, soda and salt.

loans.use: to buy bread, soda and salt to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Khem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 14 people who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes that can improve their families' standard of living. Mrs. Khem is the village bank president, who has been selected by the other members. 

She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where she can grow rice. She sells some part of the rice and rest of the rice she uses to support her family. 

Her husband, Mr. Sarun, is a construction worker and a farming laborer. Through this activity, they support two children who are attending local public school. 

In the rice field, she has a problem because her field is infertile soil. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Khem is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed and pesticide.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed and pesticide

loans.name: Magali

texts.es: Magali tiene 42 años, es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. Magali comienza su negocio de venta de cosméticos visitando a sus clientes, es una vendedora muy persistente y convincente, disfruta de hablar con ellos y aconsejarles sobre lo que mejor le quedará a su rostro, su negocio es muy rentable ya que cuenta con una amplia cartera de clientes. Considera que lo más difícil del negocio es cobrar, por la venta de sus productos, ya que no siempre sus clientes tienen plata para pagarle, pero con los 5 años de experiencia que tiene, se las arregla para que le paguen completito todas sus ventas, ella quiere poner su puesto de ventas de cosméticos, donde pueda vender mas cómoda y sin la necesidad de ir casa por casa. Con su primer préstamo, Magali quiere hacer crecer su negocio, es por eso que desea pagar a tiempo todas sus cuotas para poder acceder a otro préstamo, además sabe que cuenta con el apoyo de su banco comunal. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos de belleza, para tener más productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Magali is 42 years old, and is a humble and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home and is willing to work very hard to succeed in life.  

Magali began her business selling cosmetics by visiting her customers.  She is a very persistent and persuasive saleswoman.  She enjoys talking with her customers and advising them on the best products for their face.  Her business is very profitable because she has a broad range of customers.  She thinks the most difficult thing about her business is charging for the sale of her products, because her customers don't always have the money to pay her.  With five years of experience, she manages to be paid in full for all of her sales.  She wants to have a store to sell cosmetics, where she can sell more comfortably and without the need to go from house to house.

With her first loan, Magali wants to grow her business, so she wants to make all of her payments on time so that she can take another loan.  She also knows that she has the support of her community bank.

With the 500 nuevos soles she is requesting, she will purchase more beauty products so that she will have more products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics to meet her customer demand.

loans.name: Jose Eradio

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 65 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y dos hijos en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

José se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores, específicamente ganado ovino y caprino, en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio. El los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. 

El desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

José es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José, 65, is a father living with his wife and two children in Olmos District, a farming area with significant commercial activity located in Lambayeque Province over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

José raises small farm animals, specifically sheep and goats, in some corrals located near his home.  He feeds them grains and natural grasses and when they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants that tend to visit the area where he lives.

He wants to acquire more animals and nutritionally balanced feed to expand his business and earn higher income.  Because of this he’s thought it convenient to request a 1200 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa that will help him reach this goal.

José is quite a dedicated, hard working person.  His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessman to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals to raise and to buy nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es:
Nery tiene 30 años de edad. Ella es joven y vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos en su casa propia. Ellos residen en la ciudad de Urubamba que pertenece al departamento de Cusco al sur del Perú. Su casa está ubicada cerca de la plaza de armas del distrito.

Nery se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir en el Centro Comercial de Señor de Torrechayoc en la ciudad de Urubamba. Para poder desarrollar su actividad, Nery ha alquilado un puesto de venta en el centro comercial. 

Nery tiene muchos clientes y cuenta con la fidelidad de muchos de ellos, su negocio es muy conocido a solo cuatro años de su creación. Ella cuenta con una muy buena ubicación estratégica para la venta ya que se encuentra ubicada en el centro de la cuidad.

Nery es cliente conocida de la Asociación Arariwa ya que recibió varios créditos y los pagó con responsabilidad. Ahora ella está solicitando un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 para que de esta manera Nery pueda comprar y surtir con mas mercadería, implementar e innovar su negocio con novedades en prendas de vestir y obsequios según la estación.

Nery tiene un espíritu emprendedor, ella quiere que sus inventarios y su negocio crezcan. Pues ella desea ser una empresaria de éxito pues cuenta con muchas cualidades de las que resaltan su puntualidad y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Nery is 30 years old.  She is a young woman who lives with her partner and two children in her own home.  They live in the city of Urubamba, in Cusco department, in the south of Peru.  Her home is located near the district's main square.

Nery sells clothes in the Señor de Torrechayoc shopping mall in the city of Urubamba.  In order to carry out her business, Nery has rented a sales location in the shopping mall.

Nery has many customers and many of them are loyal to her business.  Her business is very well known even though it has only been around for four years.  She has a very good, strategic sales location since she her business is located in the city center.

Nery is a well-known client of Asociación Arariwa since she has already received several loans and repaid them responsibly.  She is now requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy more merchandise for her business.  She will stock and innovate her business with new clothes and gifts according to the season.

Nery has an entrepreneurial spirit.  She would like her stock and business to grow.  She would like to become a successful businesswoman.  She has many good qualities.  In particular, she is punctual and responsible.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Nan

texts.en: Nan, 53, resides in Kampot province, Cambodia, an area known for fresh seafood. Nan and her husband are farmers, earning an income of 2.5 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 75 USD on food and 40 USD on the other necessary expenses. Nan is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase a car to provide transportation service. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. Nan appears in the photograph with her family in the field.

loans.use: to buy a car to provide transportation services

loans.name: Edreda

texts.en: Edreda, 35, is a married woman with two children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the poultry business for ten years, and with the income generated, she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Her hardship is limited capital to meet the increasing demand of her customers and her vision is to increase on her poultry projected to at least 2,000 birds, as well as educate her children. Edreda needs the loan to buy chicks and feed for her poultry farm.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed

loans.name: Rahmattilo

texts.ru: Рахматтило житель Шахритуского района. Ему 54 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он вместе с семьей занимается растениеводством. При доме у него имеется большой участок земли, где он выращивает овощи и дыню. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже 21 год. Кредит берет для покупки минеральных удобрений, топлива и семян арбуза.  Сейчас сезон посева арбуза. Поэтому Рахматтило берет кредит, чтобы посеять и получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en: Rahmattilo lives in the Shahrituz region. He's fifty-four years of age, married and has three children. They own a large plot of land adjacent to their home, where they have grown vegetables and melons for the past twenty-one years. He's asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers, fuel and watermelon seeds. It's watermelon planting season, so Rahmattilo is requesting a loan in order to plant and receive a good harvest fro sale.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers, fuel and watermelon seeds

loans.name: Hir

texts.en:
Hir is a 55-year-old widow from the village of Naora in northern Israel. Hir and her husband had a successful animal raising business and she sold cheeses and dairy products. Her products had an excellent reputation and were purchased by clients from her village and the region. Unfortunately, after her husband passed away Hir sold the business with the animals. Last year she decided to begin selling her dairy products again but she had to purchase the milk from others. With the help of her family, Hir has reentered the business of raising sheep and making specialty cheeses, labane and yogurt.

Hir needed this loan to purchase sheep and lambs, prepare her barn and purchase equipment.

In the future, Hir wishes to further expand and purchase modern milking and cheese making equipment.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and lambs, prepare her barn and purchase equipment.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Silvina quién invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Ellas son muy conocidas en el barrio por ser unidas y trabajadoras. Se encuentran actualmente con 12 miembros.
La Sra. Silvina está casada hace 11 años con el señor Adalberto quien trabaja como chofer de una linea de transporte, tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad. Ella tiene una despensa por medio del cual puede ayudar a su marido con los gastos de la casa. Comenta que ya tiene una buena clientela, ya que su vecinos y las personas de loas barrios aledaños vienen a comprar de ella.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, leche, hortalizas, bebidas y demás para el abastecimiento de su establecimiento. Ella tiene como meta ampliar su despensa y  surtir mas sus mercaderias logrando aumentar sus ingresos dentro de su familia,
texts.en:
The contact who started this current committee was Silvina who invited and organized her friends to join the Committee of Entrepreneurial Women's Program.  These ladies are very well known in their neighborhood for being united and hard working.  The group currently has 12 members.

Silvana has been married to Adalberto for 11 years.  He works as a driver for a transport company.  The couple have four grown-up children.  Silvina has a grocery store which enables her to help her husband with their household expenses.  She says that she already has a good customer base since both her neighbors and people from neighboring areas come to buy from her.

Silvana is requesting this loan to buy meat, milk, vegetables, drinks and other products with which to stock her establishment.  Her goal is to expand her grocery store and stock it with more merchandise so that she can increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy milk, meat, vegetables and drinks to stock her store

loans.name: Makki

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has two children.

Makki has been an owner of a store since 2008, selling women and kid's clothing, cosmetics and tissues. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, doors, and floor and to purchase additional inventories. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, doors, and floor and to purchase additional inventories.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es: La señora Vanessa trabaja en una tienda donde venden fotocopiadoras y su esposo es chofer de transporte de pasajeros. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora ya que la señora se encuentra estudiando ensamblaje de computadoras. Vive en casa de sus padres  ubicada en la zona 16 de febrero en la ciudad de El Alto. Vanesa es casada y no tiene hijos. Vanesa ya obtuvo dos créditos anteriores a través de Kiva y se encuentra muy satisfecha con la relación existente.
texts.en: Vanessa works in a store where they sell photocopiers and her husband’s a driver providing passenger transportation services.  She needs the loan to buy a computer because she’s currently studying computer assembly.  She lives in her parents’ house located in the city of El Alto’s 16 de Febrero zone.  She’s married and has no children.  Vanessa got two previous loans through Kiva and she is very satisfied with the current relationship.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.es:
Ivonne es una mujer que sabe mucho D. restauración y D. artesanías y para ella es un deleite trabajar y ofrecer sus servicios como educadora D. las técnicas que conoce, porque es su potencial innato. Si usted llega a la casa D. Ivonne, además D. su amabilidad encuentra un taller D. cerámica donD. produce todo tipo D. adornos al frio, al calor, ofrece servicios D. horneado, trabaja figuras D. yeso, cuadros esculturas D. madera, restaura toda clase D. artículos que la gente aprecia y que cree haber perdido y como si fuera poco está siempre dispuesta a enseñar para que esta tradición creativa D. la que Dios la dotó, continúe en la sociedad. Ella es una mujer apoyada siempre por su familia, feliz y autodidacta que trabaja porque le gusta lo que hace y con ello obtiene inmensa satisfacción personal, para ella su trabajo es inigualable, le ayuda a recobrar la calma cuando está estresada y le permite su genial expresión artística.
Ivonne tiene 5 años D. estar vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que la ha apoyado logrando aumentar sus habilidades administrativa y con ello el incremento D. sus ventas y  D. utilidades. Su sueño más adelante es formalizar la escuela D. artesanos para jóvenes. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva mediante el cual logrará invertir en materias primas, pues se propone elaborar manualidades en cerámica y ponerle su buena energía y todo su potencial creativo con lo cual siempre realiza su trabajo.
texts.en:
Ivonne is a woman who is very knowledgeable about restoration and crafts. She takes delight in her work and offers her services as a teacher, sharing her techniques with others, because it is part of her innate being. When visiting Ivonne’s home, in addition to being welcomed with kindness, one would find a ceramics workshop where she produces all types of decorations maD. by using cold and heat. She also offers the services of her kiln. Ivonne also produces plaster figurines, paintings, and wood sculptures. She restores all types of artifacts that people appreciate, but believe have been lost.

Ivonne is always willing to teach because she believes this creative tradition is a gift from God so that society can continue. She is a woman who has always been supported by her family. Since she is happy and self-taught, Ivonne enjoys her work and receives immense personal satisfaction. For her, there is no other type of work because it helps her to remain calm in times of stress and provides her an outlet for artistic expression.

Five years ago she joined Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization that has helped Ivonne improve her management skills so that she can increase her sales and her profits. Her dream going forward is to establish an art school for young people. At the moment, she is applying for a Kiva loan so that she can invest in raw materials for making ceramic handicrafts. Ivonne always has a good energy level and all the creative potential to pour into her work.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making ceramic handicrafts.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda's group is comprised of hard working women. Brenda is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Brenda has been working hard to manage her small retail business which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Brenda has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase supplies,  like sugar, and will help Brenda to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Brenda hopes that in the future she will be able to become a doctor. 

Brenda is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.
