María se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, es comerciante ambulante por lo que vende recorriendo en su barrio, también vende su mercadería en la ciudad de Machala y aprovecha para realizar la compra de más mercadería, realiza esta actividad desde hace 4 años, se encuentra en su sexto ciclo y nos comenta que los prestamos le están beneficiando en el crecimiento de su negocio, tiene una bonita amistad con todas las socias del banco comunal y se caracteriza por ser una persona muy carismática, con el préstamo que la fundación le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercadería, su meta es de comprarse un carro para poder viajar para traer su mercadería.
texts.en:
The community bank "El Despertar" (The Awakening) was started in the city of Cuenca, which was baptized and founded as Santa Ana de los Ríos de Cuenca by the Spanish conquistadors. It is known for the 4 rivers that surround it and its historic city center. The temperature ranges from 14ºC to 18ºC (57ºF and 64ºF). The group's members, like all citizens of Cuenca, are very warm and friendly to locals and visitors alike. María S. is a member of El Despertar community bank. She lives in the large city of Cuenca in the Indurama sector. María is 27 years old and is a native of Machala city. She is married; her husband works as a driver. They have an 11-year old son who attends the Liceo Americano (American high school). María sells clothing as a street vendor in her neighborhood. She also sells her merchandise in Machala, where she often purchases additional inventory. María has done this work for 4 years. She is in her 6th loan cycle and says that the loans are helping the growth of her business. She has a good friendship with all the members of her community bank and is known to be a very charismatic person. With this loan she will invest in the purchase of additional merchandise. Her goal is to buy a car to be able to travel further to sell her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pants, t-shirts, blouses, children's clothing, etc.

loans.name: Giannina Mariela

texts.en:
Giannina is a client of Asociación Arariwa. She is member of a communal bank consisting of 22 members in Cusco. The group is called Fuente de Vida ("source of life" in Spanish).

Giannina is 26 years old, lives with her common-law husband, and is now pregnant with her first child. Giannina has been working with Arariwa for two years and her favorite aspect of Arariwa’s communal banking model is the savings component which is built into every loan--while making her monthly loan repayments, Giannina also pays an additional amount into her savings account. At the end of several loan cycles, these savings are returned to Giannina and the other communal bank clients, providing each of them with an additional source of capital to use to improve their business and quality of life.

Giannina’s business is buying and selling clothes, which she has been doing for the past 6 years. She buys her inventory in Lima, Arequipa and Cusco, and then sells the clothes in one of the main markets in Cusco. Giannina wants a loan to buy new lines of clothing to sell in her market stand and thereby grow her business.

Giannina appreciates Kiva lenders and thanks you for the loan. She promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Buy clothing to sell in market

loans.name: Lina Amely

texts.es:
Lina es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Lina es soltera, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Lina vende materiales de construcción, cuenta con un local para almacén y sus ventas los realiza a domicilio, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su papá.
Lina necesita un préstamo de 1750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arena.
Lina sueña con aperturar una ferretería y tener una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Lina is a member of the Amor Divino communal bank. Lina is 27 years old, single, and has a son. She sells construction materials and has a space for a warehouse. She makes her sales door-to-door with the help of her father.

Lina needs a loan of 1750 PEN that she will invest in the purchase of sand. Lina dreams of opening a hardware store and having a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sand

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: FAtou S. est une femme de 53 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SIWAL depuis 2 ans et a été 4 fois bénéficiaires de crédit. Elle fait de l'élevage de moutons et du petit commerce. Son objectif est de participer la prise en charge de sa famille et le renforcement de son épargne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou S. is 53 years old, a widow and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of SIWAL for two years and obtained loans four times in the past. She raises sheep and does a bit of retail. Her goal is to support her family and to boost her savings.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increasing her investment capital

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est composé de quatre femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent le quartier Darsalam  de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles  se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage  et de leurs activités commerciales.
Ce groupe fait des activités diverses et variées. 
Après avoir correctement remboursés les cinq prêts précédents, elles  sont à leur 6ème  prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 16 pièces de pagnes wax,  20kg de « sarkatanè », 8 kg de « n’gueni », 8 verres de « magnon kissè horon », 24 flacons d’Eau de Cologne (mourouni et Alices), 40 petits flacons de parfum pour encens,1/2 douzaine de parfum, 2 sacs de sucre,1 sac de gingembre,1 sac de feuilles d’oseille de Guinée, 1sac de lait en poudre de 25kg, 1carton d’arôme, des bouteilles et des sachets  plastiques où mettre les boissons locales pour la vente.  
 Elles s’approvisionnent en pagnes wax à Bamako et à la foire hebdomadaire de Ségou pour les autres articles achetés. La vente des marchandises se fait généralement à domicile et en ambulant à travers les quartiers de Darsalam, Médine et à Hamdallaye, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle  composée d’hommes, de femmes et d’enfants.
 Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.750FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt de Soro Yiriwaso et satisfaire les petits besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is of four women married mostly in monogamous families. They have an average age of 37 and have on average four children. They live in Darsalam de Ségou (Fourth administrative region of Mali). They met each other through ties in the neighborhood and commercial activities. This group has diverse and varied activities. After having fully reimbursed their five previous loans, they are on their sixth group loan. It will be used to purchase 16 lengths of Wax brand pagnes [colorful West African fabric], 20 kg of sarkatanè, 8 kg of n’gueni, 8 glasses of magnon kissè horon, 24 bottles of perfume (Mourouni and Alices) [All ingredients for making incense], 40 small bottles of perfume for incense, half a dozen perfumes, 2 bags of sugar, 1 bag of ginger, 1 bag of hibiscus sabdariffa [bissap], one 25kg bag of powder milk, 1 box of flavoring, bottles and plastic bags to fill with local beverages for sale. They get their Wax brand pagnes in Bamako and the other items at the weekly fair in Ségou. The sale of merchandises is usually made from home and door-to-door through the neighborhood of Darsalam, Médine and in Hamdallaye. They sell for cash and on credit to customers who are men, women and children. They hope to make an average monthly profit of 37,750 Francs CFA, which will be used to reimburse their Soro Yiriwaso loan, and to fulfill small family needs.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Victor,  pertenece al banco comunal  “Los solidarios”, nuestro socio está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba ubicada en el departamento de Cusco a 1 hora de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 25 años de edad, él socio es conviviente, Nuestro socio  tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, el socio es chofer el tiene un carro y presta servicio en la ruta Urubamba Ollantaytambo Cusco; Nuestro socio trabaja arduamente para sacar adelante a su familia y darles una buena calidad de vida, nuestro socio solicita el préstamo en esta ocasión para costear el bautizo de su hijo, nuestro socio pagará los servicio de la iglesia, también agasajará a los invitados y le comprará un bonito terno a su hijo.  

Nuestro socio agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Victor is a member of the Los Solidarios Community Bank. He lives in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco, about one hour from the city of Cusco. He is 25 years old, married, and has a 2-year old son. Victor drives a vehicle providing service on the Urubamba-Ollantaytambo-Cusco route. He works hard to help his family get ahead in life and give them a good standard of living. Victor is asking for a loan to pay for the cost of having his son baptized. He will pay for the church service, a celebration for the guests, and buy his son a smart suit. He is grateful for this opportunity to obtain a loan and promises to make the repayments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for the baptism of his young son

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is 37 years old, married to Nicholas Waweru, and they have six children who all go to school. She works as a tailor and has been running her tailoring shop in Naivasha town for the last eight years. She specializes in making new clothes for sale by order, but she can also repair torn clothes for her clients at a small fee.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her second loan from the institution. She had earlier applied for a loan of Kshs 50,000 which she paid well and on time. She plans to buy more textile cloth which she will use to make new clothes for sale.

Her future dream is to continue in tailoring, enlarge her business, and move into a bigger place where she can employ other people to increase her clothes production.

loans.use: To buy textiles for making new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 36 years old and is married with three children who are 4, 9 and 11 years old. Chantal is known in the business of selling new clothes, mainly children’s clothes. She has been in this business for about a year and the hours of her business are from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day except Saturday.

Chantal is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through adding a variety of styles such as men’s and women’s clothes.

With this loan, Chantal has a vision of growing her business to the extent that she can even start wholesaling. If she starts wholesaling, she hopes to earn more profits than before which, in turn, will be used for further reinvestment in her business and enable her to continue building a better future for her family.

loans.use: To add a variety of styles such as men's and women's clothes

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis tiene 36 años de edad y es separado, tiene un hijo de diez años y vive junto a sus padres en el sector San Luis, una zona urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, ciudad bastante conocida en el norte del país por su movimiento comercial.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cuatro años a brindar servicio de transporte público dentro de la ciudad de Chiclayo y alrededores en un auto Tico propio que utiliza como taxi. Esta actividad es la unica fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta y gracias a ella puede solventar sus gastos personales, ayudar a su hijo y colaborar con la economía familiar.

Jorge Luis se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1300 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el empadronamiento de su unidad y otros trámites necesarios para renovar las licencias de funcionamiento que le permitan circular libremente por la ciudad dentro de la legalidad correspondiente, brindando un servicio seguro, de calidad y que no se vea interrumpido por operativos de control.

Jose Luis es un hombre trabajador que dedica la mayor parte del día a brindar su servicio, su mayor anhelo es salir adelante y poner un negocio más estable con el cual percibir mayores ingresos que le permitan brindar una mejor calidad de vida a las personas que quiere. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 36 years old and separated; he has one 10 year old son and lives with his parents in the San Luis area-close to the city of Chiclayo, a city well-known in the north for its business industry.

For more than 4 years, he has had a car that he uses as a taxi for public transport in the city of Chiclayo and surrounding areas. This is his only source of income and thanks to it, he has been able to meet his personal expenses and help his son as well as helping meet the household expenses.

Jorge Luis is asking for a loan of 1300 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva’s field partner) that he will use to pay taxes and other necessary procedures to renew his working license and be able to move around the city legally. By making the necessary paperwork, he will be able to give reliable and quality service so that his work won’t be interrupted by inspector officials.

Jose Luis is a hardworking man that spends most of his days working, his biggest wish is to get ahead and to have a more stable job so that he can have more income that will allow him a better quality of life for the people that he loves. He has worked with our institution before and has shown to be punctual and responsible when making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To renew licenses that will allow him to work legally.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara is married with children. Her husband is a businessman dealing in spare parts. All her children go to school and she resides in her own house where she stays with additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, medication and school fees. Hajara deals in bananas in Kalerwe markets in one of the city suburbs. She sells to all categories of people at both retail and wholesale. Hajara has been in this business for a long time. Besides banana selling, she also owns a boda boda (motorcycle) which brings in additional income on a daily basis. Hajara also owns rental houses. She has been with MCDT for a long time and has received many loans from MCDT, She wants to use this loan of 1,000,000/= to buy more bunches of bananas. She works six days a week. Business challenges include defaulters and thieves. Hajara aspires to see her business increase, to educate her children and improve her standard of living. She joined MCDT to generate capital for her businesses.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy S. is from the village of Matugas Bajo. She is 49 years old, is married, and has one adult child. Daisy owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-one years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month. In 2008, Daisy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Virginita

texts.en:
Virginita D. C., 45, is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has a 17 year-old child. To make a living, Virginita plants, harvests and sells rice. 

Virginita joined CEVI to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Virginita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI of 10000 PHP to purchase fertilizers. This loan will be her fourth from CEVI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

-------------------------------------
About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sandra Auxiliadora

texts.es:
la sra. Sandra Auxiliadora S. se dedica a la venta de joyería de plata, Sandra tiene más de 2 años de realizar esta actividad económica.  Es una persona muy conocida en el lugar por su espíritu de superación, solvencia moral y de buena conducta, se ha sabido ganar la clientela lo que le  ha generado mayor demanda de su producto ya que las ventas las realiza de contado y al crédito generándole de esta forma clientela permanente en todo el año. A la vez Sandra Auxiliadora trabaja como impulsadora de Corporación Unimer y es pasante universitaria de la carrera de Pedagogía facilitándole vender sus productos a sus compañeras de trabajo y de la universidad.  
En la actualidad, no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir su negocio y así brindarle a sus clientes mas variedad de productos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas joyas de plata.
texts.en:
Sra. Sandra Auxiliadora S. has been selling silver jewelry for more than two years. She is well-known locally for her desire to succeed, her moral values, and the fine manner in which she conducts herself. Sandra has been able to attract customers because of increased demand for her products. Her sales are made for cash or on credit, which helps her maintain a steady flow of customers through the entire year. At one point, Sandra worked as a sales representative for the Unimer Corporation while she was studying for her degree in Education. She sold their products to her co-workers and classmates.

At the moment, she does not have sufficient operating capital to restock her business and provide her customers a wide variety of products. This loan will be used to buy more silver jewelry.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rings, chains, bracelets, necklaces, and earrings

loans.name: Gina

texts.es: Gina, de 27 años, está felizmente casada con Elmore de 29 años, con quien tiene 2 hermosos hijos, que son su razón de vivir, ellos viven en su casa propia. Muy orgullosa, cuenta que le falta poco para terminar de construir su vivienda, gracias al esfuerzo conjunto de ella y de su esposo. Ella se dedica a la repostería, actividad por el cual desarrollo como sustento económico. Es así que prepara pasteles, tortas, bocaditos, galletas, de acuerdo la al pedido que le hacen. Disfruta mucho lo hace, amasando y dando forma a sus deliciosos postres que son del gusto de la mayoría de sus clientes. Paralelo a esta actividad, también cría aves de corral, por otro lado su esposo labora en una empresa privada en Lima, por lo que se hace responsable de los gastos fuertes de la casa. Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar cabinas y ofrecer servicio de Internet, por considerarlo muy rentable. Esta es su sexto crédito con MFP y  se muestra muy satisfecha y orgullosa de laborar en su grupo comunal, porque ya conoce la metodología de trabajo que practica su grupo. Esta mujer emprendedora, con el dinero que solicita, comprará los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de bocaditos y tortas.
texts.en:
Gina, 27 years old, is happily married to Elmore, 29 years old, with whom she has 2 beautiful children that are her reason for living. They live in their own home. Very proudly, she tells us that they require little to finish constructing their home, thanks to her and her husband’s shared effort. She works in pastry making, which has developed to be an economic support. Thus she prepares cakes, pies, cookies, and sweets, according to the orders that she makes. She really enjoys this work, mixing and forming her delicious desserts that are tasty to the majority of her customers. Along with this job, she also raises farmyard birds. As for her husband, he works in a private company in Lima and is responsible for the major costs of their house. In the future, he has plans to install booths and offer internet services, which they consider to be very profitable. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she is very satisfied and proud to work with her communal group, because she already knows the working methodology that her group uses. This businesswoman, with the money that she requests, will buy consumables necessary to make cakes and cookies.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase consumables to make cakes and cookies

loans.name: Caroline Akinyi

texts.en:
Caroline Akinyi W., who has been a housewife for a considerable duration of time, testifies how, at times, life can be hard with only the husband being the breadwinner. For this reason, she started selling cereals in Nambale, Busia, in 2007, to earn income and become economically independent. She often purchases her inventory on weekly basis from Busia, and, with the profit earned, she has been able to support her husband in taking care of the family's needs.

She would wish to expand her business and be able to buy a pick-up to help in transporting her farm supplies, and having heard about KIVA/KMET loans, she decided to apply for Ksh.10,000 to boost her business. She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of two children, and lives in Nambale.

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Monsieur Chiekh F. es un jeune qui s'active dans l'élevage de poulets de chairs dans la localité de Sandiara Mr F. posséde un grand poulaillé qui peut abriter prés de 500 poussins .Pour les besoins de la fête de korité qui correspond à la fin du Ramadan (le jeûn)Cheikh F. sollicite un crédit pour renforcer ses sujets pour faire face à une éventuelle demande de sa clientèle et des villages environnant. C'est grace à ce poulaillé que Mr F. fait vivre sa famille et s'occuper  de ses enfants
texts.en:
Mr. Cheikh F. is a young man active in the chicken farming business in Sandiara. Mr. F. has a large chicken coop that can contain up to 500 chicks. When considering the impact of the Korite festivities (which corresponds to the ending of Ramadan), young Cheikh F. is requesting a loan to bolster his number of chickens to meet a potential increase in demand from his customers and from neighbouring villages. This chicken coop is what enables Mr. F. to feed his family and take care of his children.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: poultry farming

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria O. is a 52-year old widow who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  Vegetable Vending and Videoke  businesses. She lives in Prk. Pag-asa, Brgy 1 Poblacion, Roxas, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her Vegetable Vending and Videoke  businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 20800 each month. Gloria is now borrowing PHP 29500 so that she  could  purchase more vegetables to sell.   This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29500, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Gloria aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the  Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: José

texts.es:
El señor Jose es casado vive con su esposa y sus hijos de 1 y 3 años de edad en casa  de sus padres en la zona Pasankeri sur de la ciudad de La Paz
El señor Jose trabaja como empleado de limpieza en una entidad privada y su esposa trabaja como vendedora de perfumes, de está manera obtiene ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de un lote de terreno en la ciudad de EL Alto y así tener un lugar donde vivir.
Es su primer crédito con IMPRO y el análisis socioeconómico realizado le califica favorablemente para acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Jose is married and lives with his wife and children, ages 1 and 3, in his parents' home in the Pasankeri zone, south of the city of La Paz. Jose works as a member of the cleaning staff of a private company and his wife works as a perfume salesperson. This is how they obtain an income for their household. The requested loan is for the purchase of a plot of land in the city of El Alto, which will provide them with a place to live. This is his first loan with IMPRO and the socioeconomic analysis for receiving a loan graded him favourably.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of land

loans.name: Hasifah

texts.en:
Hasifah N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has three children.  One of her children is currently in school. Hasifah has a business in a food market, which she has had for one year. Hasifah also sells charcoal.

To help expand her business Hasifah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food and charcoal. With the help of the loan from BRAC Hasifah hopes to generate greater profits and buy more food. In the future Hasifah hopes to own another business, like a retail shop. Hasifah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by increasing the number of items for sale in her business.

loans.use: To buy matooke and charcoal

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita C. is from the village of Centro Napo Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years-old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Conchita owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing beauty parlor services such as haircuts, manicures and pedicures in the local community. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Conchita joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Conchita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to to expand services provided.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana A. is 58 years old, married and has twelve school-aged children. She is from the village of Ricoro, a part of Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Juliana runs a store from which she sells a variety of fruits such as mangoes, apple, and pineapple to the local community. She has been in business for over thirty years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Juliana joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional fruits to buy and sell. Juliana is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat lives in Gujranwala which is an industrial city in Pakistan. She lives in a two room brick house in the area named Khiyali Bypass with her family. She came there after her marriage many years ago. She has given birth to three sons who left their education incomplete and now do their own businesses. Nusrat is married to N. M., who is 50 years old and operates an onion selling business. He puts onions on a cart and visits different streets of the city to sell them. He has been doing this business for over 10 years, and people know him very well as a person who provides quality onions to them at cheap prices. 

Nusrat supports her family by doing stitching and embroidery work. She has a good number of clients in her neighborhood and she receives a good number of orders every month. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her business of stitching clothes. She will invest the loan in purchasing a new stitching machine that will help her finishing her orders on time and to work more efficiently. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes the loan will bring good profits to her by improving her business.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 69 años D. edad. Es casada y vive junto a su esposo en el sector La Aviación del distrito D. Cayaltí, una zona agrícola D. movimiento comercial considerable que se encuentra situada a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace mas D. veinte años a la crianza D. ovejas. Ella los cría a campo abierto, en un terreno que posee, cuando estas han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes D. la zona y eventualmente a los vecinos y pobladores del distrito.

Ella desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda con las cuales pueda mejorar su calidad D. vida, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Jesús es una persona activa y bastante responsable. Siempre gusta D. sentirse activa y apoyar a quienes le necesiten.
texts.en:
Jesús is 69 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband in La Aviación sector of Cayaltí district, a farming area with considerable commercial activity, which is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Jesús has been raising sheep for more than twenty years.  She raises them in the open field on a plot of land which she owns.  When they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to traders in the area and eventually to the neighbors and residents of her district.

She would like to carry out some improvements on her home in order to improve her quality of life.  For this reason she is requesting a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Jesús is an active and quite responsible person.  She always likes to feel active and support those who need it.

loans.use: To improve her house

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María de 55 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra.  

Ella vivía en Manabí pero para tener mejores ingresos se mudo a Guayaquil ya que es una de las ciudades del ecuador más comerciales del Ecuador. Con esfuerzo se mudo y ubico la su tienda en la parte delantera de su actual casa. Trabaja desde las 07h00am vendiendo arroz, azúcar, aceites a un bajo costo ya que compra al por mayor los productos. 

Para seguir con la tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, azúcar, aceite para su préstamo. Una de sus metas para cumplir es construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
María, 55, has a grocery store in the front part of her house.  She lives in a periurban area in El Fortín de Guayaquil, notable because of its unpaved streets.

She used to live in Manabí but in order to have better income she moved to Guayaquil because it’s one of Ecuador’s most commercial cities.  With effort she moved and set up her store in the front part of her current house.  She works from 7am selling rice, sugar, oils at low cost because she buys the products at wholesale.

To continue in business she needs a loan to buy rice, sugar and oil.  One of her pending goals is to build her house better.

loans.use: For rice, sugar, oil.

loans.name: Edelina

texts.en:
Edelina G. is from the village of Minaog. She is 60 years old, married, and has 5 adult children. Edelina operates a family member's business in the services sector, offering tailoring services in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Edelina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Edelina is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed for tailoring. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Edelina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials

loans.name: Maribeth's Group

texts.en:
Maribeth C. is from the village of Manla Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Maribeth is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Marigold 2.

Maribeth is married and has 2 school-aged children. She owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Maribeth has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Maribeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribeth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Maribeth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Loreta Napuecas' Group

texts.en:
Loreta N. is from the Barangay of Catadman, Ozamiz City. She is 44 years old, married and has two adult children. Loreta is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

To make a living, Loreta sells a variety of different herbal medicinal products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2006, Loreta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,600 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional herbal products to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Loreta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for her future emergencies.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Northwestern Mindanao. It reaches the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for Herbal Medicine

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina tiene 31 años de edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. Guillermina y su esposo Alberto tienen un pequeño taller de fabricación de muebles de madera. Su esposo es el que fabrica los muebles de madera y Guillermina le da el acabado a los muebles ósea pule, pinta y saca brillo. Ellos venden sus productos los sábados al lado del populoso mercado “El Molino”. Ya son 6 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Guillermina requiere el préstamo para comprar madera de tipo caoba, corriente y otras.
 
Guillermina pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 31 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, in the department of Cusco, in Peru. Guillermina and her husband Alberto have a small workshop where they make wooden furniture. Her husband is the one who makes the furniture out of wood, and Guillermina puts finishes on the furniture, that is, she polishes it, paints it, and makes it shine. They sell their products on Saturdays alongside the popular "El Molino" market. They have already worked at this business for six years, and it is going very well for them. Guillermina needs the loan to buy wood such as caoba (mahogany), softwoods, and other types.

Guillermina belongs to the community bank "Hijas de Maria" (Daughters of Mary) of Asociación Arariwa, in Cusco, Peru. The community bank is in its third year, and it's going very well for all the members.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: María

texts.es: María, de 46 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Desde muy pequeña siempre le enseñaron a María a trabajar en todo para alcanzar sus metas, ahora se dedica a la venta de alfalfa y cuyes, los cuales ella misma cultiva y cría respectivamente. Paralelamente trabaja junto a su hermana en la elaboración de quesos y manjar, productos que son vendidos en la ciudad de Lima. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es criar sus cuyes y lo hace con mucho amor, lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que viajar constantemente a la ciudad de Lima, por los pedidos de manjar y queso que tiene. Con el tiempo, espera que su negocio siga creciendo  y que le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos. Este es el décimo segundo crédito con MFP, está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no desea meter en problemas a su banco comunal, en donde es muy solidaria con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los dos mil ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más comida para sus cuyes, ya que es la actividad que mejores ingresos le está generando.
texts.en:
46 year-old María is a very simple and cheerful woman.  She lives in her own home and what she most desires is to improve her quality of life.

Since she was a little girl, María has been taught to work hard at everything in order to achieve her goals.  Her business is selling alfalfa and guinea pigs that she grows and raises herself.  In parallel with this, she also works together with her sister making cheese and 'manjar' (a sweetened condensed milk product).  They sell these products in the city of Lima.

What Maria most likes about her work is raising her guinea pigs and she does this with a lot of love.  She has been in this business for 16 years and she considers that the most difficult part of her work is having to constantly travel to Lima with her 'manjar' and cheese orders.  Over time, María hopes that her business will continue to grow and that it will make her better profits.

This is María's 12th loan with MFP and she is ready to make all her repayments on time since she doesn't want to make difficulties for her community bank.  María is very supportive of the other members of her bank.  She will use the 2,800 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy more feed for her guinea pigs since this is the business that is making her the best profits.

loans.use: To buy alfalfa and other feed for her guinea pigs

loans.name: Nelson Jose

texts.es: Desempeñándose como Maestro de Primaria desde el año 1,985  es soltero viaja de león a su centro de trabajo diario, este señor ha obtenido 2 financiamientos con la empresa bajo el convenio firmado con dicho colegio, ya que los financiamientos les han ayudado a mejorar su situación y nivel de vida, ya que la necesidad actual es un tratamiento Médico y Mejoramiento de la vivienda antes que entre el invierno.
texts.en: He has been working as an elementary school teacher since 1985.  He is single and travels from León to his workplace for his daily job.  This gentleman has received 2 loans with the company under the agreement signed with his school.  The loans have helped him to improve his situation and standard of living.  His current need is to have medical treatment and improve his home before the winter comes.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses (examinations, consultations, medicines) and to improve his home (buying metal sheets, beams, cement and sand)

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita D. is from Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old, married and has four adult children. To make a living, she sells ready-to-wear clothing, primarily to her neighbors and friends. She has been engaged in this business for six years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living standard of her family. 



About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Felisa works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure/pedicure (services) business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from frozen foods.  Felisa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy various kinds of cosmetics for her manicure/pedicure (services) business.

Felisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dreams of sending her kids to school and having savings for her family.

loans.use: to prchase cosmetics for her manicure/pedicure business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 37 años es una excelente madre soltera que con mucho amor y dedicación cuida de sus dos hijas: Andrea y Jimena a las que cría en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Casacoto.  Desde hace 10 años comenzó a producir la tierra y vivir de ella. Sus principales cultivos constan de papa, habas y arveja, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero y cuidado, pues tiene que prevenir las inclemencias del tiempo; las que benefician o dañan sus sembríos dependiendo a la intensidad en la que se presentan, “cuando existen mucha lluvia o mucho calor perjudica la cosecha”, afirma. Paralelo a su trabajo se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, los cuales vende en un espacio que acondicionó en su casa, donde está pensando vender gasolina y petróleo a los transportistas que llegan a su localidad, donde está segura que podrá obtener buenas ganancias, ya que el caserío donde vive es muy lejano y no existe grifos que proporcionen combustible. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sembradoras de Casacoto”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente apoyada por las integrantes de su banco comunal, que son personas solidarias y muy buenas. Gloria, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos variados para surtir su tienda de comestibles; los cuales comercializará a los pobladores de su localidad, asimismo comenzará con la compra de varios galones de gasolina para su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria is a 37-year old single mother who raises her two daughters, Andrea and Jimena, with love and dedication. She owns her house, located in the village of Casacoto. Ten years ago, Gloria started farming potatoes, beans and peas. She takes good care of her crops to prevent damage from the weather. "Too much rain or sun damages the harvest," she confirms. 

Along with her farming, Gloria sells basic goods from a store space set up in her home. She is also thinking of selling gasoline and oil to travelers; she feels certain it will be profitable since the village is far from other locations that sell fuel. 

Gloria belongs to the “Sembradoras de Casacoto” community bank. This is her third loan with MFP and she feels well supported by the other bank members, who are good, supportive people. Gloria will invest the loan in a variety of products to stock her grocery store with, as well as in the purchase of a few gallons of gasoline for her new business venture.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and grocery store products.

loans.name: 041017 - Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Cầu P. Thị (59) is 51 years old and lives in the town of Hoằng hoá - Thanh hoá.  She leads a nine-person loan group affiliated with the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.The official name of this group is Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường ( Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường).

Cầu is married, has four grown children and makes a living by catching and selling fish. She has been in this business for 30 years and makes about 2,000,000 VND a month from her work. In 2002, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. Cầu has successfully repaid seven loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women and will use her portion of this one to buy fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue she earns to continue expanding her business.

About the other borrowers in this group:
1.  P. thị Lý (66) is a 50 year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to raise livestock.
2.  Lê Thị Kiểm (98) is a 49 year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.
3.  T. Thị Thanh (31) is a 29 year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.
4.  P. Thị Tư (58) is a 56 year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to raise livestock.
5.  Lê Thị Hược (33) is a 53 year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.
6.  N. Thị Hoà (47) is a 39 year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to run her general store.
7.  Lê Thị Vình (70) is a 58 year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to raise livestock.
8.  P. Thị Yên (57) is a 32 year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Cầu P. Thị (59) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoằng hoá - Thanh hoá.  Cầu là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 9 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 041017 - Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường (041017 - Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở biển trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Cầu thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 30 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Cầu kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND.  Vào 2002, Cầu đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Cầu đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5,000,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thuyền đánh cá.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  P. thị Lý (66) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Lê Thị Kiểm (98) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


3.  T. Thị Thanh (31) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


4.  P. Thị Tư (58) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Lê Thị Hược (33) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


6.  N. Thị Hoà (47) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


7.  Lê Thị Vình (70) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


8.  P. Thị Yên (57) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 26 years old and married with a one-year-old child. His wife, Agnes, is a secondary school teacher. Patrick supplies milk to customers using a motorbike.He intends to use the loan to increase his milk delivery supply by taking more orders and  enlarging his clientele. He has been in this business for six years.This is his third loan with KADET and he has successfuly  managed to repay the previous loans. Patrick will use the anticipated profits to increase his savings and buy another motorbike. He hopes to build a home for his family and also a vehicle for his milk-delivery business.

loans.use: To buy more milk for resale.

loans.name: Patricidra

texts.en:
Patricidra is a hardworking entrepreneur living in the Philippines. She is 49 years old and married with four school-aged children.

Patricidra sells cosmetics products such as lotion, make-up, powder and lipstick. With these activities, she usually generates PHP 6,000 a month. Most of her customers are her female neighbors. Patricidra has operated this business for almost seven years now. According to her, the business is of great assistance in supporting her family's needs. She is requesting PHP 24,000 to purchase more items to sell like lipstick, foundation and perfumes.

In the future, Patricidra would like to start another business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like lipstick, foundation and perfumes.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita vive en Atlacahualoya, en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 70 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 6 hijos todos son casados, ella tiene su tienda de abarrotes, ella solicito su crédito para comprar refrescos, sabritas, jabón, cloro, sal, cerillos, galletas, papel higiénico, huevo, azúcar para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, ella inicio su negocio hace 2 años con unos ahorros que junto de lo que le dieron sus hijos, su yerno le prestó unos anaqueles para exhibir la mercancía y ella compro un refrigerador para enfriar el refresco,  antes elaboraba las cazuelas las ollas y los jarros de barro porque vivía en San Marcos, ella cambio de recidencia porque su esposo y sus hijos se vinieron a trabajar a Atlacahualoya en el campo. Su negocio es importante porque aunque sea poquito va saliendo para algún imprevisto,porque ella tiene trabajo y se siente contenta atendiendo a sus clientes que son los vecinos y los visitantes o turistas, las ganancias la utiliza para volver a surtir su tienda. Ella está planeando sembrar maíz y cebolla en esta temporada de lluvia ya que a su esposo le gusta trabajar en el campo, a ella le gusta cuando ya tiene elotes y los asan para comer. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que toda su familia esté bien y vivir contentos. Atlacahualoya es un pueblo bonito hay campo donde se puede trabajar siembran la cebolla, el maíz y hay huertas de guajes verdes. Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamo por que si nos ayudan a crecer los negocios que se vean bonitos y a vivir mejor nuestras familias”.
texts.en:
Margarita lives in Atlacahualoya, in the State of Morelos, Mexico.  She is 70 years old, married, and has six children who are all married.

Margarita owns a grocery store.  She requested this loan to buy soft drinks, Sabrita-brand snacks, soap, bleach, salt, matches, cookies, toilet paper, eggs and sugar with which to stock her store.  She started her business two years ago with some savings which she added to some money her children gave her.  Her son-in-law lent her some shelves to display her merchandise and she bought a refrigerator to keep her soft drinks cold.

Margarita used to make casserole dishes, pots and pitchers from clay when she lived in San Marcos.  However, she moved because her husband and children came to work on the land in Atlacahualoya.  Margarita's business is important because, although it isn't much, she is prepared for any unforeseen circumstances as she has work.  She also feels happy serving her customers who are her neighbors, visitors and tourists.  She uses her profits to re-stock her store.

Margarita is planning to grow corn and onions during this rainy season since her husband enjoys working on the land and she likes it when there are ears of corn that she can grill and eat.  Her dreams and hopes are for her family to be well and live happily.

Atlacahualoya is a beautiful village with land where people work growing onions and corn.  There are market gardens full of green 'guajes' (a type of squash).  Margarita would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad "Thank you for the loan.  If you help us to grow our businesses, things go well and our families live better".

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, soap, bleach, salt, matches, sugar, cookies, Sabrita-brand snacks, etc. to stock her store

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 37 years old, and she has a nine-year-old child. Her child goes to school. Vestine sells used shoes and it’s her husband who introduced her to this business, and they work together. They have run this business together for the past three years. This business has enabled them to meet their needs and expand it as well. They have also managed to buy themselves a television set. 

Vestine is requesting a loan to buy more used shoes and make more profits because she wishes to buy a piece of land with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy used shoes for sale.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a 51-year-old single lady.  She runs a curio shop in Nyali, Mombasa. Her business has been in operation for the last seven years.
 
Purity has been a KADET client and this marks her second borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase khanga's,  sculptures and jewelry for her business.

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan.  Her  dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: purchase khanga’s, sculptures and jewelry

loans.name: Grupo Brisas 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Francisca belongs to the “Grupo Brisas 1 & 2” (Breezes 1 & 2 Group). The group is comprised of ten members. Each one of them works day to day at their business activities. The group is located to the north of the city of Santo Domingo.  They mostly sell clothes, footwear, accessories, cosmetics, food, and other miscellaneous products.

Francisca’s family is maD. up of her long-term partner and their three children. They live in a rented home, which is a simple structure maD. of wood. Her most difficult challenge has been always working to bring in extra income for her family and proviD. for her children's education. She enjoys working and she does this to help her children be able to get ahead, become professionals, get an education, and form their own families.

Francisa’s business is selling bacon and pork. She prepares the meat in order to sell it for a better price and to be able to save more. She has been engaged in this business activity for two and a half years. She tells us that she started thanks to motivation from some friends and some money that she was able to get together with her husband. Then she was able to apply for loans from Esperanza, and she was able to invest. Francisca has now had four loans with Esperanza Internacional. She will use this new loan to buy several pounds of bacon and pork.

Her story is being used to represent the other members of her group. Francisca and her group thank you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy pork to prepare and sell.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married and has two children.

Hussein has been an owner of a store for cooking and rental kitchen utensils since 2007; he has more than five years experiences in this field and has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to make two tents for his store and to buy more materials. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to make two tents for his store and to buy more materials.

loans.name: Jorge Eduardo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jorge Eduardo; el tiene 45 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura y también trabaja como docente del nivel secundario, en el negocio de agricultura el socio siembra maíz y después lo vende en forma ambulatoria en el mercado de Urubamba, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de agricultura y mejorar en su trabajo como docente del nivel secundario. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, fertilizantes y también para pagar el alquiler del tractor que necesitan para el negocio de agricultura.
                                              
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sr. Jorge Eduardo is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor Pasion” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

He is 45 years old, married, and has three children. Jorge Eduardo divides his time between his daily activities and his farming business. He also works as a high school teacher. In his farming business, Jorge Eduardo grows corn and then sells it as a street vendor at the market in Urubamba. He wants to expand and improve his farming business as well as improve in his job as a high school teacher. Jorge Eduardo is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and to pay for the rental of a tractor that he needs to use for his business.

He is happy with the loan and promised to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay for the rental of a tractor.

loans.name: Liliana Isabel

texts.es: Liliana de 44 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 12 a 20 años respectivamente. Allí se dedica a la venta de productos medicinales y naturales de diversos laboratorios. Su negocio empezó por su inquietud en la actividad de ventas, pero como tuvo tan buena acogida se entusiasmó y ahora sueña con aumentar su crecimiento y más adelante tener un local con la normatividad de la ley, para que sus hijos tengan una empresa de donde generar ingresos para terminar sus carreras universitarias. Su mayor desafío es la falta de capital de trabajo, para lograr el incremento en las ventas a la que ella aspira, pues con la creciente clientela se queda corta para comprar lo que sus clientes requieren. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará medicina natural al por mayor para que le hagan buenos descuentos y ofrecer precios mucho más competitivos, que le ayuden a su sostenibilidad en el mercado.
texts.en:
Liliana, 44, lives in the city of Barranquilla with her spouse and three children whose ages range from 12 to 20.  She sells natural and medicinal products from various laboratories.  Her business began because of her interest in sales and when she saw that she received a warm welcome she became excited and now dreams with increasing her growth and later on to have a store with all the legal requirements so that her children will have a firm where they can generate income to finish their university careers.  

Her greatest challenge is the lack of working capital to increase sales like she’d like to because she falls short of having sufficient funds to buy enough to meet demands of her growing clientele.  Her Kiva loan will be her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she’ll use it to buy natural medicine at wholesale so that she can qualify for good discounts and be able to offer much more competitive prices that will help her sustainability in the marketplace.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines at wholesale.

loans.name: Milton

texts.es: Milton, de 48 años, es un señor muy amable y trabajador, esta separado de su pareja, pero como ambos compraron una casa, viven juntos en ella y en compañía de sus hijos. EL trabajo de Milton consiste en la siembra y cosecha de cítricos durante, además de verduras, siendo éste último ejerciéndol por más de 25 años, mientras que los cítricos desde hace 10 años. El trabajo que realiza en sus tierras es buena, por ello es que tiene productos grandes y buenos y tiene mucha demanda por parte de sus compradores en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Le gusta la actividad que realiza, ama estar en el campo, estar en contacto con la naturaleza, pues él creció ahí y se a convertido en su fuente de desarrollo y económica. Sus clientes saben la calidad del producto que posee y le pagan el precio que él exige, pero ahora tiene un gran proyecto, le encantaría tecnificar sus plantaciones de cítricos, poner un sistema automático de riego y hacer un pozo tubular para que tenga así un mejor resultado. Este será el noveno crédito con MFP, pues considera que la institución es de gran ayuda para su inversión. Con el monto solicitado, lo utilizará para preparar su terreno con la compra de abono, fertilizante y contratar joranleros.
texts.en: Forty-eight-year-old Milton is a very kind and hardworking man.  He is separated from his partner, but as they bought a house together, they both live in it with their children.  Milton's work consists of planting and harvesting citrus fruits, as well as vegetables.  He has been growing the latter for more than 25 years, while he has been growing citrus fruits for 10 years.  He does good work on his land, which is why he produces large, good produce that is in high demand from his buyers in the city's wholesale market.  He likes his business and loves being in contact with nature in the fields as he grew up there and it has become his source of development and income.  His customers know the quality of his produce and they pay him what he asks, but at the moment he has a big project; he would love to introduce modern technology to his citrus planting by putting in an automatic irrigation system and digging a tubular well to produce better results.  This will be his ninth loan with MFP, as he considers the institution to be of great help with his investments.  He will use the requested total to prepare his land by buying fertilizers and to hire day laborers.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer and to hire day laborers

loans.name: Tuzamurane Muhinzi Group

texts.fr:
Daniel fait partie du groupe Tuzamurane/Muhinzi. Le nom du groupe signifie « Improve ourselves ». Il a 46 ans et il est marié avec 9 enfants de 4 à 22 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. 

Daniel est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser les semences sélectionnées afin de récolter beaucoup plus. Dans les prochaines années, Daniel voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz dans sa vallée. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Daniel is part of the Tuzamurane/Muhinzi group. The name of the group means "improve ourselves". He is 46 years old and married with nine children, whose ages range from four to 22 years old; four of the children are at school.

Daniel is a rice farmer. This is his second loan from ACB and he is going to use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming.

In order to grow his business, he is planning to use selected seeds so that he can harvest a lot more. In the years to come, Daniel would like to be among the best rice farmers in his valley. With the profits he makes he is planning to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming activity

loans.name: Pedro José

texts.es:
El señor Pedro José de profesión ingeniero civil, es soltero y actualmente posee su propio negocio de imprenta y fabricación de tinta el cual está situada en Masaya  desde hace 4 años.

El señor Pedro José se acercó a la oficina de Ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo en el que lo utilizará para la compra de una fotocopiadora, que la esta necesitando para cubrir la demanda de los clientes. Y poder incrementar más sus ingresos. Considera que también le  ayudará a tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señor Pedro José is a civil engineer by profession. He is single, and currently runs his own printing and ink business. He is based in Masaya and has been in business for 4 years. Señor Pedro José approached [the field partner] Ceprodel seeking a loan that he will use to buy a photocopier, which is necessary so that he can meet his customers' demands. It will mean he can increase his income, and he says that it will mean he can improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a photocopier and toner for printing

loans.name: Maria  Teresa

texts.es: La Sra. María  ya es una cliente distinguida por nuestra institución y ella renovó su crédito, por que uno de sus hijos necesita una cirugía de  emergencia, y van a pagar parte de los gastos del hospital, ella y su distinguido esposo decidieron acudir con nosotros para ver una pronta solución a la enfermedad de sus hijo, ya que  por  el  momento  no  cuentan con  el  capital  necesario  para   hacerle  frente  a  este  gasto, agradece  el apoyo  brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. María is a distinguished client of Credituyo. She is requesting another loan because one of her children is in need of emergency surgery and the money will be used to pay part of the hospital expenses. María and her husband decided to approach Credituyo because they needed a quick solution for their child’s illness.

At the moment, they do not have the necessary capital to deal with this expense. María is grateful for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: to pay for her child's hospital expenses.

loans.name: Johny

texts.es:
Ser reconocido como una persona responsable y trabajadora, así como brindarle una buena educación a sus hijos son los sueños de Johny, quien se dedica al transporte de materiales en su moto desde Rionegro a la Ceja, municipios del oriente de Antioquia, lo que le permite obtener sus propios ingresos. 

Actualmente este emprendedor de 33 años de edad, necesita de un préstamo para reparar su moto y así brindar un servicio más rápido y oportuno lo que se traducirá en mayores ingresos para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Johny's dreams are to be recognized as a responsible and hard-working person, and to provide his children with a good education.  Johny's business is transporting goods on his motorbike from Rionegro to La Ceja, towns in the east of Antioquia.  This allows him to make his own income.

This 33-year-old entrepreneur currently needs a loan to repair his motorcycle so that he can provide a faster and more timely service.  This will allow him to make more income for himself and his family.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Try Us Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you members of the “Try Us” group from Magburaka. They are small-business people who are based in Magburaka, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 500,000 SLL for each person to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Sulaiman. Sulaiman is age 51 and was born in Magburaka. He is married to a businesswoman and is the father of nine children, six of whom are in primary and secondary schools.  

Sulaiman sells a variety of items, including biscuits, batteries, mints, soaps, etc. He has been a businessman for 12 years now. He will use his share of the loan to buy the above-mentioned items in large quantities to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, batteries, mints, soaps, etc. in large quantities to add to his business.

loans.name: Fredy Suyapa

texts.es:
Fredy  Suyapa, tiene 33 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos de 2, 6, 12 y 14 años de edad, tres de ellos estudian, su esposo trabaja en una gasolinera de la ciudad, viven en un sector suburbano de San Pedro Sula.

La señora es muy trabajadora, tiene un local fijo en el mercado donde vende mercadería como ropa interior para damas, ropa de niño como pañales, camisas y blusas.  Trabaja las 8 horas del día, todos los días. 

Este negocio lo estableció hace un año, con el fin de generar más ingresos al hogar y cubrir todos los gastos. Es su primer préstamo y es para invertir en ropa interior para damas y niños. De esta manera va incrementar su inventario para vender más. Su plan es ampliar mas el negocio.
texts.en:
Fredy Suyapa, 33, is married and has four children who are 2, 6, 12 and 14 years old; three of them are in school.  Her husband works at a gas station in the city.  They live in a suburban zone in San Pedro Sula.

She is very hardworking.  She has a stationary stand in the market where she sells merchandise like women’s underwear, children’s clothes like diapers, shirts and blouses.  She works 8 hours per day, every day.

She opened the business a year ago aiming at generating more income for her household and to cover all expenses.  This is her first loan and it will be used to buy women’s and children’s underwear so that she can increase her inventory and sell more.  Her plan is to expand the business more.

loans.use: to buy women's underwear and children's clothes.

loans.name: Maota

texts.en:
Maota is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Taga. She is married and has 6 school-aged children.  To make a living, Maota raises cattle for sale.  Maota has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1120 WST a month.

In 2010, Maota joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Maota has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1500 WST from SPBD, used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell, and is now requesting a new loan of 1950 WST which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. The loan will be the third taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Maota plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Samon's Group

texts.en:
Samon is 42 years old, widowed and has five children, three of whom are working in Malaysia to complement the family’s income. She has struggled to earn a living in a rural area of the Ratanak Mondul district by planting maize as a primary income for more than 10 years.
